title: Developer
description:
Scania is currently undergoing an exciting transformation from a traditional truck manufacturer to a provider of complete sustainable transport solutions. IT is a crucial part of this transformation as Scania’s success is depending on flexible and efficient IT solutions that support current and future business requirements.
   

  

 Globalisation, digitalisation and mobility are examples of trends that are affecting our business environment. We are increasing our ability to make use of our information assets and utilize new technology. New possibilities enable us to share data with each other, apply machine learning and artificial intelligence.
   

  

 The work environment at Scania’s IT department is international and our employees are representing many different nationalities and countries. To this exciting and dynamic environment we are now looking for the following IT-professional.
   

  

**Your responsibility**
 You will join a DevOps team that, among other things, works with development and support for R&D. We work close to our customers and are involved in the entire system development process, from concept development to implementation and production. The team is responsible for projects and maintenance of current and future IT services that support Scania’s processes. You will play a central role in our DevOps team and will have many contacts around the Scania organisation. You will be involved in requirements, development, testing and release management. Together with the other teams, you will work in close cooperation with product and process owners on issues relating to functional guidelines – in both the short and long term.
   

  

**Your profile**
 We are currently looking for someone who is passionate about agile working methods, loves development and enjoys the challenge of getting people and technology to function as a team to achieve optimal results. You also see opportunities for personal development in a technology-intensive global company.
   

  

**Do you enjoy working in a sociable and friendly atmosphere, are you down-to-earth and do you like sharing your skills? Then this may be the ideal opportunity for you!**
 We are looking for an experienced DevOps engineer! Scania uses the Dassault System's application portfolio, prior experience of the platform is a prerequisite. You have good knowledge in GitLab/Jenkins/Perforce. Experience from network side is meritorious You need to be proficient in written and spoken English, since it’s our corporate language.
   

  

 We expect that you also have:
   

  

  

* 5+ years of experience of CATIA V5/ENOVIA/DELMIA/Dassault Systems platform.
* Good knowledge in CI/CD.
* Good knowledge of AIX system administration.
* Knowledge of Oracle databases.


**The location**
 Scania headquarter is located less than 40 km south of Stockholm city. It is easily accessible by regional train, commuter train, bus or car. Scania's own bus line, Scania Job Express, goes from Stockholm city directly to Scania in Sodertalje.
   

  

**We offer**
 In addition to exciting career and personnel development opportunities, we offer Scania employees a competitive salary and other benefits, such as a company car, performance bonuses, a pension plan, flexible working hours, lunch at reduced prices and much more.
   

  

**Application**
 Please apply with your Cv and a Personal Letter with no later than 2025-01-12. For more information Please contact Anna-Carin Markström (Manager), anna-carin.markstrom@scania.com.
   

  

**About Scania and IT @ Scania**
 Scania is a part of Volkswagen Truck & Bus GmbH and one of the world´s leading manufacturers of trucks and buses for heavy transport applications. Scania is also leading provider of industrial and marine engines. Service-related products account for a growing proportion of the company´s operations, assuring Scania customers of cost-effective transport solutions and maximum uptime. Scania also offers financial services.
   

  

 Scania’s IT organisation is an integrated part of the company providing products and services to all business units worldwide. Based on deep Scania business knowledge and internal relations we balance in-house core competences and service production with services externally sourced and governed by us. We are around 1500 people and the majority is located in Sodertalje.

title: Software Engineer till Geposit
description:
*Vill du vara med och forma framtidens lösningar för optimerad logistik? Geposit söker nu en Utvecklare som brinner för att bygga skalbara lösningar och vill vara en del av ett snabbväxande SaaS-företag. Låter det intressant? Läs vidare!*
 Geposit är ett Stockholmsbaserat SaaS-företag som erbjuder ledande tjänster inom geodata. Vi hjälper bolag att förstå och driva sina affärer utifrån ett geografiskt perspektiv med hjälp olika tjänster, däribland API för adressvalidering, digital karttjänst för geografisk zonindelning och tjänster för geotargeting av online-annonser. Våra kunder finns i många branscher men vi vänder oss särskilt till företag med resurser ute på fältet, t.ex. transport och serviceföretag.
   

  

 Nu gör vi satsningar för att utveckla och växa vårt erbjudande med marknadsledande tjänster för optimering av leveranser. Det är ett komplext men spännande område och därför söker vi en ny kollega till vårt härliga och drivna utvecklingsteam!
   

  

**Om rollen**
 I rollen som Software Engineers hos Geposit kommer du ha stort fokus på backend-utveckling (Golang / Go). Vår ideala kollega tar stort ägandeskap och har förmåga att arbeta självständigt. Även om huvudfokus läggs på backend, krävs viss flexibilitet för att också bidra i frontend-utveckling (React.js) när det behövs.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer bland annat bestå av:
   

  

* API Development: Designa, utveckla och underhålla robusta API:er
* Backend Engineering: Arbeta i Golang för att bygga skalbara backend-lösningar
* Database Management: Arbeta med SQL-databaser för att säkerställa effektiv datahantering
* Cloud Integration: Deploy:a och hantera applikationer på molnplattformar
* Frontend Collaboration: Vid behov stötta i frontend-utveckling (React.js)
* Project Ownership: Ta ansvar för delprojekt från idé till release


**Om dig**
 Vi söker dig som har minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom utveckling. Därutöver ser vi gärna att du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av API-utveckling
* Gedigna färdigheter i Golang
* Goda färdigheter i molntjänster (t.ex. AWS, Azure eller GCP)
* Kunskaper och erfarenhet av SQL-databaser
* Viss kunskap inom frontend-utveckling i React.js


 Vi söker dig som kan kommunicera obehindrat på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Kunskap inom Java och C++
* Erfarenhet av algoritmisk problemlösning och ruttoptimering
* Språkkunskaper i danska


 Utöver detta har du en stark drivkraft att komma framåt, att hitta kreativa vägar förbi problem och du tar saker i mål med en stor portion grit. Du trivs i ett mindre bolag där ditt engagemang och din tekniska kompetens får fritt spelrum. Eftersom du gillar både stora som små projekt, är vår sammansvetsade organisation där det händer mycket, en attraktiv plats för dig nu när du börjar känna dig redo för nya utmaningar.
   

  

**Låter det intressant – kontakta oss**
 Låter det här som en roll, ett team och en arbetsmiljö som du skulle kunna trivas i – då vill vi gärna höra mer från dig! Sök jobbet, connecta med oss eller dela detta med någon du tror skulle passa in.
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten, teamet eller företaget hör du av dig till Elin Andersson, Tech Talent Acquisition Specialist, på Progrits.
   

  

 Då det är juletider vill vi flagga för att det kan dröja lite längre än normalt att få återkoppling på din ansökan. Urval och intervjuer kommer att påbörjas i början på januari.
   

  

**En del av Progrits**
*Du blir del av Progrits - en mjukvarukoncern med ledande marknadspositioner och produkter, ett stort tillväxtfokus och en tydlig strategi. Sedan 2023 är Progrits en del av Axcel, ett nordiskt riskkapitalbolag med stort intresse för tech-sektorn.*
*Att vara en del av Progrits innebär ökade möjligheter för utveckling både för oss som företag och för dig som anställd, och samtidigt större trygghet.*
*Är du som vi, tror vi att du vill känna meningsfullhet på jobbet – och vara med om att göra Geposit till ett ännu bättre och roligare ställe att jobba på. För roligt är viktigt – jobbet är en för stor del av livet för att inte ha kul!*
 Geposit utvecklar digitala verktyg för adressverifiering, geografiska analyser och områdeshantering. Vi drivs av teknisk innovation och viljan att förenkla och förbättra affärsprocesser. Med hög servicegrad lyssnar vi på våra kunder och strävar efter att erbjuda bästa möjliga kvalitet och funktionalitet.

title: Software Engineer till Geposit
description:
*Vill du vara med och forma framtidens lösningar för optimerad logistik? Geposit söker nu en Utvecklare som brinner för att bygga skalbara lösningar och vill vara en del av ett snabbväxande SaaS-företag. Låter det intressant? Läs vidare!*
 Geposit är ett Stockholmsbaserat SaaS-företag som erbjuder ledande tjänster inom geodata. Vi hjälper bolag att förstå och driva sina affärer utifrån ett geografiskt perspektiv med hjälp olika tjänster, däribland API för adressvalidering, digital karttjänst för geografisk zonindelning och tjänster för geotargeting av online-annonser. Våra kunder finns i många branscher men vi vänder oss särskilt till företag med resurser ute på fältet, t.ex. transport och serviceföretag.
   

  

 Nu gör vi satsningar för att utveckla och växa vårt erbjudande med marknadsledande tjänster för optimering av leveranser. Det är ett komplext men spännande område och därför söker vi en ny kollega till vårt härliga och drivna utvecklingsteam!
   

  

**Om rollen**
 I rollen som Software Engineers hos Geposit kommer du ha stort fokus på backend-utveckling (Golang / Go). Vår ideala kollega tar stort ägandeskap och har förmåga att arbeta självständigt. Även om huvudfokus läggs på backend, krävs viss flexibilitet för att också bidra i frontend-utveckling (React.js) när det behövs.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer bland annat bestå av:
   

  

* API Development: Designa, utveckla och underhålla robusta API:er
* Backend Engineering: Arbeta i Golang för att bygga skalbara backend-lösningar
* Database Management: Arbeta med SQL-databaser för att säkerställa effektiv datahantering
* Cloud Integration: Deploy:a och hantera applikationer på molnplattformar
* Frontend Collaboration: Vid behov stötta i frontend-utveckling (React.js)
* Project Ownership: Ta ansvar för delprojekt från idé till release


**Om dig**
 Vi söker dig som har minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom utveckling. Därutöver ser vi gärna att du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av API-utveckling
* Gedigna färdigheter i Golang
* Goda färdigheter i molntjänster (t.ex. AWS, Azure eller GCP)
* Kunskaper och erfarenhet av SQL-databaser
* Viss kunskap inom frontend-utveckling i React.js


 Vi söker dig som kan kommunicera obehindrat på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Kunskap inom Java och C++
* Erfarenhet av algoritmisk problemlösning och ruttoptimering
* Språkkunskaper i danska


 Utöver detta har du en stark drivkraft att komma framåt, att hitta kreativa vägar förbi problem och du tar saker i mål med en stor portion grit. Du trivs i ett mindre bolag där ditt engagemang och din tekniska kompetens får fritt spelrum. Eftersom du gillar både stora som små projekt, är vår sammansvetsade organisation där det händer mycket, en attraktiv plats för dig nu när du börjar känna dig redo för nya utmaningar.
   

  

**Låter det intressant – kontakta oss**
 Låter det här som en roll, ett team och en arbetsmiljö som du skulle kunna trivas i – då vill vi gärna höra mer från dig! Sök jobbet, connecta med oss eller dela detta med någon du tror skulle passa in.
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten, teamet eller företaget hör du av dig till Elin Andersson, Tech Talent Acquisition Specialist, på Progrits.
   

  

 Då det är juletider vill vi flagga för att det kan dröja lite längre än normalt att få återkoppling på din ansökan. Urval och intervjuer kommer att påbörjas i början på januari.
   

  

**En del av Progrits**
*Du blir del av Progrits - en mjukvarukoncern med ledande marknadspositioner och produkter, ett stort tillväxtfokus och en tydlig strategi. Sedan 2023 är Progrits en del av Axcel, ett nordiskt riskkapitalbolag med stort intresse för tech-sektorn.*
*Att vara en del av Progrits innebär ökade möjligheter för utveckling både för oss som företag och för dig som anställd, och samtidigt större trygghet.*
*Är du som vi, tror vi att du vill känna meningsfullhet på jobbet – och vara med om att göra Geposit till ett ännu bättre och roligare ställe att jobba på. För roligt är viktigt – jobbet är en för stor del av livet för att inte ha kul!*
 Geposit utvecklar digitala verktyg för adressverifiering, geografiska analyser och områdeshantering. Vi drivs av teknisk innovation och viljan att förenkla och förbättra affärsprocesser. Med hög servicegrad lyssnar vi på våra kunder och strävar efter att erbjuda bästa möjliga kvalitet och funktionalitet.

title: Software Developer
description:
**Software Developer - Vostio Product Team at Assa Abloy Hospitality, Stockholm Liljeholmen**
 Are you a passionate technologist who thrives on collaboration, innovation, and making a real impact? ASSA ABLOY Hospitality, part of our Global Solutions Division is seeking a dynamic developer to join our R&D team working on the product portfolio Vostio, our cutting-edge hospitality solution.
   

  

 Join the Vostio RND Team in Stockholm, Liljeholmen office and enjoy a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

**What Would You Do As Our Software Developer**
 ASSA ABLOY Hospitality is growing, and so is this Team, developing our modern access control solutions used globally, called Vostio.
   

  

 We're not just hiring a developer; we're seeking a team player who brings energy, curiosity, and a genuine love for solving complex challenges. If you're the type of person who gets excited about turning ideas into reality, communicates openly and enjoys collaborative problem-solving, maintains a sense of humor even under pressure and continuously learns, while not being afraid to experiment… Then you might be our perfect match!
   

  

**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who:
   

  

* Has demonstrated technical expertise in Cloud development (GCP, AWS, Azure).
* Has strong Java or Kotlin experience.
* Embraces modern development paradigms, including functional programming.
* Has previous background in microservice and event-driven architectural solutions.
* Has a solid understanding of security principles, particularly access control and multi-tenant system design.
* Is fluent in English, able to communicate clearly with multiple stakeholders.


 Additionally, it would be beneficial for you to have some of the following Typescript knowledge, Infrastructure as Code (CDK, Terraform), experience with React or Golang or familiarity with encryption standards. However, these are not our must-have skills.
   

  

**Beyond the Code:**
 We believe great developers are multifaceted. Tell us about your passions outside of work – whether it's rock climbing, painting, playing an instrument, or collecting vintage postcards. Your unique interests are what make you, you!
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills
* A dynamic, innovative environment, where you are encourage to bring your ideas into life
* Opportunity to work on meaningful and modern technology that helps others
* A supportive and Talented Team that values both professional excellence and personal growth
* A chance to shape the future of hospitality technology


 Ready to bring your whole self to work? We can't wait to meet you!
   

  

**We review applications regularly, so don’t wait** 
  

  

 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here!
   

  

  

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Daria Skucha, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at Daria.Skucha@assaabloy.com.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Open Application: System Developer
description:
Join Lumera's dynamic Product Development team in Sweden as we expand our presence in the European Life and Pensions industry. We're always seeking outstanding system developers to help drive our innovative solutions forward as we build tomorrow together. Excited? Submit your open application now!
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Collaborating with agile teams to build and enhance our cutting-edge insurance product.
* Utilizing technologies like Java, SQL, with opportunities to explore new tools.
* Ensuring the delivery of top-notch, easily maintainable software.
* Learning, teaching, and executing – together with your team.


 Curious to hear more about life as a system developer at Lumera from Erik Gyllenstierna? Check out this interview!
   

  

**What You’ll Be Getting**
* Amazing colleagues, the best in our field.
* Daily challenges that keep you engaged and motivated.
* Access to in-house business knowledge, just a few desks away.
* Flexible hybrid remote work options, possibility to work remote two days per week.
* A culture of continuous learning and knowledge sharing.
* Benefits designed to support a healthy work-life balance.
* Conveniently located offices in Stockholm and Umeå.


**To Thrive In This Role, You**
* Hold a Master's degree within IT/Computer Science or related fields.
* Either just graduated or bring several years of experience as a system developer.
* Are proficient in English communication, both spoken and written.
* Have a proactive, solution-oriented mindset.
* Demonstrates drive, curiosity, and a solution-oriented approach.
* Has an ability and preference of working with others.
* Active in seeking new knowledge from more senior colleagues.
* Value communication, transparency, and openness.
* Understand the importance of feeling proud of your work.
* Enjoy solving problems and work with complexity.


 Does this sound like the perfect fit for you? Apply today! Send us your CV or apply using your LinkedIn profile.
   

  

**Please note that due to this being an open application form, feedback on your application may linger. For any inquiries or general questions, contact Felix Wallin at felix.wallin@lumera.com. We look forward to receiving your application!**
 P:S. Make sure to let us know your preferred location: Stockholm or Umeå.
   

  

**About Lumera**
 Lumera is dedicated to the digital transformation of the European Life and Pensions industry. As insurtech innovators, we provide future-proof core technology for policy administration.
   

  

 The Prudent Revolution is our mission – bridging technology and partnership to navigate the fastest, safest path through complex change for L&P providers.
   

  

 We combine tech and industry expertise with relevant market experience to offer a broad range of consultancy and data services – from managing faultless legacy system migration to facilitating compelling end-user experiences.
   

  

 Based in Stockholm, Lumera has significant presence with offices in the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, Norway, Sweden, India and Vietnam.
   

  

 Lumera is majority owned by Monterro, a leading Nordic software investor.
   

  

 www.lumera.com
   

  

 Follow us on LinkedIn and Facebook.
   

  

 We are Lumera - pioneering the digital transformation of the Life and Pensions industry. With strategic partnerships and advanced automation, we streamline policy administration, making complex processes simpler. Our mission, The Prudent Revolution, guides L&P providers through change, ensuring a smooth transition. Trusted for migrations and armed with deep domain expertise and innovative AI solutions, Lumera shapes the future. Join us on this innovative journey!

title: Java Software Engineer (R-17098)
description:
**Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet**
 Dun & Bradstreet combines global data and local expertise to help clients make smarter decisions. With 6,000+ people in 31 countries, we are a team of diverse thinkers and problem solvers who all share a common curiosity: to find new ways to turn data into value. If you share this curiosity and want to be part of a future-ready company, come join us! Learn more at dnb.com/careers .
   

  

 The Consumer Intelligence team is looking for a Software Developer, responsible for delivering smart data that help our customers make the right decisions.
   

  

 As part of the team, you will get the chance to provide platform components to deliver user facing experiences to consumers. We work closely with our customers to make sure we develop and build the right things.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Collaborate with a small, autonomous team of developers, and product owners to find end-to-end solutions to important problems.
* Implement these solutions in a microservice environment, built mostly on Kotlin and Spring Boot
* We work towards an architecture based on micro-services and REST APIs and with modern frameworks and technologies such as Java, Kotlin, Spring Boot, ElasticSearch, MongoDB, Kafka, Docker and Kubernetes in AWS.
* Develop software that aims to meet the business goals and visions
* Ensure delivery of services that meet performance, scalability and robustness requirements
* Unit and integration tests for code and services produced
* Take part in the overall strategy for IT development


**Your Passion**
* You are passionate about development and being part of a real agile Tech organization. Our developers have great responsibility to participate and drive our products and services forward with high-end technology and customer experience. We work in product teams, in short sprints and with Continuous Deployment. We also work cross functional and cooperative across all the organization to manage and move towards our technical vision and platform to align in the future.
* Being part of our Tech organization, you are a social team player, curious and explorative, and want to take part in continuously improve the way we work and evaluating tools in the scope of open source and larger communities to best support our needs and vision.


**Who You Are**
* You hold a degree in computer science or similar subject and have at least 2+ years of working experience in similar engineering position
* You have an understanding of Java or Kotlin development
* Previous coding experience in object oriented or functional programming
* You care about quality and you know what it means to ship high-quality code
* You have some knowledge of distributed systems, and be passionate about pair programming practices and agile way of working
* You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* You are fluent in spoken and written Swedish and English


**Why Join Us?**
**Benefits**
 Does this role sound like a great opportunity but you’re not sure about making a move? We are really proud of our company and culture and think we have some great things to offer. Some of our benefits in Sweden include:
   

  

* Two paid volunteer days to contribute to causes in your community
* A paid day every year to use for your health and wellness
* Instead of half days before public holidays, you will have 4 additional full days a year for you to use to celebrate what is meaningful to you
* Annual wellness/sport benefit
* Collective agreement, pension, insurance and parental pay allowance
* Access to free services providing support and counselling
* Flexible working arrangements and hybrid work arrangement for most roles


***Whilst some roles do have certain requirements which are essential, we try to focus on hiring based on potential rather than CV as much as possible. If you are unsure you fully meet the requirements, we would still love to hear from you!***
 All Dun & Bradstreet job postings can be found at https://www.dnb.com/about-us/careers-and-people/joblistings.html and https://jobs.lever.co/dnb . Official communication from Dun & Bradstreet will come from an email address ending in @dnb.com.
   

  

 Notice to Applicants : Please be advised that this job posting page is hosted and powered by Lever. Your use of this page is subject to Lever's Privacy Notice and Cookie Policy , which governs the processing of visitor data on this platform.

title: Software Engineer for Revenue Engineering
description:
**About Us**
 Soundtrack Your Brand is a B2B scale-up company providing music streaming services to more than 50,000 businesses in over 70 countries, from the café round the corner to bigger brands like McDonald's, Toni & Guy and TAG Heuer.
   

  

 The company consists of 90+ talented, motivated and humble employees. We believe in product-led growth, where the product is the primary driver of customer acquisition, conversion and expansion. Our headquarters are located in central Stockholm (Odenplan).
   

  

 The role
   

  

 We're looking for a senior engineer to join our Revenue Engineering team.
   

  

 The team is responsible for subscription management, product packaging and business support systems.
   

  

 You'll be working on a wide range of projects, spanning from distributed systems to data pipelines, often in close collaboration with web developers as well as designers.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Designing and developing services needed to realise our product roadmap
* Improving, evolving and replacing existing services and APIs
* Making sure our systems stay performant, reliable and cost efficient
* Helping the team grow as a whole by sharing knowledge and lifting each other up


**About You**
 You're driven and entrepreneurial, but you know how to be a team player too. Regardless of roles, we're always looking to work with people who can adapt to constant change, prioritise what's important, stay humble, open, curious and get things done.
   

  

 You have at least 5+ years of experience as a engineer, preferably with experience in SaaS and/or billing related systems.
   

  

 Our technology stack
   

  

 We’re building distributed services that are hosted on Google App Engine and Google Container Engine (GKE). Services are accessed using GraphQL and REST.
   

  

 Our language of choice is primarily Go but we also use Scala. The services we build and maintain use a variety of technologies, such as Datastore, Cloud SQL (Postgres), Spanner, Elastic search, and Google Cloud Storage. We also export data to BigQuery for data analysis.
   

  

 All our services are deployed and configured using Terraform and Helm. We primarily use Google Pub/Sub for communicating between services.
   

  

 Employee benefits
   

  

* You have the freedom to decide where you work the best with our Work From Anywhere program with a one-off setup bonus included
* Generous pension plan
* Yearly budget for health, wellness and personal development
* Laptop and mobile phone of your choice with included cellular subscription
* Regular social activities such as team events, meet ups, after works and off-sites


 If you have any questions about the position or need to reach out, get in touch with Marcus Revfalk at marcus@soundtrackyourbrand.com. Please note that we only accept applications submitted via our career page and do not accept applications by email.

title: Business Intelligence Developer
description:
**Senior BI-utvecklare sökes till vår kund i centrala Stockholm** 




 Vi söker en erfaren BI-utvecklare med expertkunskap inom datahantering och analys! Är du en passionerad BI-specialist med stor erfarenhet av att skapa datadrivna lösningar? Då kan du vara den vi söker!
 



**Om oss:** 




 UNQ Recruitment grundades med en vision att revolutionera rekryteringsbranschen genom att erbjuda skräddarsydda och innovativa lösningar för både kandidater och företag. Vi strävar efter att skapa meningsfulla möten mellan individer och organisationer. Sedan vår start har vi varit dedikerade till att hitta rätt matchningar och bygga långsiktiga relationer för att skapa värde för både kandidater och företag.
 



**Om rollen:** 




 Som Senior BI-utvecklare kommer du att vara ansvarig för att designa, utveckla och implementera kraftfulla och skalbara BI-lösningar för vår kund inom finans. Du kommer att arbeta tätt med andra seniora utvecklare och affärsanalytiker för att skapa datadrivna lösningar som hjälper företaget att fatta datastödda beslut. Du kommer även att vara en mentor för mer juniora medarbetare och hjälpa till att driva kompetensutveckling inom teamet.
 



 Vår kund är ett väletablerat företag beläget i centrala Stockholm, och du erbjuds en hybrid-arbetsmodell som ger dig flexibilitet för att ha en bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Du kommer att få möjlighet att arbeta i en stimulerande och utmanande miljö, där det finns stora utvecklingsmöjligheter och kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling.
 



**Meriter vi gärna ser att du besitter:** 



* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av BI-utveckling, gärna med fokus på ETL-processer, datamodellering och visualisering.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med BI-verktyg som Power BI, Tableau eller liknande.
* Goda kunskaper i SQL och databashantering, både för relationsdatabaser (SQL) och NoSQL-lösningar.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med molnbaserade BI-lösningar (AWS, Azure eller GCP).
* Förmåga att skapa effektiva och skalbara datalösningar i en mikrotjänstarkitektur.
* Kunskap om verktyg och processer för kontinuerlig integration och kontinuerlig leverans (CI/CD).
* Stark problemlösningsförmåga och analytiskt tänkande.
* Förmåga att både arbeta självständigt och som en del av ett team, samt att stötta och guida mer juniora kollegor i deras utveckling.
* Förmåga att pedagogiskt förklara tekniska lösningar för icke-tekniska intressenter.



**Ansökan:** 




 Om du är intresserad av rollen eller har några frågor, tveka inte att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare, @Caroline Dunvret här på LinkedIn.
 



 Vi kommer att gå igenom alla ansökningar efter jul och nyår och ser fram emot att återkomma med feedback på din ansökan under v.2 2025.
 



 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: SQL Database Developer
description:
**Xensam: SAM Disrupters** 




 Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered, cloud-hosted Software Asset Management technology. We’re looking for key players to join us as we scale our impact and build the Xensam team together. We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.
 



  





 We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.
 



  





**About the role** 




 As our Database Developer at Xensam, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the performance, integrity, and security of our company's databases. You will work closely with our development and operations teams, providing support and guidance to optimize our SQL/PostgreSQL database systems, as well as implementing efficient data models.
 



  





 The ideal candidate is passionate about database management, possesses at least 3-5 years of hands-on experience with PostgreSQL, and thrives in an environment that values freedom of work and the ability to get things done.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




 You will take ownership by maintaining and managing our SQL/PostgreSQL database systems, performing routine database administration tasks, such as database monitoring, troubleshooting, and optimization. You will also collaborate with development and operations teams to design and implement efficient database structures and schemas. Other responsibilities that you will have:
 


* Engage in database concept refinement, data modeling, and the fine-tuning of SQL queries for optimal system performance.
* Monitor database performance and proactively identify and resolve performance bottlenecks.
* Troubleshoot and resolve database-related issues, including query optimization and data consistency problems.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and enforce database standards and best practices.
* Stay up to date with industry trends and advancements in SQL and database administration.



  





**Qualifications** 



* 3-5 years of professional experience working with databases.
* Strong proficiency in SQL/PostgreSQL database administration and performance tuning.
* Excellent understanding of database concepts, data modeling, and SQL query optimization.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex database-related issues.
* Proven ability to work independently, take ownership of projects, and meet deadlines.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
* Strong proficiency in written and spoken English and Swedish.



  





**Bonus points for** 



* SQL/PostgreSQL certification (e.g., SQL/PostgreSQL Certified Professional) is a plus.
* Experience with other database technologies, such as Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle Database, MongoDB etc.
* Experience in the field of software licensing generally, or Software Asset Management specifically.



  





**What you get** 



* A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
* Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
* Free access to beverages, snacks, gym facilities, on-site massage, shuffleboard, and other games.
* If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
* Join an ambitious and diverse team, and work with cutting-edge technology in the fastest-growing SAM software on the market.
* An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.



  





**At Xensam, our core values define our culture** 




**Rebellious** 
 : We encourage a spirit of freedom and initiative within responsibility.
 



**Humane** 
 : We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.
 



**Harmonious** 
 : We promote work-life balance, creating a pleasant, supportive workplace.
 



 Join Xensam for a balanced, collaborative, and growth-focused work environment. If you're a team player ready to thrive,
 **APPLY now!** 




  





 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.

title: Software Engineer - Pensionsinnehav
company_industry: Financial Services, Software Development, and Banking
description:
*Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär och bidra till Avanzas ambition att skapa Sveriges bästa pensionssparande?* 




  





 Avanza satsar stort inom pensionsområdet och har siktet inställt på att skapa Sveriges bästa pensionssparande. Detta genom att skapa en privatkundsupplevelse i världsklass samt att erbjuda enkla, innovativa och effektiva tjänstepensionslösningar. För att lyckas med detta krävs att vi har ett effektivt och skalbart Pensionsbolag som kan växa med vår affär.
 



  





 Team Pensionsinnehav spelar en viktig roll i detta genom att skapa förutsättningar för Avanza Pension att enkelt, effektivt och självgående få affären att växa, med hjälp av system som är skalbara, trygga och moderna.
 



  





**Om teamet & rollen** 




 På Avanza har teamen mandat att själva driva sin teknik, affär och kundupplevelse. Vi tror att utöver att vara intresserad av teknik och att ta fram tekniska lösningar också är en fördel att vara nyfiken på produktutveckling. För att kunna förverkliga våra ambitioner jobbar vi insiktsdrivet och i tvärfunktionella team.
 



  





 Team Pensionsinnehav består idag av en produktägare och fyra javautvecklare. Teamet präglas av ett starkt samarbete och drivs av en gemensam strävan att utveckla lösningar tillsammans. I teamets uppdrag ingår att effektivisera pensionsbolaget genom att automatisera manuella arbetsflöden, hålla den tekniska plattformen modern och hitta nya produktmöjligheter för att möta ambitionerna om stark kundtillväxt.
 



  





 Teamet bygger även stöd för att tillgängliggöra data för pensionsbolaget att göra dataanalyser på, detta via Avanzas egen dataanalysplattform. Teamet ansvarar också för olika typer myndighetsrapporteringar som berör innehav och skatteberäkningar, samt ansvarar för Avanzas försäkringsprodukt Aktielån.
 



  





**Tekniker och verktyg vi använder:** 



* Java 21
* Spring, Spring Boot
* Angular 2+ och Typescript
* MongoDB
* Eventdriven arkitektur (Kafka och Event Sourcing)
* REST och gRPC
* Minnesdata-plattformen Gigaspaces
* Dbt, BigQuery, Looker
* Verktyg: Splunk, Grafana, Jenkins, Git, Jira & Kanban



  





**Din profil** 




 Vi söker dig som trivs med att diskutera och utveckla lösningar i samarbete med dina kollegor. Du uppskattar både att lära av andra och att dela med dig av din egen kunskap. Du är driven och nyfiken, med ett intresse för nya tekniker och arbetssätt och motiveras av att ständigt göra saker smartare, snyggare och bättre. Vi tror genuint på vikten av samarbete och gemensamma mål, att detta leder till trivsel och en lyckad slutprodukt mot våra kunder. Oavsett om du ser dig som snabb och kreativ eller systematisk och analytisk tror vi att du kommer trivas hos oss!
 



  





 Utöver att vara grym på Java ser vi det som en bonus om du även har erfarenhet och intresse av att ibland utveckla i
 **frontend** 
 , gärna i ett modernt frontend-ramverk.
 



  





**Ansökan:** 




 Skicka gärna din ansökan snarast då urvalet sker löpande, dock senast den
 **19** 
**Januari** 
 . Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mejl p.g.a. GDPR.
 



  





 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: .NET Software Engineer - Fintech - Stockholm
company_industry: Software Development, Information Services, and Staffing and Recruiting
description:
**.NET Software Engineer - Fintech - Stockholm, Sweden** 




  





 (Tech stack: .NET Software Engineer, .NET 8, C#, ASP.NET, C#, React, Angular 17, Microservices, Vue.js, TypeScript, Azure, Web API 2, Agile, SQL Server 2022, Programmer, Full Stack Developer, Architect, .NET Software Engineer)
 



  





 We have several fantastic new roles for .NET Software Engineer to join an ambitious Fintech. This is your chance to work with the sharpest minds in private wealth management and financial software development. Our client’s latest product release has changed the way people view private wealth management and allowed them to provide their clients with an individualised, scalable asset management framework that is unrivalled in today’s market place.
 



  





 Our client is looking for passionate .NET Software Engineer with experience in .NET, .NET Core / ASP.NET MVC, C# and SQL Server. Our client will provide training in: .NET 8, JavaScript, React, Angular 17, Microservices, MongoDB, Vue.js, TypeScript, Azure, AWS, Web API 2, Entity Framework, Node.js, Elasticsearch, Agile, TDD, BDD, Scrum, Kanban and SQL Server 2022.
 



  





 This is your opportunity to be part of a new, technically challenging project and to be involved in the creation of a new application from scratch. FinTech is booming and our client are fast becoming a leader of this market!
 



  





 All .NET Software Engineer positions come with the following benefits:
 



  




* Shares in the company.

title: Data Scientist
description:
We at SD Worx Sweden are looking for an innovative
 **Senior Data Scientist** 
 to join our team in Sweden. In this role, you will leverage
 **AI, ML, and LLM** 
 to streamline Payroll/HR operations, enhance efficiency, and solve key business challenges.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities:**
* Apply and implement AI/ML solutions to optimize Payroll/HR processes.
* Identify opportunities for efficiency improvements using AI tools.
* Serve as an AI expert, driving adoption and delivering tailored solutions.
* Monitor AI solutions, analyze metrics, and ensure continuous improvement.
* Lead AI-related projects, providing training and guidance to teams.
* Stay updated on AI trends, technologies, and ethical considerations.


**Key Challenges You’ll Tackle:**
* Use LLMs to interpret collective agreements and automate formula generation.
* Accelerate new customer onboarding through AI.
* Detect payroll anomalies not captured by static controls using ML.


**Who you are:**
* Strong analytical, technical, and business-focused mindset.
* Experience as a Project Manager, Product Owner, or similar role.
* Proficiency in Azure AI and familiarity with developer environments.
* Excellent communication and ability to translate business needs into AI solutions.
* Proven experience applying generative AI in enterprise systems.
* Independent, innovative, and collaborative team player.


**Requirements:**
* University degree in Data Science/AI or equivalent.
* Fluency in English and Swedish (spoken and written).
* Prior experience in similar AI-focused roles.


**About SD Worx**
 SD Worx is a leading European provider of Payroll & HR services with global reach. We have offices in Europe and an office in Mauritius. Our goal? We bring people solutions to life, so companies of any size can turn Human Resources into a source of value for the business and the people in it. Our people solutions span the entire employee journey, from getting people paid to attracting, rewarding, and developing talent. Are you ready to join us?
   

  

**What do we have to offer?**
* An attractive salary based on your experience and achievement.
* A dynamic work environment
* Learning opportunities: through an individual development plan and professional training
* Career growth: whether you want to become more of an expert in your field our you want to expand your knowledge more horizontally, there is always room to grow within SD Worx!


 From many places, we work as one, moving from better to best together.
   

  

 SD Worx lives diversity in the workplace. Diversity provides inspiration and innovation in our company. We particularly welcome applications from qualified talent, regardless of origin, nationality, gender, skin colour, ethnic and social background, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation and stage of life.

title: Mechanical Design Engineer - Automotive
description:
**Company Description**
 AFRY is a European leader in engineering, design, and advisory services, with a global reach. We accelerate the transition towards a sustainable society.
   

  

 We are 19,000 devoted experts in infrastructure, industry, energy and digitalisation, creating sustainable solutions for generations to come.
   

  

 Making Future
   

  

**Job Description**
 Are you an engineer with experience in product development? Do you want to shape the future of heavy vehicles? If so, we have an opportunity for you!
   

  

 In this role, you will work as a Mechanical Design Engineer within the automotive industry. Your assignments can be located both in-house and on-site with clients. The focus of the assignments varies. For example we have exciting projects in chassis and brake development. You will be part of an engaged team, contributing to a dynamic and collaborative work environment. This role requires strong communication skills to clearly explain complex concepts, as well as experience in managing requirements and transforming them into concrete, achievable goals.
   

  

**A few quotes from our employees:**
*"AFRY has a reputation for being one of the best workplaces in the industry year after year. It is a creative work environment that brings together people from various cultures and educational backgrounds."*
*"I think the company culture at AFRY is an excellent blend of professionalism and fun at work. At AFRY, we are involved in many activities, ranging from developing new ideas and working on concepts to collaborating and growing with colleagues."*
**Qualifications**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* Several years of experience in product development within the manufacturing industry.
* At least two years of experience in OAS, Catia V5 and Fras.
* Experience in vehicle development.
* A relevant academic background, such as a degree in mechanical engineering.
* Proficiency in English, both spoken and written. Proficiency in Swedish is considered an advantage.


 As a person, you have a strong ability to inspire enthusiasm and engagement among your team members. You thrive in teamwork, are motivated by challenges, and feel at home in social settings. You have a great interest in technology and are passionate about developing further as a product developer and engineer.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 To apply for this position, please submit your application including CV. The selection process is ongoing and the position may be filled before the last day of application.
   

  

**Last application date:** 
 February 17th 2025
   

  

**Contact information**
 Johan Eed
   

  

 Section Manager
   

  

 johan.eed@afry.com
   

  

 Johan Eed | LinkedIn
   

  

 Morgan Sandlund
   

  

 Talent Acquisition Partner, AFRY
   

  

 morgan.sandlund@afry.com
   

  

*AFRY is committed to creating an inclusive & diverse environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, disability, or age. You will be part of a global and diverse company where our differences are our strengths. Join us to accelerate the transition towards a sustainable society.*
*At AFRY, we engineer change in everything we do. Change happens when brave ideas come together. When we collaborate, innovate technology, and embrace challenging points of view. That’s how we're making future. We are actively looking for qualified candidates to join our inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. Join us in accelerating the transition towards a sustainable future.*

title: Senior Software Development Engineer
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Software Development
description:
**What You’ll Do At Elekta**
 At Elekta, we don’t just build technology. We build hope for everyone dealing with cancer. As Senior Software Development Engineer, you will be designing and implementing the user workflows for our radiation therapy products and contribute to the innovation of tomorrow’s radiotherapy solutions. You will write code on both the frontend and the backend.
   

  

 You will be part of a cross-functional software development team that works together on requirements, design, implementation, testing, and documentation.
   

  

 Your team is part of an international program that consists of a diverse group of specialists in mechanical engineering, electronics, physics, embedded software, and more.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 In addition to the above, the Senior Software Development Engineer will also take on responsibilities such as:
   

  

* Participating in all activities in software engineering, with emphasis on requirements specification, design, implementation, testing, and associated documentation whilst following company standards
* Perform evaluations of technologies, methodologies, and products
* Follow the technical and clinical evolution within the field
* Understand and adhere to the Elekta quality system and introduce improvements to its effectiveness.


**What You Bring**
 We are looking for a creative, and smart new colleague, who works best in teams. You have a can-do attitude and a problem-solving mindset. The team works with software solutions that guide the users through the radiotherapy treatment workflow. They are enthusiastic about writing efficient code with great user experience - we think you are too. In addition, we believe you have a:
   

  

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, physics, electronics or similar.
* Worked with frontend development using Angular and Typescript.
* Worked with backend development in C# .NET.
* Experience of working in MedTech or some other regulated industry.
* Experience with Docker and Kubernetes.


**Why should you join Elekta?**
 In this role, you will work for a higher purpose; hope for everyone dealing with cancer, and for everyone regardless of where in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. In addition to this, our benefit package includes:
   

  

* 30 paid vacation days/year, additional 4 Elekta days off /year (plus bank holidays).
* Ability to purchase additional vacation days .
* Attractive defined contribution pension scheme.
* Private Medical Insurance.
* Lunch Benefit.
* Contribution to wellness activities.
* Hybrid work option (you are required to work on location at least 3 days/week).


**Hiring Process**
 We are looking forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and resumé in English, via the “Apply” button. Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail. Last day for applying is January 10, 2025.
   

  

 For questions, please contact the responsible TA Partner Oscar at Oscar.persson@elekta.com.
   

  

**We are an equal opportunity employer**
 We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where Elekta operates.

title: Supply Chain Developer
description:
Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

 Inbound Network Design and Flow Engineering is a department within Logistics Nordic. Our ambition is to become the leader in sustainable logistics, and our mission is to maintain and develop our inbound transport flows by designing and continuous improve flows with minimal environmental impact, high quality, and minimal total logistic cost.
   

  

 If you are looking for a new challenge and want to be part of an ambitious and positive team that continuously strives to improve and develop Scania’s Inbound Network and Supply Chain, this might be the job for you.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a member of our team, you will play a crucial role in developing the Inbound Transport Network and Transport & Material Control processes to align with Scania’s future strategies and goals.
   

  

 We heavily focus on Scania’s Sustainability journey, where collaboration with internal and external partners is key to achieving our high sustainability targets.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Monitor, identify, propose and implement activites to improve cost, quality and sustainability of the transport network from suppliers to our production units.
* Participate in and lead projects.
* Collaborating with our regional material control functions to discuss business requirements and include in specifications for new RFQs as well as supporting in current flow setup.
* Work independently within your area of responsibility, respecting but also challenging the current logistics standards.
* Develop inbound network and processes to support Scania's global growth and sustainability journey.


**The team**
 Our group consists of dedicated, skilled, and positive supply chain developers with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We share our knowledge, support each other, and you will join us on our development journey as a team and as individuals to fulfill our mission and achieve our targets.
   

  

**Your Profile**
* Education: University degree in logistics or a related field.
* Experience: Work experience in supply chain is necessary for the role. Practical experience in project management is highly valuated.
* Skills: Fluent in spoken and written English. Strong analytical and communicative skills.
* Personal Attributes: Positive, driven, curious, and communicative. Talent for connecting with new people. Ability to see the big picture, understand details, identify new opportunities, and take initiatives for improvements.


**We offer**
 We can offer you a dynamic workplace with diverse and challenging tasks in a hybrid work setup, meaning you can work from home a few days a week if the job allows. We can also provide you with an individual development plan that you create together with your manager, so you can reach your goals and receive the right support along the way. In addition to career and development opportunities, as an employee at Scania, we can offer you other benefits such as free training at Scania's own health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, performance bonuses, occupational pension, flexible working hours, lunch at a reduced price, the opportunity for a staff car and much more. Scania also organizes several events throughout the year where family and friends are always welcome, which is usually highly appreciated by everyone. If you live in Stockholm, we also offer a direct bus service between Stockholm and Södertälje with Scania Jobexpress.
   

  

**Who Am I As a Leader**
 As a leader I am committed, interested, and believe in giving responsibility. I am inspired by people who dare to challenge themselves and want to join us in working towards a sustainable future. I believe that collaboration, trust, and a genuine desire to help others are important factors for success. With us, we value a sustainable work-life balance. I want you to be a self-driven and active problem solver who is willing to take on challenges, but also celebrate successes with the team.
   

  

**For more information**
 For more information, please contact Louise Hjortsberg, louise.hjortsberg@scania.com
   

  

**Application**
 Send in your application with your CV no later than January 7th 2025
   

  

 Due to the upcoming holidays, we will begin the selection process in Week 2 of 2025
   

  

 A background check is conducted for this position
   

  

 Scania is a world-leading supplier of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers, we drive the transition to a sustainable transport system. In 2022, we delivered 80,238 trucks, 4,994 buses and 13,400 industrial and marine engines to our customers. Net sales amounted to more than SEK 170 billion, of which over 21 percent was service-related. Scania was founded in 1891 and today operates in more than 100 countries and has approximately 57,000 employees. Research and development is mainly concentrated in Sweden. Manufacturing takes place in Europe and Latin America, with regional product centers in Africa, Asia and Eurasia. Scania is part of the TRATON GROUP. For more information visit: www.scania.com

title: Software Development Engineer in Test, Sye
description:
**Description**
 Come build the future of entertainment with us.
   

  

 Are you interested in shaping the future of movies and television? Do you want to define the next generation of how and what Amazon customers are watching?
   

  

 Prime Video is a premium streaming service that offers customers a vast collection of TV shows and movies - all with the ease of finding what they love to watch in one place. We offer customers thousands of popular movies and TV shows from Originals and Exclusive content to exciting live sports events. We also offer our members the opportunity to subscribe to add-on channels which they can cancel at anytime and to rent or buy new release movies and TV box sets on the Prime Video Store. Prime Video is a fast-paced, growth business - available in over 240 countries and territories worldwide. The team works in a dynamic environment where innovating on behalf of our customers is at the heart of everything we do. If this sounds exciting to you, please read on.
   

  

 In this role, you will be joining the live low latency streaming team. We deliver Sye, a revolutionary streaming platform primarily used for live sporting events and concerts. Our ambition is to drastically improve the customer experience of watching live streams by providing minimal latency and synchronized playback to all viewers across the globe.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 You will work on implementing and extending test automation for Sye on all platforms and solving hard challenges requiring creative solutions such as as automating a wide array of AV tests ultimately enabling our team to safely scale our tests and deployments. The platforms we support include Android, iOS, web, smart-TVs, set-top-boxes and game consoles. You will lead the automation efforts on our team as well as contribute across teams to help our partners automate their onboarding to Prime Video with automated certification tests.
   

  

 You will answer question such as "how do we automatically test subtitles without manual intervention?" or "How can we cut the speed of our automated releases in half?" as well implement these solutions.
   

  

 You will utilize test automation, continuous integration and agile development methodologies to help deploy and automate the deployment of the Sye across the world.
   

  

 A day in the life
   

  

 You will architect automation solutions across multiple teams, prototype and implement new tests, influence technology choices as well as propose frameworks and develop automated test cases.
   

  

**About The Team**
 The team owns the live low latency player SDKs for supported platforms, and we also work on the integration of them into Prime Video applications.
   

  

 We are growing, and with us you will also be able to grow as we work together. There are lots of opportunities to interact with other teams globally. Together with partners such as Twitch and IMDb TV, we are part of a strong video streaming community that will be available to you.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience building test automation frameworks and tools
* Experience programming with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
* Experience in professional, non-internship software development


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience with media and streaming services
* Knowledge of overall system architecture, scalability, reliability, and performance


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - Amazon Corporate Services Sweden AB

title: .NET Developer CRM
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Technology, Information and Media
description:
Om rollen
   

  

 Som utvecklare hos oss på Sopra Steria arbetar du med alla delar av utvecklingsprocessen, från koncept till implementation och förvaltning. Du får bryta ner komplexa problem och skapa anpassade lösningar till kunder med den allra senaste tekniken, med grund i Microsofts hela portfölj av tjänster. Som utvecklare i .NET rör vi oss över hela stacken, vilket gör att arbetsuppgifterna under en vecka kan variera. Att arbeta med Microsofts paraply av molntjänster, som dessutom ständigt utökas, gör att du kan bli specialist inom ditt kompetensområde, men ändå alltid ha mer att lära.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifterna som utvecklare hos oss kan t.ex. innebära att:
   

  

* Anpassa funktionaliteten i Dynamics CRM genom utveckling av tillägg i C# och klientanpassningar i JavaScript/TypeScript
* Skapa .NET Core-applikationer för att integrera till och från Dynamics CRM
* Skapa low code-lösningar baserat på Power Apps och Power Automate
* Skapa förutsägbara och stabila releaser med verktyg som Azure DevOps, TeamCity, Octopus Deploy m.fl.


**Om dig**
* 3 års erfarenhet som backend-utvecklare
* Du hanterar C# och .Net
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Power Apps, Power Automate, Dataverse, Azure eller andra kringliggande tjänster inom området
* God kommunikativ förmåga i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift


**Varför välja Sopra Steria**
* Fokus på kompetensutveckling och din personliga utveckling - vi kallar det för Power of sharing
* Stark företagskultur - utsedda till Sveriges bästa arbetsplats av Great Place to Work
* Europas ledande konsultbolag inom digitalisering med internationell närvaro. Läs mer om oss här


**Ansökan**
 Ansök enkelt genom att antingen ladda upp ditt CV eller länka direkt till ditt LinkedIn-konto via annonsen på vår hemsida! Observera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar inkomna via mail.
   

  

 Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller oss som bolag är du välkommen att kontakta Johanna Romanoff, [email protected]
   

  

 Sopra Steria har kunder och projekt som kan kräva säkerhetsgodkännande på olika nivåer.
   

  

 Ytterligare information
   

  

 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Automation Engineer
description:
Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

 In Battery Production we have installed high volume series production of Battery packs, Modules, two prototype lines for batteries and a line for the series production of VCB cables. We are in a phase where we train and build competence to manufacture Battery packs, Modules and cabling for tomorrow's e-mobility products.
   

  

**Our Business**
 In Battery Production, we set up three new production lines. We are in the middle of a phase where we train and build competence to manufacture battery packs and cable harnesses for tomorrow's products in e-mobility. The products and production structure are completely new and we, together with our colleagues, are currently starting up production of a product that will be critical for Scania's fulfilment of the CO2 goals. We are in a shift in our ERP system, from MONA to SAP, and with two almost fully automated production lines, EBBA, which is our MES system, has become a very important keystone in our production.
   

  

 I therefore need to strengthen my team in production technology with engineers who want to be involved in the start and be part of the creation of this production!
   

  

**Our Team**
 Our Advanced Engineering team at Scania battery production is a new unit and is still forming. Recruitment is ongoing and we strive to get the best engineers out there. We will consist of specialists in different areas, which include Tool designers, Automation engineers, Robotic Engineer, Layout engineers, 3Dexperience developer and Tightening specialists.
   

  

**Your Responsibility**
 This role is suited to a PLC, Automation or Computer Engineer who has a strong demonstrable PLC background, strong interpersonal skills and can also demonstrate excellent skills in problem solving and analysis with a keen eye for PLC coding. You will need to understand how all the systems work together to participate in a cross-functional team focused on solving deviations. In the new production environment, we will also introduce new communication tools, which create great opportunities for traceability, analyses, and quality assurance.
   

  

  

* Design and develop PLC Controller, systems based on project requirements in a timely manner
* Document control system designs and track modifications for future reference.
* Work closely with project managers and engineers to ensure systems are designed and delivered correctly and in a timely manner.
* Develop and maintain HMI (Human Machine Interface) terminals for user interaction with controllers.
* Participate in the performance testing, commissioning, and startup of projects.
* Responsible for machine interface (MEC) in machine procurement
* Participate on behalf of Battery Production in competence groups and work with standards in machine connectivity


**Basic Requirements**
* Experience in PLC solutions
* Knowledge of HMI design and programming.
* Familiarity with SCADA systems
* Ability to work efficiently in cross functional teams.
* Good communication and documentation skills.
* Knowledge in vision system
* Understaning TCP/IP network
* Smart maintenance


**Is this you?**
 We are looking for you who have an engineering degree or have completed Scania's technician training and preferably have worked
   

  

 We work in an international environment and the working language is English. Fluency in spoken and written English is a must, thus a basic requirement and Swedish is a merit.
   

  

 As a person, you are analytical, and structured, and can see connections. To succeed in this assignment, we believe that you have worked with similar systems before and are flexible as everyday life can be unpredictable. We also see that you are solution-focused and want to find best practices for developing the organisation and are a team player because we need to have good collaboration with our colleagues.
   

  

**More Information**
 Please contact Nimitra Damjuti, Group Manager Advanced Engineering at Battery Production, email: nimitra.damjuti@scania.com
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should contain a CV, and copies of your grades, a personal letter is optional. Scania is using tests as a part of the recruitment process. Selections and interviews may be held during the application period. A background check might be conducted for this position. Please apply as soon as possible at Career | Scania Group, but at the latest the 27th of December, 2024. Please note, as a Scania employee you apply via MySuccess/Careers. During the Christmas and New Year holidays, the process will be paused and will continue at the beginning of January 2025. We hope for your understanding!

title: Logistics Developer - Battery Production
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 Join our Logistics Engineering and Development department as a Logistics Developer for Automatic storages. You will support the material flow to produce Modules, Battery packs, and Electrical Cables Harnesses, which are key components for our electrical vehicles. Our material handling process features various automated equipment for Production and Logistics, including automatic storages, AGVs, and robots.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Plan, lead, and follow up on activities and projects for the logistics process in our stream.
* Monitor developments within Production and Logistics and contribute to introducing new technologies.
* Actively participate in assigned forums and gather improvement suggestions for the business.
* Communicate at different levels within Scania's organization.
* Identify improvements and suggest necessary changes.
* Calculate investment and resource needs for assigned projects.
* Drive major improvement activities to develop working methods, methods, and processes.
* Work daily with the Warehouse Control System, steering all three automatic storages, and closely support operations with processes, deviations, and improvements.


**Who You Are**
* You possess an academic background in Production and Logistics or a related field.
* You have previous experience with operational and personal responsibility, preferably in a Production or Logistics environment.
* You communicate effectively in both Swedish and English, both in speech and writing.
* You have a strong passion for Production and Logistics, and you constantly strive to develop yourself, others, and our working methods to achieve set goals.
* You are engaged, curious, and well-structured.
* You work with resilience and a supportive attitude.


**This Is Us**
 Logistics encompasses several key functions: production planning, material planning, material handling, logistics development, and logistics technology. Most processes in production and material handling are automated, with flows that are highly interconnected. Nothing moves without signals within and between our IT systems, and material handling processes are largely automated with high-bay warehouses, buffers, and AGVs.
   

  

 Our team specializes in Logistics Engineering and development, focusing on launching and operating our new plant. Some of us are also exploring the next steps in our electrification journey. We believe that open-mindedness and teamwork are crucial to our success. Our processes are strongly interconnected, and we are working to establish a common understanding of our current position and future direction.
   

  

 We are an international team with diverse backgrounds, experiences, and competencies. This diversity brings different perspectives, which strengthens our approach to tackling and solving challenges. Our team fosters an open and inclusive environment where everyone is encouraged to share their opinions, which is highly valued and supports our work.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-01-05. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Manager Logistics Engineering, mail: alexander.classon@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Backend Developer inom Business Intelligence
description:
*Vill du vara med och bygga framtidens datamodeller för finansiell rapportering? Drivs du av innovation och förbättringar i en tvärfunktionell kultur? Ta chansen att jobba i en dynamisk och lärorik miljö där du är med och bidrar till spelupplevelser i världsklass! Är du intresserad att ta BI Finance till nya höjder med den senaste tekniken och smartaste modellerna, läs vidare och ansök redan idag.* 




  





**I rollen får du:** 




 • Tillsammans med ditt team ansvara för ATGs centrala rapporterings- och avräkningssystem som hanterar stora mängder transaktioner.
 



 • Arbeta tillsammans med teamet för den tekniska förflyttningen från PL/SQL till Kotlin och att använda vår dataplattform i AWS på rätt sätt.
 



 • Vara en viktig del av migreringen av nuvarande databassystem till framtidens lösning och vår resa från on-prem till molnet vilket innebär kontinuerligt lärande och utveckling.
 



 • Nära samarbete mellan utvecklare och intressenter.
 



 • Bidra med din erfarenhet och förmågor för att designa och bygga framtidens lösning tillsammans med skickliga och engagerade kollegor.
 



 • Tillämpa relevanta designprinciper vid utformningen av vår framtida lösning för vårt rapporterings- och avräkningssystem.
 



 • Säkerställa datakvalitet, datasäkerhet, dataintegritet och prestanda samt implementera processer för validering.
 



  





 Vi söker nu en erfaren och driven backend-utvecklare med erfarenhet att bygga mikrotjänster i Kotlin, lösningsarkitektur i transaktionsintensiv miljö och i kombination med rätt användande av data och tekniker i vår dataplattform i AWS. I dagsläget arbetar teamet med PL/SQL on-prem och dagens funktionalitet ska byggas upp modulärt i en molnbaserad lösning där du kommer vara en del av den tekniska förflyttningen. Du kommer att ingå i ett produktutvecklingsteam med andra utvecklare, Scrum Master och produktägare. Teamets uppdrag är att säkerställa det finansiella flödet för ATGs spelprodukter online och i butik.
 



  





**Är det här du?** 




 Vi söker en erfaren systemutvecklare med god analytisk förmåga. Då vi är i uppstartsfasen av transformationen från on-prem till cloud ser vi att du är erfaren, driven, nyfiken och lösningsorienterad. Du är en lagspelare som ser kompetensdelning som en självklar väg till lärande för dig och andra. Du förstår vikten av att aktivt bidra till kontinuerliga förbättringar i kod och arbetssätt och att hålla din egen kompetens och förmågor aktuella. Du har god kommunikativ förmåga och uttrycker dig obehindrat på svenska och engelska. Vi ser gärna att du har en relevant högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom eller motsvarande kompetens och några års erfarenhet av:
 



  




* Agilt teamarbete.
* Objektorienterad programmering och mikrotjänstutveckling.
* Systemutveckling eller databasutveckling inom finansiell Business Intelligence.
* Förståelse och erfarenhet av AWS och alternativ för att designa och återanvända data från vår dataplattform i AWS.
* Relevanta design- och dimensionsmodelleringsprinciper inom mikrotjänst-arkitektur.
* Avancerad SQL och Java/Kotlin, AWS, Kubernetes, OCP4, Spring/SpringBoot.
* Stora datamängder och transaktionsintensiv verksamhet med höga krav på tillförlitlighet, test och kvalitet, säkerhet och prestanda.



  





**Meriterande:** 



* Databasteknologier såsom Oracle och PL/SQL.
* Data-arkitektur och förståelse för moderna molnbaserade dataplattformar.
* Erfarenhet av Python, Jira, GitHub och Solace.
* Erfarenhet av att bygga Machine Learning-modeller.
* Medverkat i en migrering från on-prem till molnbaserad lösning.



  





**”ATG siktar högt, är ambitiösa och har en fantastisk kultur”** 




 ATG siktar alltid högt och speciellt inom detta område finns det stora möjligheter att utveckla sig själv och jobba med ny teknik för ett kritiskt område in väldigt dynamisk bransch. Inom teamet har vi påbörjat en förändringsresa och här finns chansen att verkligen komma in och göra skillnad. När det gäller hur vi jobbar är det agila moderna arbetssättet en självklarhet för mig och min syn på ledarskap handlar mycket om att sätta en vision och en riktning och att få alla att känna sig motiverade, engagerade, betrodda och ha full möjlighet att få ut det bästa av sig själva. En annan hörnsten är att alltid leva upp till ATGs kultur och värderingar i hur vi jobbar, kommunicerar och tar oss an utmaningar och självklart har vi kul tillsammans!
 



**- Tomas Hagelin, Manager IT Business Inteligence.** 




  





**We are the game** 




 I närmare 50 år har vi på ATG levererat spänning och underhållning till svenska folket. Vi drivs av att trygga den svenska hästnäringen och att fortsatt vara ett ansvarsfullt spelbolag i framkant. Vår vision att leverera världens bästa spelupplevelse. Hos oss är du en del av en innovativ miljö – med hjälp av den senaste tekniken utvecklar vi spelupplevelser i världsklass. Självledarskap och kompetensutveckling är viktiga delar för oss. Sedan starten 1974 har vi byggt och förvaltat systemen för våra produkter som hanterar 4 500 000 transaktioner per dag.
 



  





**Join the game!** 




 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan via vår rekryteringsportal antingen med ditt cv eller din LinkedIn-profil – det som är enklast och smidigast för dig. Läs gärna mer om oss på vår karriärsida och tveka inte att höra av dig om du har frågor om tjänsten.
 



  





 Vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning och kommer att göra en bakgrundskontroll för denna roll. Tjänsten är på heltid och utgår från vårt kontor vid Solvalla, alldeles intill travbanan. Vi har ett flexibelt arbetssätt vilket innebär att du har möjlighet att kombinera distansarbete med arbete från kontoret. Var med och bygg världens bästa spelupplevelse tillsammans med oss!
 



  





 Urvalet kommer att påbörjas under v.2!

title: Azure Integration Developer to Epical
description:
**We're redefining what a data consultancy can be and achieve** 




  





 At Epical, we’re not just another consultancy firm; we’re on a mission to redefine what a data consultancy can be and achieve. Everything we do begins and ends with trust.
