title: Engineering Manager
description:
We’re a cutting-edge tech-enabled bank on a mission to revolutionize financing for small businesses across 7 markets in northern Europe. Our innovative solutions aim to simplify access to financing and enable growth for small businesses. As we scale, we are now looking for an Engineering Manager to be part of our journey to transform the financial landscape for entrepreneurs.  

  

**About the role**

  

As an Engineering Manager at Qred, you'll play a crucial role in shaping our organizational design, people management, and way of working. You'll be acting as a development manager for the Revenue domain, which means you will be responsible for leading and supporting our 4 development teams with one Tech Lead per team. Your focus will be to ensure alignment with our methodologies, and fostering collaboration within the Revenue domain. This role calls for a visionary leader with a technical background and a passion for building high-performing teams.

 **Key Responsibilities**

* + **People Management:** Oversee performance & staff management of our of engineering teams consisting of ~15 engineers
	+ **Efficient Way of Working:** Champion methodologies like Agile, Lean, Continuous Delivery, and DevOps to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of our engineering processes. Drive and align our Qred engineering maturity model through all teams
	+ **Collaboration and Cross-Functional Work:** Foster strong collaboration and communication between Engineering, Product Management, and UX Design
	+ **Organizational Design:** Define team structures, optimize resource allocation and match personalities, ensure scalability and productivity within the engineering organization
	+ **Recruitment and Retention:** Lead the recruitment strategy for Engineering for the domain, attracting top talent and fostering a culture of retention
	+ **Enable Qred:** You will be part of the Revenue Domain and you will have a tight collaboration with CTO, Architects and Chef Revenue Officer. Your focus will be what is best for Qred, then the product department

 **Requirements**

* + A passion for mentoring and developing engineering talent
	+ A technical background with broad full-stack experience, preferred language is Javascript (nodejs / react / react native), we don't expect you to code but we expect you to understand the challenges our engineers face in their competence and in the cross-functional team
	+ You would need two years of experience in a Head of Engineering or development manager role in a sizable organization, preferably in a domain structure organization
	+ We also see that you have a university engineering degree
	+ Deep understanding of Agile methodologies, DevOps practices, and modern software development principles
	+ Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build strong relationships across functions
	+ Alignment with Qred's leadership values: Visionary, Empowering, Lead by example
	+ We have employees from all parts of the world, English and understanding cultural differences are hard requirements
	+ You like to meet your department and get to know the persons, we believe in non-formal meetings and chats, therefore you need to like an office-first approach to meet the teams as their office days are spread over the week

 **One last thing**

This is a full-time, permanent position based in our headquarters in Stockholm. Don’t wait to send in your application as we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. While the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately

 *Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*

title: Head of Data
description:
##### ***Tycker du om att jobba med data? Om du dessutom älskar båtlivet så vill du inte missa denna möjlighet!***

**Skippo driver Nordens mest älskade navigationsapp och Sveriges största digitala båtmagasin som varje år används av runt en miljon båtåkare. Nu söker vi en extraordinär dataanalytiker/ ingenjör som vill vara med på vår resa att bygga framtidens båtliv.**

  

I Norden är båtlivet ett unikt kulturarv med fler båtar per capita än någon annanstans i världen. Trots en generellt hög digitaliseringsgrad har båtvärlden förblivit traditionell och analog - det vill vi ändra på! Vi har ambitiösa planer vad gäller user experience, nya digitala funktioner och tjänster som kan bidra till ett bättre, enklare, säkrare och mer inspirerande båtliv!


Till vårt team i Stockholm söker vi en person vars själ brinner för data för att bygga upp och utveckla vårt datateam. Att strukturera, bearbeta, analysera och presentera information som ska hjälpa oss att utveckla både nya och befintliga båttjänster och produkter.

  

I Skippos ecosystem kommer data från en mängd olika källor och inkluderar allt från prenumerationsdata, data om hur appen används, positionsdata, till väder data och information inmatad av användare såsom information om deras båt samt diverse UGC. Som Head of Data kommer du äga allt arbete gällande data på bolaget - från att identifiera och korrelera källor, till att definiera och implementera pipelines samt verktyg för analys och visualisering. Till din support har du ett team av engagerade, problemlösningsorienterade och kunniga kollegor - strateger, utvecklare, produktägare, UX/UI designers, CRM- och marknadsföringsexperter. Vi förväntar att datateamet skall växa med dedikerade experter framöver - där får du leda rekryteringsarbetet med att identifiera behov och hitta rätt kompetenser. Utöver detta kommer du att:

* Ansvara för insamling, lagring och analys av data som behövs såväl operativt för att drifta våra tjänster samt internt för att fatta faktabaserade beslut i hela organisationen (inom ledningen, produktutveckling, marknadsföring, finans).
* Proaktivt jobba med produktteamet och utvecklare för att identifiera och analysera data och information för att bättre förstå användarbeteenden och förbättringsmöjligheter.
* Omsätta den enorma mängd användardata från våra nästan en miljon användare till att skapa slutprodukter och funktioner till användare (t.ex. vilken naturhamn som passar bäst givet olika vindstyrkor/ vindriktningar, väder, båttyp/ storlek, säsong etc.)
* Löpande övervaka och kvalitétssäkra datakällor.
* Skapa och underhålla rapporter och dashboards.
* Visualisera data för internt och externt bruk.

##### **Kvalifikationer:**


För att leverera i denna roll behöver du ha ett brinnande intresse för dataanalys. Dessutom tickar du av nästan alla av följande kompetenser/egenskaper:

  

* Erfarenhet från miljöer med **snabb tillväxt** och **konsumentinriktning,** helst inom **app**- och/eller **mediaprodukter**
* Relevant **utbildning och erfarenhet** av att arbeta med datainsamling och analys, i synnerhet från B2C och / eller SaaS miljöer.
* Erfarenhet av **AI/ML** eller liknande.
* Stark **analytisk skärpa** med förmåga att tolka och identifiera mönster i användardata.
* Förmåga att **omsätta insikter** till effektiva handlingsplaner.
* Förmåga att identifiera mönster och avvikelser i data, **testa hypoteser** och **dra slutsatser**.
* **Strukturerad, noggrann** och **uppmärksam på** **detaljer**.
* Erfarenhet av att jobba med **SQL-databaser** och i synnerhet **BigQuery**.
* Hands-on erfarenhet av visualiseringsverktyg och i synnerhet **Looker Studio**.
* Vi jobbar också med **AppsFlyer, RevenueCat, GoogleAnalytics, KafkaStreams och Braze** - ju flera av dessa du känner desto bättre.
* Idé- och initiativrik med förmåga att hålla många projekt i luften samtidigt.
* Du kommunicerar felfritt på svenska och engelska.
* Ett intresse för båtlivet och allra helst egen **erfarenhet av båtlivet** i Norden.

**Vad du kan förvänta dig av Skippo:**

* En chans att bidra till att radikalt förändra en industri som släpar efter digitalt.
* Möjligheten att få jobba med en spännande tjänst i ständig utveckling.
En samarbetsinriktad arbetskultur med högt i tak, där varje åsikt räknas.  
* 

Detta är vår första dedikerade data-relaterad roll vilket innebär ett stort ansvar men också en fantastisk möjlighet att påverka både organisationen och arbetssättet.  

  



Tveka inte att höra av dig till nesa@skippo.io om du har några frågor eller funderingar. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Seniora IT-konsulter till Castra Jönköping
description:
*Är du redo att utveckla din karriär och samtidigt njuta av friheten att själv forma din vardag? Hos Castra erbjuder vi en arbetsplats där du kan skapa en spännande framtid på dina egna villkor. Inled 2025 med nya möjligheter!*

**Rollen som konsult**


Castra Mellansverige växer, och vi letar efter dig som vill vara med på vår framgångsresa! Vi söker seniora och erfarna konsulter som delar vår passion och våra kärnvärden: **FRIHET, MÖJLIGHETER och MEDBESTÄMMANDE**.

**Erfarenhet**


Hos oss kan du vara utvecklare inom frontend, backend eller fullstack, BI-specialist, teknisk projektledare, testare/testledare, UX/UI-utvecklare eller IT-säkerhetsexpert.


Vi söker dig som är nyfiken på att ta nästa steg i karriären och vill bidra med din expertis samtidigt som du får möjligheten att forma din framtid och dina arbetsuppgifter utifrån det som driver dig.


Istället för att fokusera på vad du gjort tidigare är vi nyfikna på att höra mer om vad du vill uppnå framåt. Men vi ser att du har med dig sedan tidigare:

* 6+ års erfarenhet inom ditt kompetensområde
* konsultmässig inställning och drivs av att skapa värde


Det är en fördel om du har körkort, bil och är öppen för uppdrag där placering är på annan ort.

**Vårt erbjudande: Det bästa till de bästa!**


På Castra tror vi på att skapa en arbetsmiljö där varje individ får chansen att nå sin fulla potential. Hos oss får du friheten att själv styra över dina uppdrag, arbetstid och kompetensutveckling. Vi ger dig möjlighet att forma ditt arbetsliv efter dina behov och ambitioner. Som en del av vårt team har du också möjligheten att bli delägare, vilket ger dig verkligt inflytande över både din egen och företagets framtid.


Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö där utveckling står i fokus. Med spännande uppdrag och tillgång till en snabbfotad säljstyrka stöttar vi dig i att hitta uppdrag som passar just dig.


Vi är stolta över att vara ett **Gasell- och Karriärföretag** som kombinerar stark tillväxt med en fantastisk arbetsmiljö. Sedan 2017 har vi varit certifierade av **Great Place To Work** och vi utsågs till **Sveriges Bästa Arbetsplats 2024**.  

  



**Nytt år, nya möjligheter**


Castra Mellansverige har kontor i Jönköping, Örebro, Karlstad, Norrköping och Linköping. Castra finns även i regionerna Norr, Syd, Väst och Öst. Oavsett var du befinner dig finns vi nära till hands. För mer information, besök: https://www.castra.se/om-oss/

**Låt oss skapa magi tillsammans!**


Redo att inleda det nya året med en spännande möjlighet? Sök direkt via länken eller kontakta oss för att höra mer! Vi ser fram emot att läsa din ansökan efter lite julledighet och återkommer till dig så snart vi kan.


Vid frågor kontakta:Rebecca Frödekrans, konsultchef, Jönköping Rebecca.frodekrans@castra.se, 070-512 13 39.

title: Full-stack Engineer (Music Experience)
description:
### **About us**


Soundtrack is a B2B scale-up company providing music streaming services to more than 80,000 businesses in over 70 countries, from the café round the corner to bigger brands like Joe & The Juice, Toni & Guy and TAG Heuer.


The company consists of 90+ talented, motivated and humble employees. We believe in product-led growth, where the product is the primary driver of customer acquisition, conversion and expansion. Our headquarters are located in central Stockholm (Odenplan).

### **The role**


As a full-stack engineer in the Music Experience team, you’ll be working on a wide range of projects together with other engineers, product owners, UI/UX designers, machine learning experts, researchers, music experts and analysts.


Music is the core of Soundtrack’s product. The Music Experience team is a vertical team that is dedicated to ownership and development of all music features, like music onboarding, home, search, stations, user created playlists, schedules and artist/album/playlist detail pages. The team owns the features end to end, from UX/UI to APIs, databases, and machine learning.


Your primary focus will be to work on new features and continuous improvements for our apps built on React (with TypeScript) and Python. We are a data driven team and will continuously iterate based on insights, A/B testing and qualitative user feedback. Ideas can come from anyone, data is the final judge.


You can check out the How it works page to see what kind of features you will be working on or download our app and sign up for a free trial to get a first hand experience.

### **Responsibilities**

* Building, releasing and continuously improving new and existing features and services.
* Contribute to the team’s vision, strategy and agenda
* Helping the team grow as a whole by sharing knowledge and lifting each other up

### **About you**


We're always looking to work with people who are friendly, professional, humble, open, and with a passion for details. You are probably not a stranger to describing yourself as:

* Self-sustaining – you can work independently, taking initiatives and planning your own time
* Curious – you enjoy learning new things to grow both professionally as well as on a personal level
* A good communicator – you enjoy discussing different solutions and strategies for technical challenges
* Agile – you feel comfortable in a dynamic environment where focus lies in what’s important here and now, with the ability to realize when it's time to change the game plan and when to stick to it
* Humble – you are an open person, you say what you mean and mean what you say
* Street smart – crafty, able to build solutions with limited resources
* Not a perfectionist – but disciplined and methodical in your approach to solving problems

### **Mandatory requirements**

* You feel at home building robust mobile & web apps as well as APIs and services
* Proficiency in TypeScript/JavaScript and one or a few server languages
* Comfortable with Git, Node, (p)npm and browser dev tools

### **Beneficial requirements (not required)**

* General interest in music and/or music technology
* Python apps - we use Python as our server language in Music Experience
* Modern, accessible and performant web development
* GraphQL client and servers libraries (we use Apollo and Strawberry)
* Basic knowledge of functional programming
* Container based deployments using Docker/Kubernetes
* Continuous integration/Continuous deployment workflows

### **Employee benefits**

* You have the freedom to decide where you work the best with our Work From Anywhere program with a one-off setup bonus included
* Generous pension plan
* Yearly budget for health, wellness and personal development
* Laptop and mobile phone of your choice with included cellular subscription
* Regular social activities such as team events, meet ups, after works and off-sites
* Daily breakfast served at the office

title: UI Designer - App
description:
**We are looking for a talented UI Designer with a passion for details to join our team and play a key role in crafting the Hemnet app - the platform where millions of Swedes discover their next home. Your work will ensure we deliver an engaging, intuitive, and high-quality experience for all users.**
 As a UI Designer in the App core team, you’ll focus on design system, concept development, and prototyping while collaborating closely with UX designers, researchers, product managers, and engineers.
   

  

 While Hemnet has years of experience building mobile apps, the App core is a new team established to drive App as a product more holistically. Together with other Product teams, we’ll shape a product that balances exceptional design with functionality.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design & Innovate: Create user-centric app designs that align with platform patterns, best practices, and brand guidelines
* Prototype & Develop Concepts: Transform ideas into prototypes that drive product development and user testing
* Collaborate Cross-Functionally: Work with UX researchers, product managers, engineers, and other designers to align design goals with product vision
* Enhance the Experience: Use motion design and micro-interactions to create seamless, delightful user experiences
* Evolve Design Systems: Contribute to and refine Hemnet’s design system to ensure consistency across the app


**What You Bring Minimum Requirements**
* Strong UI design skills, with experience designing consumer-facing apps
* Proficiency in Figma and a deep understanding of platform design patterns and best practices
* Experience designing in a product environment, with a strong understanding of end-to-end product development
* Expertise in motion design (micro-interactions) and information architecture
* Proven ability to craft exceptional UI with strong visual design skills and extensive experience in design systems
* A collaborative mindset and proven ability to work in cross-functional product teams


**Meritorious**
* Experience with iconography design, branding, and marketing design
* Familiarity with the property market or adjacent industries
* Experience adapting designs for accessibility compliance


**Who You Are**
* Driven & Self-Sufficient: You take initiative and push projects forward
* Creative Problem Solver: You blend aesthetic sensibilities with usability and design best practices
* Quality-Minded: You are meticulous, ensuring every detail enhances the user experience
* Open & Collaborative: You thrive in a team environment, constructively challenging ideas to drive better outcomes


**Why Join Us?**
 As a UI Designer at Hemnet, you’ll directly impact how millions of users discover and navigate their home-search journey. You’ll be part of a collaborative team that values creativity, innovation, and delivering an exceptional user experience. Your work will help ensure we deliver the best possible Hemnet experience for our customers.
   

  

****🏡** 
 Your career at Hemnet**
 Are you ready to play a meaningful role in one of the biggest decisions people make in life? If so – welcome to Hemnet! Since 1998, we’ve taken pride in making the life-changing, often stressful journey of finding a new home as smooth and enjoyable as possible.
   

  

 At Hemnet, our mission is to connect every seller with every buyer, empower buyers to discover every home for sale, and enable real estate agents to match seamlessly with sellers. With over 40 million monthly visits, we’re Sweden’s most popular property platform and the first choice for Swedes looking to buy or sell a home. Together, we’re creating an open, transparent housing market, making home transactions in Sweden among the most efficient in the world.
   

  

 Our success is built on a strong, friendly culture that values creativity, inclusivity, and collaboration. Hemnet is a place where everyone has a voice, and our welcoming environment helps you thrive and grow as you work alongside passionate colleagues from around the globe.
   

  

**A Hybrid Way of Working**
 Our vibrant office in central Stockholm is the hub of our collaboration and culture, providing a lively space that fosters team spirit. We come together in the office three days a week, with two flexible remote days. To be part of our team, it’s essential to be based in or near Stockholm.
   

  

 Hemnet is Sweden’s largest property platform. Since the start in 1998, we have been the natural meeting place for real estate agents, property sellers and buyers. Hemnet offers the majority of properties for sale on the market; the largest number of potential buyers; products through which sellers are able to influence the selling of their property - and products that give real estate agents the opportunity to strengthen their brand. We are one of Sweden’s largest sites and apps, and one of the most popular property platforms in the world based on population.

title: UX Designer
description:
**Who we are:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our products.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
 We make touch and eye tracking based assistive technology for people with communication and mobility challenges. The success of our products has life-changing impact on our customers. Our Research & Development Team develops the hardware, software, and other technology that makes that impact possible.
   

  

 We’re on the lookout for a UX Designer with a strong passion for accessibility and design systems to join us. In this role, you’ll create intuitive, user-focused interfaces for software, allowing individuals with communication challenges to express themselves using innovative eye-tracking technology.
   

  

**What You’ll Do:**
**Champion System Thinking:** 
 Craft scalable, reusable solutions that seamlessly align across platforms and products.
   

  

**Develop and Document Design Standards:** 
 Establish design principles, components, interaction patterns, and design tokens rooted in accessibility guidelines to promote consistency across our software suite.
   

  

**Ensure Seamless Collaboration:** 
 Prepare comprehensive design documentation for smooth handovers to our development teams.
   

  

**Collaborate Cross-Functionally:** 
 Work closely with product managers, developers, speech therapists, and fellow designers to create user-centric solutions that are aligned with our goals.
   

  

 We have a hybrid model so you will be able to have the mix of working both from our office at Löjtnantsgatan 25 and from the comfort of your own home.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For:**
* Proven UX Experience: A solid background in UX design with a portfolio that showcases your ability to deliver impactful projects. (If you don’t have a portfolio, tell us why – we’re interested in your story!)
* Design Systems Expertise: Demonstrated experience in building or maintaining a design system for multi-component, multi-platform products.
* Proficiency with Design Tools: High-level skills in Figma, Adobe XD, Sketch, or similar software (We are using Figma!)
* Excellent Communication: Strong interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively within multidisciplinary teams.


**Bonus Points For:**
* Accessibility Expertise: A strong understanding of accessibility standards (e.g., WCAG) and experience designing for users with diverse physical or cognitive abilities.


**Next step!**
 Connect with Mikaela Nilsson at mikaela.nilsson@tobiidynavox.com for any questions. Submit your resume or LinkedIn profile through our website. Please submit all application materials in English. We’re excited to learn more about you and your passion for accessible design!
   

  

**Where we stand:**
 We believe diversity not only enriches our workplace culture, but also gives us a strategic advantage. Working with people from a variety of backgrounds and perspectives helps us all become better communicators, better problem solvers, and better human beings. Our differences make us stronger.
   

  

 Tobii Dynavox values equality of opportunity, human dignity, and racial/ethnic and cultural diversity. Tobii Dynavox does not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, age, veteran status, ancestry, or national or ethnic origin.
   

  

 Equal Opportunity Employer/AA Women/Minorities/Veterans/Disabled

title: Digital Product Designer
description:
**Us** 




 Born and based in Stockholm, Sweden, POC is a safety and performance pioneer on a global mission: protect lives and reduce the consequences of accidents for athletes and anyone inspired to be one. Creating all types of protection for cycling and snow sports, POC uses research, scientific methods and rigorous testing in its pursuit of innovation. Now we’re looking for a Digital Product Designer.
 



  





**The Job** 




 We are seeking to strengthen our Brand Studio team as we look to deliver a better, more consistent experience across our ecom platform. You’ll be responsible for the generation of materials that ensure the POC website consistently demonstrates our brand identity and values, while delivering a first-rate customer experience. You will champion user-friendly, inspiring and intuitive digital design systems, as well as generate consistent visual storytelling and graphic outputs.
 



  





**What You'll Do** 



* Develop, evaluate and implement POC’s digital design systems, following alignment with the Global Art Director, graphic designers and digital channel owners.
* Apply design systems in order to maintain a consistent brand appearance across the POC website, newsletters and digital ads.
* Together with colleagues in the Brand and Digital teams, be part of strategic and physical UX and UI improvements to the POC website.
* Develop and implement ideas to improve the customer experience on the POC website, and adapt assets to deliver that experience.
* Together with the merchandising team, design, edit and deliver website assets that work to ensure all POC products are displayed as effectively as possible.
* Implement POC’s campaign storytelling on the website.
* Continually test and review (A/B tests, surveys) designs and ideas to improve the customer journey through POC’s owned digital channels, and adjust outputs based on performance analysis.



  





**You** 



* Understand the principles of UX and UI, and how to integrate them into scalable design systems.
* Have a great eye for visual storytelling and can combine this with effective user interfaces.
* Have 1–2 years of experience in conceptual design, and an understanding of user experience and usability, preferably from within ecom.
* Are as interested in creating website assets as you are in developing design systems.
* Have a bachelor’s degree in graphic design, UX, UI or similar.
* Are proficient in Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, or similar.
* Are fluent in spoken and written English.
* Preferably have skills in HTML5/CSS.
* Are tech-savvy and willing to try new tools and methods.
* Understand the principles and methods for displaying, merchandising and selling products online.
* Are experienced in making your designs implementable and can enable handover to external developers.
* Are likely to have an interest in skiing and/or cycling.



  





**Why You Want to Work Here** 



* You’ll work where the innovation happens and you’ll be a part of the journey of bringing ground-breaking products to life.
* You’ll join a passionate, skilled team where each member brings unique expertise and insight.
* There’s a friendly and uplifting atmosphere with kind, respectful and helpful colleagues.
* We love outdoor sports and have a passion for cycling and skiing. Each week, we do lunch rides andgroup outdoor training. Besides this, we have a generous health allowance, health insurance, discounted POC products and the option to participate in our product testing program.
* Besides sports, you will also enjoy a weekly office fika.



  





**What Now?** 



* If you feel you are a great fit for this role, send your CV and portfolio to brand@poc.com right away. Please apply via the e-mail and not the "Easy Apply" function here on LinkedIn as we will exclusively be looking at e-mail applications. The application deadline is 2025-01-03, but please apply as soon as possible because we will hold interviews as soon as applications come in.

title: Web Content Editor & Junior UX/UI Designer
description:
SPLIT Stockholm, an award-winning digital full-service agency, is seeking a proactive and detail-oriented 
 **Web Content Editor & Junior UX/UI Designer** 
  to join our team on a full-time basis. With diversity, design, and strategic marketing at our core, we embrace a multidisciplinary approach and value multiple perspectives to drive innovation. Join our collaborative environment that fosters creativity, inclusion, and professional growth.
 



  





**Role overview** 




 As a Web Content Editor & Junior UX/UI Designer, you will manage the accuracy, quality, and consistency of content across multiple global websites while also supporting the web team in enhancing the overall user experience. You will build pages using the CMS, ensure compliance with brand guidelines, and contribute to UX/UI improvements that align with our clients’ objectives.
 



  





**Key responsibilities** 




  





**Content editing and management:** 



* Edit and publish content across multiple global websites.
* Build and update pages within the CMS.
* Ensure all web content is accurate, up-to-date, and adheres to brand guidelines.
* Conduct audits and quality assurance checks to identify bugs, issues, and areas for improvement.



  





**Content quality:** 



* Uphold high editorial standards and consistency in all published materials.
* Perform regular quality checks to maintain content integrity.
* Ensure compliance with accessibility standards, making content available to users of all abilities.



  





**User experience (UX) & design support:** 



* Collaborate with the team to enhance site structure and navigation to improve user experience.
* Assist in creating wireframes, UI elements, and page layouts under the guidance of senior designers.
* Contribute to ongoing UX research, testing, and iteration to optimize design solutions.



  





**Collaboration & coordination:** 



* Work closely with stakeholders to plan and execute prioritized tasks and initiatives.
* Provide guidance and feedback to content creators and external contributors to maintain high-quality content standards.
* Support web migrations and contribute to executing the global web roadmap.



  





**Qualifications and skills** 



* Minimum of 2 years’ experience in web content editing or management, preferably in a digital agency or global brand environment.
* Familiarity with UX/UI principles, experience in basic wireframing, and working knowledge of design tools (e.g., Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD).
* Proficiency with Content Management Systems (CMS).
* Understanding of SEO, accessibility standards, and best practices for web content and design.
* Fluent in both Swedish and English, with strong writing and editing skills in both languages.
* Attention to detail, the ability to manage multiple deadlines, and strong communication skills.



  





**What we offer you** 



* Competitive salary.
* Access to comprehensive health, medical, life, and rehabilitation insurance covering physical and mental well-being.
* Flexible working hours and hybrid work opportunities.
* Professional development opportunities and educational grants.



  





 If you’re ready to build digital experiences – combining meticulous content management with evolving UX/UI design skills – we’d love to hear from you. Join SPLIT Stockholm and help us elevate digital storytelling and user engagement for clients around the world.

title: Grafisk Designer
company_industry: Environmental Services, Engineering Services, and Industrial Machinery Manufacturing
description:
*Brinner du för en hållbar framtid? Kom och jobba på ett ledande globalt miljöteknikföretag* 




  





**Arbetsbeskrivning** 




 Vi söker en passionerad grafisk designer för att stötta upp vårt grafiska designteam. Mellifiq producerar kontinuerligt stora mängder innehåll (content) som ett resultat av all den research, laboratorietestning, och komplexa lösningar vi erbjuder våra kunder. Det innehåll vi producerar används i kommunikations-, marknadsförings- och utbildningssyfte för både kunder, leverantörer och anställda runt om i världen. Vi producerar majoriteten av all grafisk design in-house.
 



  





 Tjänsten är placerad i Hägersten, Stockholm.
 



  





**Din profil** 




 Vi tror att du är en kreativ grafisk designer som har ett genuint intresse för kommunikation och hur budskap kan förstärkas med hjälp av grafisk form. Du har en förmåga att visualisera dina idéer. Vi är en digital organisation och du behöver besitta ett tekniskt intresse och kunskaper i hur du arbetar i digitala verktyg. Vi tror på lärande under tiden du arbetar och på personlig utveckling på jobbet, det finns goda möjligheter att växa både i din egen kunskap och din position i företaget
 



  





**Kvalifikationer** 



* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom grafisk design eller annat relevant område
* Goda kunskaper i Adobe sviten såsom Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, After Effects etc.
* Förståelse för UX design, responsive interface, typografi, färg och form samt grunderna i SEO och SEM
* Behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift
* Körkort



  





**Meriter** 



* Erfarenhet av att jobba i WordPress & Microsoft Office
* Erfarenhet inom rörlig grafik, foto, film, video, animering och illustration
* Erfarenhet av marknadsföring inom sociala medier & visuella identiteter



  





 Anställningsform: Tillsvidare
 



 Startdatum: Omgående, enligt överenskommelse
 



 Arbetstid: Heltid
 



  





 Vi läser ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.

title: Product Manager - Find & Discover
description:
**Are you an experienced Product Manager ready to make an impact at scale? As our Product Manager, you’ll lead the strategy and execution for the core of our consumer experience, where 9 out of 10 Swedes find their next home.**
 In this role, you’ll collaborate with cross-functional teams to build exceptional search, filtering, and map experiences. With millions relying on us daily, you’ll drive solutions that balance the needs of users, business objectives, and our long-term product vision.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Lead Strategically: Define and communicate a compelling vision and long-term goals for the Find & Discover product, ensuring alignment with company objectives
* Collaborate Cross-Functionally: Partner with tech, UX, analytics, and business stakeholders to ensure seamless product development and impactful launches
* Deliver Impact: Enable high-quality product releases by removing roadblocks, facilitating quick decisions, and fostering an experimental mindset
* Prioritize the Customer: Drive discovery, testing, and feedback to continuously improve the user experience
* Make Data-Driven Decisions: Track and analyze key product metrics, partnering with analytics to run experiments and iterate effectively
* Inspire and Lead: Empower your team to challenge assumptions, focus on priorities, and deliver results collaboratively across departments
* Solve Complex Problems: Navigate ambiguity with a clear, adaptable approach to drive meaningful outcomes for both users and the business
* Champion Growth: Continuously refine processes and encourage feedback to support personal and team development


**What You'll Bring**
* 5+ years of Product Management experience in consumer-facing and app contexts
* Proven experience with Search and Discovery products—ideally at companies mature in experimentation
* Understanding of recommendation systems, personalization, and/or SEO and marketing technologies is a strong plus
* A track record of delivering impactful results in fast-moving, scaling environments
* Experience in tech scale-ups or mature organizations where you’ve built or optimized large-scale products
* Exceptional leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills, with the ability to inspire cross-functional teams
* A passion for creating user-centric products that balance business and technical needs


**Why Join Us?**
 You’ll play a pivotal role in shaping how millions of users discover their next home. If you’re ready to lead a product that touches millions and thrives in an environment of experimentation and discovery, we want to hear from you.
   

  

**Your career at Hemnet**
 Are you ready to play a meaningful role in one of the biggest decisions people make in life? If so – welcome to Hemnet! Since 1998, we’ve taken pride in making the life-changing, often stressful journey of finding a new home as smooth and enjoyable as possible.
   

  

 At Hemnet, our mission is to connect every seller with every buyer, empower buyers to discover every home for sale, and enable real estate agents to match seamlessly with sellers. With over 40 million monthly visits, we’re Sweden’s most popular property platform and the first choice for Swedes looking to buy or sell a home. Together, we’re creating an open, transparent housing market, making home transactions in Sweden among the most efficient in the world.
   

  

 Our success is built on a strong, friendly culture that values creativity, inclusivity, and collaboration. Hemnet is a place where everyone has a voice, and our welcoming environment helps you thrive and grow as you work alongside passionate colleagues from around the globe.
   

  

**A Hybrid Way of Working**
 Our vibrant office in central Stockholm is the hub of our collaboration and culture, providing a lively space that fosters team spirit. We come together in the office three days a week, with two flexible remote days. To be part of our team, it’s essential to be based in or near Stockholm.
   

  

 Hemnet is Sweden’s largest property platform. Since the start in 1998, we have been the natural meeting place for real estate agents, property sellers and buyers. Hemnet offers the majority of properties for sale on the market; the largest number of potential buyers; products through which sellers are able to influence the selling of their property - and products that give real estate agents the opportunity to strengthen their brand. We are one of Sweden’s largest sites and apps, and one of the most popular property platforms in the world based on population.

title: Product Owner - Foundation
description:
*Are you ready to take the redefine the financial industry? Are you looking to leave an impact on the financial lives and futures of over 2 million customers across the Nordics? Then Nordnet is the place for you!*
**In brief**
 At Nordnet, we exist to democratize savings and investments. Through leading UX, cutting edge financial products, and automated and inspiring customer journeys, we are building the best platform for savings and investments – enabling higher returns for our customers. Nordnet is customer-focused and product led.
   

  

 We are looking for an ambitious and driven Product Owner to join our team and lead the teams in the Foundation domain. This domain is the backbone of our services, managing customer onboarding, account creation, and managing credit and payment. You will play a pivotal role in enhancing our platform to deliver seamless and secure experiences for our customers.
   

  

**This is part of the role**
 Overall, you will make sure we stay competitive within savings and investments. On a daily basis, you will be working alongside the business with your talented engineering team. You will solve complex problems and drive discovery & delivery of new products and services to our customers. You will prioritize the development backlog, define requirements and keep development team updated with information.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Drive product innovation to secure and maintain a leading position in a competitive landscape.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to prioritize the development backlog and ensure alignment with business goals.
* Guide and lead development teams in solving customer problems and improving the overall user experience.
* Break down large initiatives into smaller, actionable deliverables and establish agile go-to-market strategies.


**This is you**
 You have deep interest within savings and investments and you also have previous working knowledge and experience from digital product development within financial services sector. You most likely have some technical or analytical experience and as a person, you are driven, creative and have great teamwork skills!
   

  

**You Have**
* A minimum of 3 years of experience as product owner or similar role within financial services
* Passion for creating smooth and effortless customer journeys, enabling the experience of saving and investing.
* Ability to navigate the complex, competitive, and regulated finance landscape
* High personal initiative with a natural ability to lead by example, inspire others, and drive results


**We offer**
 Nordnet started from a passionate belief that changing the hierarchic financial world was possible. We became part of redefining the industry when we gave the customers power over their own savings. You will become part of a journey that has only yet started towards the vision of making our customers the best investors they can be. To be leading in Tech is pivotal for that journey and you will work with colleagues who have a great passion for that goal.
   

  

 We are over 900 employees in Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen. We cooperate, exchange ideas and use our core competencies in order to continuously improve the way we meet our customers. Open communication, creativity and engagement are important parts of our everyday life at the office.
   

  

 Since November 2020, Nordnet (SAVE) is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm main market with a market capitalisation of SEK40bn.
   

  

 Visit us on: www.nordnetab.com, www.nordnet.se, www.nordnet.no, www.nordnet.dk, www.nordnet.fi
   

  

 Check out our app at: https://apps.apple.com/se/app/nordnet/id345038631 and https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.nordnet&hl=en&gl=US
   

  

**Application**
 If you have questions, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner, Keri Bergström Käll at keri.bergstrom.kall@nordnet.se
   

  

 Please apply today by using the button below – we will start interviewing immediately.
   

  

 Please note that we do only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered.
   

  

 We want to inform you that Nordnet conduct, drug test, credit and background checks on the final candidate.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: UX-lead
description:
Inera är ett digitaliseringsbolag som bidrar till att utveckla välfärden. Vi är Sveriges digitala ingång till hälsa, vård och omsorg och utvecklar digital infrastruktur för en sammanhållen välfärd. Vi arbetar på uppdrag av kommuner och regioner. Vår vision är världens mest innovativa och omtänksamma välfärd.
   

  

 För att kunna upprätthålla hög kvalitet inom hälsa, vård och omsorg måste välfärden utvecklas, med oförändrade eller minskade resurser. Genom digitalisering – att förändra strukturer, beteenden och arbetssätt med stöd av digital teknik – kan flera av välfärdens utmaningar mötas. Det gör Ineras uppdrag viktigare än någonsin.
   

  

**Om rollen** 
  

  

 Vi söker en UX-designer för rollen UX-lead. Som UX-lead på Inera har du en nyckelposition i vårt strategiska och operativa UX-arbete. Du tillhör sektionen för tjänstearkitektur och design som har en central roll i att skapa hållbara och effektiva digitala lösningar. Vi säkerställer att moderna arbetssätt, tydliga riktlinjer och processer finns på plats i syfte att möjliggöra ett heltäckande tjänstearkitektur- och UX-arbete. En viktig del av vårt arbete är att förvalta och utveckla vårt UX-ramverk, vilket innehåller vårt designsystem, riktlinjer och metoder. Ramverket guidar oss i att skapa användarvänliga och innovativa lösningar för våra slutanvändare.
   

  

 Du leder arbetet med att identifiera, analysera och konkretisera krav och behov, vilket skapar grunden för UI-designers att vidareutveckla lösningar när de är redo för utveckling. Du samordnar UX-arbetet och samarbetar med både interna UX-resurser och externa UI-designers. Rollen ger dig möjlighet att utveckla din kompetens inom ett brett spektrum av UX-områden, från research och design till tillgänglighet och användarflöden.
   

  

 Du kommer även att ha en centra roll i att driva UX-arbetet inom projekt och utvecklingsområden. I denna roll bidrar till att forma framtidens digitala tjänster och skapa verklig nytta för användarna. Arbete sker i ett team med cirka 10 medarbetare och i nära samarbete med UI-designers från våra leverantörer. x
   

  

**Är det här du?** 
  

  

 Vi söker dig med minst fem års erfarenhet av UX och en relevant utbildning inom området. Du har kunskap inom UX-research och behovsanalys och är insatt i att arbeta med tillgänglighet och inkluderande design. Du har god kännedom om WCAG, och en certifiering inom området är meriterande.
   

  

 Du är skicklig på att omvandla behov till användarvänliga lösningar och har erfarenhet av att leda UX-arbete inom större projekt eller utvecklingsområden. Med god förståelse för tekniska förutsättningar och begränsningar bidrar du till att skapa hållbara och effektiva designlösningar. Specialistkompetens inom områden som datadriven research och design, UX-copywriting eller tillgänglighet är en extra merit.
   

  

**Varaktighet och tillträde** 
  

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Intervjuer kommer ske löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan ansökningstidens slut.
   

  

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?** 
  

  

 Richard Frank, chef Tjänstearkitektur och design (richard.frank@inera.se)
   

  

 Andreas Melin, UX-strateg (andreas.melin@inera.se)
   

  

*Fackliga frågor (Vision), Monica Rosén, monica.rosen@inera.se*

title: Technical Designer - Games
description:
We’re on the lookout for a Technical Designer to join one of our game teams—a group of about 100 awesome folks working together to create something amazing.
 



  





 In this role, you’ll be the bridge between design and code, bringing ideas to life by creating, implementing, and refining tools, systems, and workflows. It’s a chance to collaborate, innovate, and help shape the game from the ground up.
 



  





**What you’ll be doing:** 




  




* Build prototypes to help the design team experiment with cool new features.
* Spot technical challenges in designs and offer clever solutions or tweaks.
* Suggest and implement improvements for design tools and workflows.
* Work on gameplay systems like environmental destruction to make them balanced and fun.
* Team up with other disciplines to ensure designs align with tech pipelines.



  





**What we’d love to see:** 




  




* At least 3 years of experience as a technical designer in game development.
* A knack for AAA PvP gameplay and systems design, plus an understanding of player psychology and UX.
* Experience with Unreal Engine (bonus points if you know your way around blueprints or UnrealEngine-Angelscript).
* Familiarity with programming languages like C#, Lua, or Python.
* A creative, curious mindset and a love for collaboration.
* Some knowledge of other game-making areas like animation, physics, or 3D art.
* Great communication skills in English.



  





**What’s in it for you?** 




  





 We offer competitive pay, a supportive team of passionate creators, and an environment where you can grow and thrive. Most importantly, you’ll get to help shape something incredible alongside a bunch of like-minded game enthusiasts.
 



  





 We welcome people from every walk of life. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you’re from, or how you identify—if you love making games, there’s a place for you here.
 



  





 So, what are you waiting for? Be yourself, make some amazing games, and let’s create something unforgettable together. Apply today—we can’t wait to meet you!

title: Engineering Manager
description:
**Company Description**
 Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  

 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

**Job Description**
**Visa’s Technology Organization** 
 is a community of problem solvers and innovators reshaping the future of commerce. We operate the world’s most sophisticated processing networks capable of handling more than 65k secure transactions a second across 80M merchants, 15k Financial Institutions, and billions of everyday people. While working with us you’ll get to work on complex distributed systems and solve massive scale problems centered on new payment flows, business and data solutions, cyber security, and B2C platforms.
   

  

 We are seeking a Engineering Manager to Tink - delivering open banking solutions as a part of Visa, to the Customer Experience team. The Customer Experience team has a clear mission: to deliver world-class product experiences to its customers. We provide powerful solutions to developers and their consumers. By solving the right problem, crafting a scalable solution, and providing great experiences, we make the platform easy to use, quick to onboard, and we ensure reliable outcomes for the end-user. That is why front-end development and UX design are core to us at Customer Experience. The Customer Experience area is unique with its set up of front-end and full-stack teams. With this, you will have the opportunity to not only develop the people and products we own but also how Tink as a whole work with frontend development and UX. We believe that there are a lot of things to be done and an opportunity for someone to grow within their role.
   

  

**What you will do:**
 Even though we have a broad mandate, there are some parts of the Tink experience we are especially passionate about. See more of the work we do and a few use cases here.
   

  

 We use React, TypeScript, Golang, MySQL, node.js and all our microservices run on Kubernetes in AWS. We regularly deploy to production and assure quality by automated tests and monitoring. The team is responsible for the availability of the services it owns, has SLOs/SLIs in place as well as an on-call rotation.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Drive technical development and provide leadership in an innovative and fast-paced environment
* Build high performing teams to support a cross-functional team composed of backend and frontend engineers
* Work closely with product manager and designers to ensure we're building products in the best way
* Enable the team to reach their targets by removing impediments, clarifying goals and initiatives, and fostering ownership and accountability
* Facilitate a culture of learning, trust, responsibility, and friendliness
* Be responsible for the overall planning, execution and deliver on agreed timelines
* Make sure the team has the talent it needs to succeed long-term by hiring great people


 We strongly believe in the power of collaboration, both within our team and in partnership with other teams and stakeholders. Working together is the cornerstone of building exceptional teams, delivering outstanding products, and fostering personal growth. It forms the very essence of our work culture and defines how we operate.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 We are looking for an Engineering Manager who has a business-oriented mindset, understands how projects and delivery influences business growth and sees the link between engineering and product development. Someone who is great at managing change and changing priorities.
   

  

* Experience from an Engineering Manager position, leading a cross-functional engineering team.
* Experience from frontend and backend engineering, we use node.js for our backend services
* A track record of operational excellence and have led a change initiative, for example taking a project or team from A to B.
* Solid experience from working in an agile development environment, preferably from a fintech/payments industry.
* Strong organizational and prioritization skills along with outstanding written and verbal communication skills.


 This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Technical Watermark Designer
description:
**Crane Currency has an immediate position opening for a Technical Watermark Deisgner, Based out of TUMBA.** 




  





**Who We Are** 




 Crane Currency is a premier industrial technology company and a pioneer in currency manufacturing and advanced micro-optics technology for securing physical products. Yes, chances are you have our product in your wallet right now! Our sophisticated equipment and software leverages proprietary core capabilities with detection and sensing technologies. Around the world, our customers trust us to anticipate their needs with innovative, reliable, and high-quality currency & authentication solutions and services—just as they have for generations.
 



  





**How You Will Make An Impact** 




 This role provides you an opportunity where millions of people one day may be holding your design work. Our customers look to you and the global design team to bring their dreams into reality. You will be involved with projects to design our customers’ currency and security products. You will partner with internal stakeholders to help expand our brand awareness and employer proposition. Your work will be captured globally on both Currency and Consumer brands.
 



  





 As a Technical Watermark Designer at Crane You Will:
 


* Create designs for customers from procurement that become technical specification and contribute to new customers and markets for Crane Currency.
* Understand the market and customer demand to meet both design and technical design.
* Design standard watermark for customer s based on substrate or demand.
* Design drawings (sheet layouts) with associated substrates for paper production and sheeting.
* Ensure that all production documentation from specified documentation from design is available at the start of production.
* Produce technical documentation for the tablecloth production according to plan and be responsible for ensuring that the documentation meets the customer's demand regarding aesthetics, safety, production and quality requirements.
* Ensure that digital documentation meets the customer's expectations after production.
* Responsibility of developing the design of Window Wire.



  





**Required** 




**Knowledge and expertise that matter most for this role:** 



* Education: Technical Univeristy Degree alternatively College engineering with several years of documented experience from Design and Manufacturing.
* Language: Good knowledge of Swedish and Englisish (verbally and written)
* IT : Good knowledge of Microsoft Office package, Graphic Software such as Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator and Corel Draw.



  





**Preferred :** 



* Experience from LEAN and working with Continuous Improvement.



  





  





**How We Will Care For You** 



* Top- notch medical benefits – We take care of you with our wellness allowance and reimbursement for medicines and medical care .
* Personal development – We want you to grow with us . Through lunch & learns , career ladders and more .
* Community Engagement – Give yourself time to support the local community and environment through volunteer events and on-site initiatives to benefit local communities and organizations .
* There’s more – Competitive compensation, vacation, parental leave, and retirement plans.



  





**What Drives Our Team** 




 We are a passionate team of 1,200 creators and problem solvers, united by our purpose, we give people confidence every day in moments that matter. This comes to life through our Shared Values:
 


* People Matter
* Do the Right Thing
* Trusted Partner
* Innovate for Growth
* Always Improving



  





 People are at the center of all that we do, from our employees to our customers and our communities. We empower our teams to help shape the Crane Currency experience, embracing and celebrating our unique perspectives and differences to learn from each other and grow stronger together. To learn more about life at Crane Currency, visit.
 



  





**Where We Are** 




 Your role is in Tumba, Stockholm , located in the historic Tumba Bruk area, 10 -minute walking distance from the train station, 30 km south of Stockholm, and about 20 minutes from Stockholm Central Station. Tumba is a small suburb in an area with different cultures from all corners of the world. The area offers a beautiful landscape and countryside feeling. You can spend the day to explore the shopping mall nearby, enjoy the surrounding nature, or take the train into the vibrant pulse of Stockholm City to enjoy the many restaurants, shopping, sightseeing and stroll through beautiful Downtown, Gamla Stan.
 



  





 Crane Currency is a drug free workplace.
 



 Crane NXT is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, or national origin or any other characteristic protected under applicable local law.

 #ONSITE
 



 LI-KP1
