title: Technical Support, Exam.net
description:
**About Teachiq**

Teachiq is a product led Edtech company. We develop and market products for schools and universities both in Sweden and internationally. Many of us who work at Teachiq have a background in the classroom or in tech companies (Spotify, eBay, Google, etc.). What we all have in common is that we highly value the teacher role in society and want to simplify their everyday life.

At the moment we have two products:

* Kunskapsmatrisen, or KM, targets teachers in Swedish schools. With KM the teacher can access question banks to build exams, conduct and mark the exams, give feedback to students and let the students work on their own. KM is tied to the Swedish curriculum and used across 1500 Swedish schools.
* Exam.net is an online platform for creating and conducting secure digital exams in schools and universities. Between 50 000 - 100 000 exams are conducted each day across paying customers in more than 100 countries. Exam.net is the most used platform for digital examination, including National Examinations, in Sweden.

Teachiq is profitable and not dependent on external financing, allowing us to work with a long term perspective and focus in the direction we believe is right. We currently have 40+ employees divided between our two offices in Stockholm and in Gothenburg. We are growing, and we are now looking to grow our technical customer support, increasing the Gothenburg support team from 2 full time employees to 3, whereof 2 (including yourself) will be working primarily with the Exam.net product. As part of our technical support team you will work with hands-on customer support as well as structuring and documenting our processes and help material - both internal and external. You will be an important link in our understanding of our customer journey, and you will interact with our developer team, our product team and Sales team. The role will be based in our Gothenburg office (at Stenpiren, Stora Badhusgatan 18-20).

Teachiq is a value driven company and our five guiding principles serve as guidance in our strategic decision making:

**#1 Focus on the teachers**

Teachiq is built on the principle that teachers are the experts regarding how education should be conducted.

**# 2 Win through product**

The long game is won through our products. While big customers are important, the long game is won by solving our user's most important problems.

**#3 Make more money than we spend**

To maintain our independence and avoid short term optimization, we wish to remain without outside funding.

**#4 Be persistent and take opportunities as they arise**

We do not always know when, where or in what shape digitization will come next so it is key that we be persistent, flexible and receptive to signals.

**#5 Be genuine and reliable**

We are authentic in our ambitions and what we say is true. We should be a reliable partner, for example in terms of financial stability, by being fair in pricing and having good customer support.

**About the role**

As a technical customer support member at Teachiq and Exam.net, you will work together with other customer support team members to triage, handle and monitor the overall level of customer support cases, primarily handled in our Service Cloud in Salesforce. Our team serves both Swedish and international customers and you will work closely with other teams such as Product, Sales and Development in order to improve our product and give our users excellent support.

In addition to technical customer support your tasks will involve support related administrative tasks, light testing and preparation of cases in order for 3rd line to take over. We also expect you to support the effort to prevent cheating during exams. We have underlying systems that flag suspicious behaviors or technical configurations, but there is also a manual component to analyze these signals and potentially notify the teachers.

There is some flexibility in the role, but we generally expect you to be on-site at the Gothenburg office 4 days per week. Our office is located at Stenpiren in central Gothenburg and the support opening hours are aligned with when Swedish schools are open, workdays (Mon-Fri) from 8am to 5pm.

**Core Responsibilities**

* Responsible for handling incoming support cases through various channels (email, phone, web)
* Triaging and monitoring overall support levels
* Investigating technically challenging cases to prepare for 2nd or 3rd line support to take over
* Writing and improving help articles to facilitate customer self service
* Cooperating with other departments in order to improve processes, provide insights or collaborate on matrix related issues
* Take on administrative product related tasks
* Analyze signals in our cheating filters and manage communication with teachers.

**Qualifications**

* Gymnasieutbildning
* +2 years of work life experience from a service role within a school organization or from a classic customer support role, now looking for the next step
* Hands-on experience with Ticketing systems like Salesforce, Imbox or Freshdesk
* Fluency in both Swedish and English, both spoken and written, is required.

**Soft Skills**

* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex events in an understandable way and find solutions and workarounds for our users
* Calm and assertive - you are motivated by seeking answers and finding solutions, even in stressful situations
* Structured - you like to find patterns and documenting what you know, you take pride in providing other teams with the information they need
* Enjoys working both on your own and as part of a team
* Curious and solution driven - you enjoy finding solutions and answers on your own but are not afraid to ask for help when you need it
* You have an understanding of the school environment and the challenges that teachers and students face on a daily basis
* Collaborative team player with the ability to work cross-functionally.

**Summary - so, who are we looking for?**

We are looking for a customer support member who enjoys working at a friendly company with high ambitions, in a small but dedicated team and who is driven by delivering excellent customer support. To do that, one must be willing to work alone, and in teams, seek help but also rely on your own initiative and abilities. This role goes beyond the traditional customer support and offers more challenging tasks that require technical understanding and a positive resolution oriented attitude.

Someone with strong communication skills, and who is able to express themselves in both writing and orally, in English and Swedish. Someone who enjoys the challenge of mixed IT environments, various markets and languages.

Someone who maybe has worked with IT administration in a school environment? Or perhaps has experience as second-line support?

Regardless, if you feel that you match the description above, we would love to hear from you. We are publishing this ad now before the holidays but won't be able to answer any questions or provide feedback until after the holidays, in mid-January. However, you are warmly welcome to go ahead and submit your CV to our Head of Support, christina.torkelsson@km.se.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: 33 000,00kr - 38 000,00kr per month

Application Question(s):

* Uttrycker du dig obehindrat, trevligt och språkligt korrekt på svenska och engelska, både i tal och i skrift?

Work Location: In person

Expected Start Date: 17-02-2025

title: Sales executive- Creative tech
description:
- **Devoteam is a leading IT consulting company with strong roots in Malmö's tech community, both as Devoteam and formerly Jayway. We have been around for 25 years and operate in 30 countries with over 11,000 employees. In Sweden (Creative Tech), we focus on innovative, tailor-made solutions based on long-term partnerships.**

**We are driven by a passion for technology and innovation and are committed to creating long-term relationships with both customers and employees. We offer services and comprehensive solutions in cloud, data, app modernization, product design, and more. Among our initiatives is** **Øredev** **, one of Scandinavia's largest developer conferences, which we co-founded.**

  
We are currently looking for a skilled Sales Executive with a focus on account management and lead generation. The workplace for this role is Malmö and surrounding areas, at Devoteam Malmö´s office 3 days per week.


**Drive Digital Transformation: Become a Creative tech Sales Executive**

As a Sales Executive for Creative tech at Devoteam, you will play a crucial role in expanding our footprint across the Swedish region.
  

  

**You will be responsible for:**

* Hunting for New Business: Identify and acquire new customers with a focus on medium-sized businesses, generating leads and building strong relationships with key decision-makers.
* Driving Revenue Growth: Develop and execute sales strategies to achieve ambitious targets, exceeding customer expectations and contributing to Devoteam's continued success.
* Mastering the Sales Cycle: Own the entire sales process, from initial contact and needs analysis to proposal development, negotiation, and closing deals.
* Collaborating with Experts: Work closely with our software developer teams, leveraging their expertise to deliver tailored solutions that meet client needs.
* Building Long-Term Partnerships: Cultivate strong relationships with existing clients, identifying opportunities to expand our services and ensure their ongoing success with Creative tech.
* Staying Ahead of the Curve: Maintain a deep understanding of the evolving Software ecosystem, including new products, services, and market trends.

**Success Stories:**

"Joining Devoteam in the Nordics has been a transformative experience. The support from the local tech teams and the clear growth path have enabled me to consistently exceed my sales targets."
  

— Aliha Mahmood, Junior Sales, Sweden


"Transitioning from Google to Devoteam has been a remarkable experience. The collaborative culture and unwavering commitment to innovation at Devoteam have empowered me to utilize my Google Cloud expertise to its fullest potential. Working with cutting-edge Google Cloud solutions here has significantly advanced my career and allowed me to deliver exceptional value to our clients."
  

— Thomas Brunn, Sales Executive, Norway


**Territory:**

* You'll be assigned named enterprise accounts within clearly defined and protected territories across the Malmö, Stockholm or Linköping region.
* Focus industries include Manufacturing, Retail, and Financial Services, with opportunities to expand into other sectors.

  
* **Proven Hunter:** Demonstrated success in acquiring new customers and closing deals in the IT project business, with a focus on software and team-delivery.
* **Solution-Oriented Mindset:** Ability to understand client challenges and translate them into effective solutions.
* **Strong Communication & Presentation Skills:** Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively articulate the value proposition of Devoteam Creative tech.
* **Relationship Builder:** A natural networker who can build rapport and establish trust with clients and internal stakeholders.
* **Results-Driven:** Highly motivated and results-oriented, with a strong work ethic and a commitment to exceeding expectations.
* **Fluent in Swedish and English:** Excellent written and spoken Swedish and English skills are essential. Fluency in a Nordic language is a plus.

  
- **What Devoteam Offers**


	* An exciting and challenging role in an international company.
	* Opportunity to work with the latest technologies and solutions.
	* A flexible and innovative work environment.**Benefits and Practical Information**


	* Paid vacation and pension: We offer 30 days of vacation and occupational pension similar to ITP1.
	* Health and well-being: Health checks over 35+, health grants 5000 SEK, and lunch yoga/ group exercise at the office.
	* Equipment: You choose tools, either Mac or PC.**Application**  

To apply, please submit your application via the link. We encourage early applications as we review them continuously.


For any questions, please contact our recruiter Sanna Ekelöf. Sanna will be your primary contact throughout the recruitment process.
company_description: Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms, cybersecurity and business transformation.

title: Regional Vice President - North
description:
Build the future of the AI Data Cloud. Join the Snowflake team.


The RVP - North role is a unique opportunity to contribute in a meaningful way to high visibility, high impact projects at a very exciting time for the company. Snowflake is an innovative, high-growth, customer-focused company in a large and growing market. If you are an energetic, self-managed professional with experience managing a complex sales process and possess excellent presentation and listening skills, organization and contact management capabilities, we’d love to hear from you. The North region at Snowflake includes Nordics, Benelux and Switzerland markets.


### **AS AN RVP YOU WILL:**

* Have an in depth understanding on Snowflake's product to be able to provide guidance on selling, navigating complex legal negotiations, helping eliminate technical barriers, managing escalations
* Hire a team of leaders and individual contributors that fit Snowflake's profile for success
* Enable, coach, develop and motivate a robust field sales team
* Scaling and developing territories by planning strategically and effectively assigning accounts
* Navigate complex legal negotiations and help eliminate technical barriers
* Ensure success of events by collaborating with marketing efforts and being accountable for attendance
* Accelerate Time to Capacity Agreement: Ensure execution during sales cycle (Effective POC, Champion's decks, Partner Alignment, Services Alignment)
* Ensure customers are set up for success and are consuming Snowflake effectively (Strategic account planning with team, ensuring
* Customer Advisory Services is engaged, Monitor consumption of all customers, Product Management engagement, C-Level Engagement)
* Manage weekly forecast meetings with the Area Vice President, EMEA Sales
* Develop an in region partner network (i.e. SIs and Ecosystem partners like Tableau, AWS, Microsoft, Google, etc.)

### **AS AN RVP, YOU WILL HAVE:**

* Extensive experience building & managing teams of leaders and individual contributors within the designated countries
* The ability to manage and motivate the team and drive them to success
* Pro-active, independent mind set with high energy and a positive attitude
* Ability to think strategically and understand the "bigger picture" along with the business drivers around it


Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.


How do you want to make your impact?

title: Bachelor's Thesis 2025 - Lossless compression of data sets
description:
Location


Linköping
Apply by


2025-02-21
What's in your future? Time to apply for a Master's Thesis!


Objective



This Bachelor's Thesis will investigate and implement a lossless compression of NIRA data sets.



Keywords: Lossless compression of structured data, embedded development with limited resources.



Summary



In NIRA products, there are parameter sets that is specific for different types of vehicles, tires and more. These parameters can be collected in a dataset and one dataset can contain several mapping blocks.



Investigate and implement compression and decompression of a dataset for less footprint in ROM with limited amount of CPU and RAM.



Scope


* Literature study of existing lossless compression algorithms
* Investigate existing structure of mapping blocks/datasets and draw conclusions to decide on a strategy for compression/decompression.
* Use chosen strategy and applicable algorithm(s) to implement compression/decompression of NIRA datasets on NIRA master branch.
* Suggest improvements for the future.
* This project is planned for two students to complete together. You will have a mentor and a dedicated team that will support you all the way.

Your profile



We are looking for an engineering student who is studying a Bachelors's program with a specialization in Computer or Electronics Engineering, or equivalent. Knowledge within any of the following areas is beneficial:


* Software development
* Embedded development
* C/C++/Python


NIRA uses Bazel as build system and Git as code version control system.



We expect you to have a solid academic record, be driven, take initiative, and work independently. You will be carrying out the thesis at our head office in Linköping.



We are looking forward to your application! Remember to include a personal letter, CV, and course listing with grades. We will be screening applications on a rolling basis. The earliest expected start date is April 2025.


**About NIRA**



We at NIRA believe in making roads safer by developing sophisticated software solutions for passenger cars. The Road Surface Information cloud platform is a family of products with a common aim of improving the safety and comfort of our roads. The primary input is data from millions of cars carrying NIRA's sensor fusion algorithm, and based on the output and our cloud algorithms, we are providing a complete view of the state of the road surface and vehicle surroundings in our cloud applications.



You are welcome to NIRA for who you are, no matter where you come from or what kind of transportation you prefer. Our work on future services focuses on all modes of transportation for everyone, including our workplace. The more diverse our experience, the more brilliant we will be in advancing a sustainable transportation system.

title: Security Analyst
description:
The Security Analysts are the first line of defence, and the ones who detect, investigate, and respond to incoming incidents, investigations, and alerts. They make sure to prioritise what needs attention and to be handled first based on an analyse of urgency and criticality of the event. This role is taking the first actions on an incident to minimize the harm and secure the environment, it is securing the first evidence of compromise and documenting the process.  

  



**Key responsibilities**

**Overall areas of responsibility and activities.**

* Perform Security Engineering tasks (build, maintain and further develop) in Azure (Sentinel), Microsoft 365, AWS and any other solutions managed by Northvolt.
* Proactively work towards continual improvements of security processes, tools and routines.
* Configure, troubleshoot, and maintain security infrastructure software and hardware.
* Monitor systems for irregular behaviour, set up preventive measures and use-cases.
* Develop, execute, and track the performance of security measures to protect information and network infrastructure, devices, and systems.
* Define and continuously improve the way of working based on the cybersecurity architecture and the needs of the organization.
* Support the different disciplines within the Cyber Defence Centre (and extended Security team) in creating/enhancing capabilities and workflows.



Apply with CV in English or your complete LinkedIn profile.


Full time employment, fixed salary.
  

Planned starting date is asap.


*Please note that candidates considered for employment with NV may be subject to a mandatory background check process.*


*Please note that any applications submitted via email or direct messaging will not be considered.*


Skills & Requirements


**We believe that you have** **:**


* A bachelor's degree in related field or equivalent work experience. Practical experience as a Security Analyst in a SOC setting or related position is a plus
* Proven knowledge of security monitoring and incident response handling, cyber threat mitigation using SIEM tools and Cloud Security Engineering.
* Sound and broad technical knowledge of networks, platforms, operating systems and programming languages, including cloud technologies
* Knowledge of threat intelligence, threat hunting, vulnerability management, and handling of sensitive investigations.

**Specific skills:**

* Broad understanding of cyber threats including common attack vectors, TTP’s and attribution and its relation to frameworks and standards, like MITRE.
* Understanding of security platforms and systems including anti-virus applications, content filtering, firewalls, authentication systems and intrusion detection and notification systems.
* Knowledge of identity and access management principles.
* Knowledge of SOC best practices and practical ways of working.
* Experience and interest in OT-security and in manufacturing industry is a plus.
* Relevant security certifications like CCNP, GIAC, SCA, CISSP is a plus.

**Personal success factors:**

* Excellent communication skills with fluency in written and verbal English, Swedish is a plus
* Appreciate and see a strength in collaborating with colleagues from different areas of expertise and experience
* Proudly share knowledge and happily guide and support colleagues
* Ability to work under high pressure and tight deadlines, with excellent time management
* Proven problem-solving and critical thinking skills
* Passionate & purpose drive
* Curious with a strong sense of right and wrong. Always objective, unbiased and ethical
Great Place to Work


Top specialists as team peers


International environment


Fast paced & entrepreneurial culture


Wellness grant


4 semaines de vacances / 4 weeks of vacation


Journées maladie illimitées / Unlimited sick days

title: Engineering Manager Core Technologies Analytics Hardware
description:
Job Title
Engineering Manager Core Technologies Analytics Hardware
Job Description*Are you a leader passionate about innovation and empowering teams? We’re seeking an Engineering Manager to lead Core Technologies Analytics Hardware at our HQ in Lund.*
Who is your future team?
Core Technologies within Axis R&D is an organization that drives, innovates, and provides key technologies to Axis future products and solutions. A fast-growing area is analytics where Core Technologies Analytics is responsible for bringing forward the latest AI algorithms, features and functionality towards a multitude of receivers from our own ASICs, camera products as well as Axis’ analytics solutions in VMS or cloud. More information is available here.  

This area continues to grow, and we are therefore looking for an Engineering Manager for the newly formed Core Technologies Analytics Hardware team. This team will work closely to the other Core Technologies Analytics teams, but with a main focus on the hardware that is essential for the analytics algorithms. The hardware is a mix of sourced IP as well as in-house design. You will lead a team of 10+ highly skilled engineers ranging from newly graduated to senior expert level. You will work closely with external suppliers as well as with several and different counterparts within Axis, and the focus ranges from short-term topics to long-term strategies. You will be responsible for technologies that are key to Axis' future success.
What you’ll do here?
As manager for this team your main tasks will be to:* Own and drive the long- and short-term agendas for the team, from strategies to daily planning, and do that both internally at Core Technologies as well as towards and in collaboration with counterparts within and outside Axis.
* Interact with Axis’ ASIC, product, and SW development organizations to make sure we understand their requests and they our deliveries, negotiate when needed, find conclusions and solutions together, and find ways forward towards successful results.
* Interact with Axis’ suppliers to make sure we are aligned short as well as long term.
* Manage contractual and legal matters that are relevant for analytics hardware.
* Identify and setup projects or activities around new technologies, tasks and requests, make sure the scope and requirements are clear and that each project or activity has sufficient staffing, planning and efficiency.
* Lead the team and individuals in their daily activities, make sure we get the most out of everyone and that they feel support and respect in and for themselves and their tasks. Develop your team and its members related to both the needs of the company as well as in balance with the needs of every individual.
* Perform standard management tasks like salary setting, budgeting, etc.


You will work closely with many organizations and individuals, but especially in close collaboration with the two Engineering Managers for the neighboring Core Technologies Analytics teams.
Who are you?
We believe that you have a genuine interest and talent in leading people and organizations. You find it easy to interact with people and between individuals and organizations and are good bridging gaps and finding ways to come to conclusions and ways forward. You combine the skill of listening with the skill of deciding and can find a good balance between the two.You are a person that is easy to interact with. You are open-minded, curious, supportive and helpful. You have a genuine interest in technology and are eager to learn new things. You can get into new areas and find your way. You know how to find information and keep yourself up to date. You have experience in interacting with companies from around the world. Their culture and ways of working interest you, and you find ways to get the most out of each and every relation and collaboration.
You fulfill the following criteria:* Several years of leadership experience, preferably as a manager and/or project manager in a technology centric organization.
* Strong track record of managing people and teams in the technical forefront.
* Well up to date with the latest technologies and terminologies of AI, including the use and design of such systems.
* The following experience areas are considered as merits: Supplier interaction including contract management; Legal aspects of technologies and their use; ASIC design; Product development
* Background as engineer, preferably in physics, electronics, computer science or similar
* Proficient in English

  

What Axis has to offer
You will work with new technologies and build the foundation for future products in collaboration with highly skilled and supportive colleagues. You have a great chance for development in an organization that values creativity and promotes individual growth. Axis treats its employees with great trust and freedom, allowing you to find the best way forward for you and your tasks. We welcome your application and look forward to the possibility of you joining us!
Ready to Act?
In case of questions, please reach out to recruiting manager Jesper Lindström, Director Core Technologies, at +46 46 272 18 00.  

We continuously review applications so do not hesitate and send in your application today!  

This recruitment is managed solely by Axis Communications AB, and we politely but firmly decline all calls from recruitment and consulting companies.
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2025-01-17*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 4500 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast
company_description: Axis Communications is a global growth company with currently are about 4000 employees worldwide and offices in over 50 countries. We are expanding. Visit our webb page axis.com

title: Tax Manager EMEA
description:
Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch’s Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
  
Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
  
At Sinch we “Dream Big”, “Win Together”, “Keep it simple”, and “Make it Happen”. These values are our foundation!
  
  

DESCRIPTION
  
In this role, you will oversee and manage the tax compliance processes across the EMEA region, ensuring adherence to local, regional and international tax regulations. This critical role will be supported by a mix of local external tax advisors, and it will closely collaborate with the FinOps EMEA team and Group Tax to #makeithappen. You will also play a vital EMEA centric tax advisory role in exciting regional and Sinch wide initiatives such as new product launches and the Finance Transformation program.
  
This role will be based at our HQ in Stockholm and report to our Head of Finance Operations EMEA.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

Tax Compliance Management
  
* Oversee and coordinate all tax compliance activities across EMEA, including corporate income tax, VAT/GST, withholding taxes, and other local taxes in collaboration with external advisors.
* Ensure timely and accurate filing of tax returns, tax financial statements, and other regulatory reports in compliance with local tax regulations.
* Lead the implementation of best practices for tax compliance, optimizing processes to improve accuracy, efficiency, and compliance rates.
* Own external tax advisor relationships with the aim of full compliance across region and effectively engage them as needed to arrive at low risk but commercially viable solutions.


Tax Reporting and Documentation
  
* Review tax provisions for financial reporting under IFRS/GAAP in coordination with the FinOps EMEA accounting teams.
* Maintain accurate tax records and documentation to support audits, financial statements, and regulatory inquiries.
* Oversee and improve processes for tax reporting within the company's ERP and tax reporting systems.


Audit Support and Risk Management
  
* Act as the main point of contact for tax authorities in the EMEA region, managing tax audits, responding to inquiries, and ensuring successful resolution of issues.
* Collaborate with internal teams and external consultants on audits, risk assessment, and implementing corrective actions if needed.
* Develop and implement controls to identify and mitigate tax risks in the EMEA region.
* Monitor changes in tax legislation within the EMEA region, assess potential impacts, and communicate updates to stakeholders.


Transfer Pricing
  
* Support all transfer pricing requirements within the region in partnership with Group Transfer Pricing and local FinOps teams, including review and execution of local strategies and documentation across multiple jurisdictions.


Process Improvement and Technology
  
* Drive process improvements and automation initiatives within the EMEA tax compliance function, leveraging technology to increase accuracy and reduce manual work.
* Support the adoption and integration of tax compliance software or ERP solutions for enhanced data accuracy and streamlined reporting.


REQUIREMENTS
  
* Relevant experience in tax compliance, preferably from a mix of multinational corporation and Big 4 accounting firm
* Strong technical knowledge of Swedish corporate income tax and VAT, other EMEA countries is a big plus
* Strong knowledge of IFRS tax effect accounting and standards
* Prior experience participating in ERP implementation projects is a plus, especially with regards to configuring tax-related processes, integrating compliance requirements, and optimizing tax reporting within ERP systems
* Experience with tax automation and data analytics tools
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Law or Finance/Accounting
* Proficient in utilizing Microsoft Office programs and finance tools
* Fluency in Swedish and English


Our corporate language is English, please submit your application in English
  
  

OUR HIRING PROCESS
  
We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
  
We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!
company_description: We help companies to communicate with customers via messaging, voice and video using multiple channels. Simplifying life by bringing all people and businesses together using technology is our purpose.

title: Junior Nätverkskonsult
description:
Har du ett öga för nätverkslösningar och gillar att jobba nära kund? Drivs du av att arbeta med stora, spännande projekt där din insats verkligen gör skillnad? Då vill jag gärna lära känna dig! Jag heter Solveig Jagelid och ansvarar för vår fantastiska konsultgrupp i Stockholm. Vi växer och söker en ny kollega i rollen som **Junior Nätverkskonsult** som vill vara med på vår gemensamma resa mot framtidens digitala infrastruktur!  

  



**Är det här din nästa möjlighet?**  



I rollen som Junior Nätverkskonsult hos oss blir du en viktig spelare i allt från planering och design till installation, konfiguration och felsökning av nätverks- och säkerhetslösningar.  

  



Du kommer att jobba både självständigt och i nära samarbete med andra specialister inom våra tre fokusområden: nätverk, säkerhet och hybrid IT. Här får du chansen att dyka djupt ner i tekniken, utforska nya lösningar och samla inspiration från både Cloud och on-prem. Och vet du vad? Om du på sikt vill certifiera dig inom fler områden så står vi redo att stötta dig hela vägen!  

  



**Är det här du?**  



Du är en person som gillar att arbeta i ett högt tempo och har en naturlig förmåga att engagera både kunder och kollegor. Du älskar att brainstorma idéer och har en förmåga att förvandla krav till konkreta, genomförbara lösningar. Dessutom är du nyfiken på att växa och utvecklas i din karriär – och vi är här för att hjälpa dig på den resan!  

  



Vi ser gärna att du har:


* Cisco CCNA-certifiering
* Har genomgått en nätverksutbildning, exempelvis på Yrkeshögskola (YH) eller motsvarande
Flytande svenska i tal och skrift  
* 

**Varför Telia Cygate?**  



På Telia Cygate är vi inte bara experter på nätverk, säkerhet och olika slags moln – vi är också ett gäng som tycker att det ska vara kul att gå till jobbet! Som en del av Telia Company har vi styrkan att skapa verklig påverkan i stor skala, bidra till samhällsnytta och hjälpa våra kunder att navigera i digitaliseringens värld. Välkommen att växa tillsammans med oss, där vi gör teknik mänsklig och skapar verklig påverkan **!**  



**Låter det intressant? Ansök idag!**  



Ta chansen och bli en del av vårt härliga team! Tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig.

Du kommer att jobba både självständigt och i nära samarbete med andra specialister inom våra tre fokusområden: nätverk, säkerhet och hybrid IT. title: Fundraising Manager till Kvinna till Kvinna, Stockholm
description:
Are you ready to take on a key role in driving successful fundraising initiatives? Do you have expertise in CRM systems? Are you passionate about strengthening women’s rights? If so, you could be the one we’re looking for to our Communication and Fundraising unit.
  
About the RoleAs Fundraising Manager, you will play a pivotal role in enhancing donor loyalty, managing the CRM system, and overseeing telemarketing to ensure an exceptional and seamless donor experience. Your responsibilities will include strategic planning, budget management, and maintaining operational excellence in these areas. Additionally, you will act as the main point of contact for Kvinna till Kvinna’s donor service vendor.
  
You will be part of a dynamic team of six colleagues working across fundraising, marketing, and external communications in the Swedish market.
  
Key ResponsibilitiesLead planning and execution of donor acknowledgment and onboarding processes.
  
Oversee operational management and ongoing development of the CRM system.
  
Manage the functionality and improvement of the Marketing Cloud platform.
  
Analyze results, generate reports, and ensure alignment with financial goals.
  
Drive telemarketing efforts to upgrade monthly donors and convert one-time donors into monthly supporters.
  
Oversee donation processing, including autogiro transactions.
  
Provide exceptional service and support to donors reaching out for assistance.
  
Coordinate mailings, materials, and other communications for donors.
  
Monitor revenues and expenses, ensuring adherence to the budget.
  
What We’re Looking ForWe are seeking a driven and detail-oriented professional with a proven track record in customer/donor loyalty. The ideal candidate thrives in a collaborative environment, excels in project management, and is passionate about fostering long-term donor relationships.
  
QualificationsRelevant higher education in marketing, communication, sales, fundraising and or a related field.
  
At least 3 years of experience in CRM systems and fundraising, preferably in a non-profit or similar setting.
  
Expertise in CRM platforms (Salesforce or similar) and marketing tools like Marketing Cloud.
  
Strong analytical skills and familiarity with reporting tools for statistical and financial analysis.
  
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills in Swedish, with the ability to craft engaging donor messages.
  
Experience developing strategies to boost donor loyalty and convert one-time donors into regular supporters.
  
Proven experience managing budgets and conducting financial reporting.
  
A track record of monitoring key performance indicators such as donor retention, acquisition, and upgrades.
  
Personal AttributesProactive, self-motivated, and results-oriented.
  
Strong collaborator with a team-first mindset.
  
Detail-focused, organized, and able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
  
What We OfferWorking at Kvinna till Kvinna means being part of an inspiring workplace where your skills will directly contribute to driving positive change.
  
We have a hybrid work arrangement with option to work remotely up to 50% of the time. Average weekly work hours are 37,5 hours. We offer wellness time during working hours and wellness allowance.
  
**Type of Employment:** this is a full-time position, indefinate with an average of 37.5 working hours per week.
  
**Start Date:** according to agreement
  
**Deadline for applying:** January 12
  
Apply via the button below.

title: 1st Line Support Agent (English and Spanish speaking)
description:
TaxiCaller is on a mission to transform the transportation industry, providing our cloud services to taxi and bus companies around the world. We grow at a good pace and we are profitable.
  
We are now looking for a 1st line support agent to our growing customer support team in Linköping.
  
  

About you
  
* You have excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think “outside the box”.
* You possess great computing skills and are interested in all things technical.
* You provide a high level of customer service and have a full understanding of its importance.
* You are a curious and fast learner.
* You communicate clearly in English and Spanish, both verbally and in writing.


This is considered an entry-level position and although we don’t believe that you need specific qualifications to succeed in this role, it is very important that you are interested in tech, and have a basic understanding of computing, cloud-based services, and mobile technology.
  
  

About the position
  
As a 1st line support agent, no two days will look the same.
  
Your daily focus will be to help our customers through phone, web chat and email.
  
You will help our customers solving their problems and making sure they have the correct settings on their account.
  
Over time, you will become an expert in the system and point of contact for anyone internally, you’ll be providing operational and technical support to teams across all of our departments.
  
The working hours will be normal office hours, Monday to Friday.
  
  

Your daily tasks will include
  
* Help our customers through phone, web chat and email, to make sure our customers can use our system the way they want it to work.
* Supporting our sales teams in sales demos and general technical support.
* Quality assurance and the development of internal training material.


It will be considered an advantage if
  
* You speak additional languages, especially Swedish, Finnish, or French.
* You have experience in technical support, ideally in an international environment.
* You have a basic understanding of software, APIs and mobile applications.


This is a great opportunity to work as part of an ambitious team whose goals are centred around growth and scalability with a strong focus on the customer experience. Your efforts will have a direct influence on how we develop and you will help to shape TaxiCaller for the future. We’re a young company and the possibilities and career opportunities will only grow along with our success.
  
For this position you need to already have a Swedish work permit.
  
  

**You can learn more about working with us here:** https://www.taxicaller.com/en/careers and here www.linkedin.com/company/taxicaller.
  
Recruitment will continue until we feel we’ve found the right fit, so we recommend applying as soon as possible and we look forward to hearing from you!

title: Bemanningskoordinator på Leksand Sommarland
description:
Till sommarsäsongen söker vi en strukturerad och driven Bemanningskoordinator som bidrar till att arbetet i parken flyter på bästa sätt.
  
  

Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter
  
  

* Ta emot sjukanmälningar och tillsätta ersättare för både Leksand Sommarland och Leksand Resort camping (restauranger och kiosker)
* Optimera bemanningen i parken genom att löpande stämma av behovet och i samråd med Parkchef genomföra aktuella förflyttningar alternativt ringa in extrapersonal
* Löpande kommunikation med Teamleaders, Parkchef och Food & Beverage gällande schemaförändringar kopplade till sjukfall, ersättare och förflyttningar
* Ta emot ledighetsansökningar och godkänna ersättare under ledighet
* Publicera och tillsätta lediga arbetspass
* Aktivt arbeta med optimering och effektivisering av schema
* Rapportering av arbetstimmar, attestering samt uppföljning
* Publicera aktuell information till våra medarbetare
* Ansvarig över att uppdatera sociala medier för våra medarbetare
* Vara Parkchef behjälplig med diverse arbetsuppgifter


Din profil
  
  

För att lyckas som Bemanningskoordinator hos oss är du en positiv och initiativtagande lagspelare som alltid möter kollegor och gäster med ett leende. Du är kommunikativ, stresstålig och trivs med att arbeta självständigt samtidigt som du har en god samarbetsförmåga. Du är driven och nyfiken i ditt arbete. Vi ser gärna att du studerar Personal och Arbetsliv eller liknande utbildning. Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av liknande arbete samt om du tidigare arbetat med Caspeco Cloud.
  
  

Vad kan vi erbjuda?
  
  

Varje dag hos oss bjuder på nya äventyr, där vi tillsammans skapar minnesvärda upplevelser för både gäster och varandra. Vi tror på att ha kul på jobbet och anordnar massor av härliga personalkvällar – en perfekt chans att koppla av, ha roligt och umgås med dina kollegor. Här hittar du inte bara ett jobb, utan också möjligheten att skaffa vänner för livet.
  
  

Arbetstider mellan 08:00-16:00 fem dagar i veckan, helgarbete förekommer. Anställningen är en säsongsanställning på 100% och sommarsäsongen pågår mellan juni till augusti. Lön och övriga villkor enligt kollektivavtal med Visita - Unionen.
  
  

Om oss
  
  

Nöjesparken Leksand Sommarland i Dalarna är ett riktigt äventyr för barnfamiljer under sommaren. Innanför grindarna väntar ett stort utbud aktiviteter och attraktioner. Några av våra populäraste attraktioner är Wipeoutbanan i Siljan, Lasertag, Höghöjdsbanor för stora och små, och så förstås vårt Vattenland med tempererade pooler och vindlande vattenrutschkanor.
  
  

Leksand Resorts femstjärniga familjecamping ligger mitt bland tallar i ett grönskande lugn alldeles intill sjön Siljan, granne med Leksand Sommarland. Vi har boenden från tält till lyxiga stugor, närmre bestämt 237 stugor, över 400 campingtomter, glampingtält och uthyrbara husvagnar. På Leksand Resort finns massor av roliga aktiviteter för hela familjen, skön avkoppling och sevärdheter runt knuten.
  
  

Visste du att vi var nominerade till årets arbetsgivare i Dalarna 2024? Kom och bli en del av vårt fantastiska team 2025!
  
  

Du kan söka jobbet direkt från mobilen genom att svara på några frågor - inget CV eller personligt brev behövs.
  
  

Allt går snabbt och smidigt och tar några minuter.
  
  

Återkoppling på din ansökan och inbjudan till eventuell intervju kommer till din mejladress. Se till att även kolla skäpposten. Hoppas vi ses!

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Set off to your next adventure with us as an Infrastructure Engineer. We look for you with an analytical mind, eagerness to learn, and drive to excel across Sellpy’s technical infrastructure.
  
We are proud to be one of the fastest-growing scale-ups in Sweden and the leading service for second hand goods in Europe. We’ve seen rapid growth during the last few years, and today we list half a million new items for sale every week!
  
To accomplish our vision of empowering everyone to live circularly, we need fantastic employees who want to grow with us. That’s why we’re on the lookout for an Infrastructure Engineer to help us take Sellpy to the next level.
  
Infrastructure Engineer at Sellpy
  
In this role, you will gain broad exposure to all aspects of Sellpy’s technical infrastructure. Reporting directly to our CTO, you will work closely with them on a variety of tasks, ranging from cloud orchestration to network design. This is a demanding position that requires the ability to think and work both strategically and operationally. You will take ownership of our infrastructure, growing with the role and responsibility to optimise our cloud environment for performant and cost-effective scalability.
  
In short, you will
  
Design, deploy, and maintain scalable infrastructure solutions with AWS services like CloudFront, Lambda, EC2 and S3.
  
Manage cloud services (e.g., AWS and GCP).
  
Optimise our MongoDB database to enable efficient querying at scale.
  
Manage on-premise networking hardware.
  
Automate infrastructure deployment using tools like AWS CDK and CI/CD pipelines.
  
Monitor system performance, ensuring reliability, uptime, and security.
  
Collaborate with our Engineering teams to optimise infrastructure for applications.
  
Troubleshoot and resolve infrastructure-related issues promptly.
  
Ensure infrastructure adheres to compliance and best practices.
  
Stay updated with new tools and technologies to improve infrastructure efficiency.
  
  

Requirements
  
At least 2 years of work experience in a similar role.
  
Confidence to stand on your own feet, as you will take ownership of your tasks and drive them independently.
  
The curiosity to explore unknown areas that you haven’t worked with before.
  
Great communication skills in English.
  
  

We’d be impressed if you have
  
A bachelor's or master's degree in computer science or engineering.
  
Experience working with AWS-services like CloudFront, S3 and EC2
  
Experience with MongoDB or SQL databases
  
Experience with logging and health monitoring solutions
  
Worked in a fast-growing, product-focused startup environment
  
  

You get to
  
Be part of a tech-minded company that's driving the change towards a sustainable lifestyle. In return, you will get direction, energy, and work on meaningful challenges daily.
  
Work with highly skilled and motivated colleagues.
  
Gain new skills with unlimited access to a learning platform.
  
Make use of prepaid vacation.
  
Enjoy Sellpy credits and staff discounts at Sellpy and the H&M brands (Arket, COS, Other Stories, Weekday and more).
  
Save up with a monthly pension plan.
  
Engagement in Sellpy’s social traditions with game nights, interactive planning days, guest speakers and other activities.
  
  

Location
  
You’re welcome to work from our new office at Medborgarplatsen in Stockholm and from home. Ideally, we’d love to see you in the office regularly, as it helps create a positive and productive environment.
  
**Form of employment:** Full-time
  
**Start:** As agreed upon
  
Öppen för alla
  
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

title: Fullstack Engineer - Commercial Tech
description:
As a Fullstack Engineer at Embark, you will be a Gamemaker in a technical team that builds and maintains internal tools that empower our game teams and improve the studio’s efficiency. Your role will directly support game development by creating solutions that automates and streamlines workflows, and provides valuable analytics. You will also be contributing to commercial projects like tools for monetization and customer support.
  
The team’s goal is to deliver scalable, user-friendly, and cost-efficient solutions that help our teams create dynamic and engaging player experiences. You’ll collaborate closely with game teams, data teams, and the commercial team, reporting to the Head of Commercial Tech.
  
As an integral part of a creative and autonomous team, you’ll contribute to high-quality tools and systems for both developers and players. For the frontend we use technologies like React, TypeScript and NextJS. For the backend we use Go, protobuf, Python, and OpenAPI.
  
Example of responsibilities
  
Develop and improve internal tools for game teams and studio-wide use.
  
Automate workflows to reduce manual effort and enhance efficiency
  
Build personalized store recommendation systems and tools
  
Continuously refine engineering practices to ensure services are easy to deploy, scale, and maintain
  
Collaborate with multiple teams to deliver tools and solutions that improve both developer and player experiences.
  
  

We would love if you have
  
Solid experience with React, TypeScript, NextJS, Go, Python and the GCP stack.
  
Proven ability to build internal data-driven tools and services.
  
Experience deploying and maintaining services on cloud infrastructure.
  
Strong background in analytics and data-driven tooling.
  
Analytical mindset, self-driven, and capable of taking projects from idea to implementation.
  
Experience in the gaming industry or other consumer-facing products.
  
Passion for games, interactive experiences, and new technologies.
  
  

At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
  
We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
  
Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
  
Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!
  
If this role doesn't quite match what you're looking for, feel free to apply to us via our "Open Application."

title: Bitr. Food & Beverage Manager till Leksand Sommarland & Leksand Resort
description:
Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter
  
  

Som bitr. Food- & Beverage Manager ansvarar du över restauranger och kiosker på Leksand Sommarland och Leksand Resort camping tillsammans med ordinarie F&B Manager samt i nära samarbete med Verksamhetschef och Verksamhetskoordinator för Mat vid Siljan, Parkchef för Leksand Sommarland och Verksamhetschef för Leksand Resort.
  
  

Utbilda och arbetsleda sommarpersonalen för att säkerställa en välfungerande drift
  
Dagligen coacha och stötta medarbetare för en ständigt förbättrad gästupplevelse
  
Personalplanering och schemaläggning
  
Kontinuerligt se över bemanningsbehovet och göra anpassningar efter antal bokade gäster, antal sålda biljetter, väder m.m.
  
Ansvar över att restauranger och kiosker iordningställs inför säsongsstart
  
Lageransvar samt inköp och beställningar till samtliga kiosker på Sommarland och Resort samt engångsartiklar och förbrukningsmaterial till restauranger
  
Säkerställa att samtliga restauranger och kiosker alltid är fullt utrustade och påfyllda för att möta efterfrågan
  
Leverantörskontakt
  
Operativ och ekonomisk uppföljning av verksamheten samt arbete med ständiga förbättringar
  
Nedstängning och utvärdering efter säsong
  
Tillsammans med marknadsavdelningen utveckla och genomföra marknadsstrategier för att öka synligheten och locka nya som befintliga gäster
  
Stötta Verksamhetschefer med diverse uppgifter
  
  

Din profil
  
  

För att lyckas i rollen som bitr. F&B Manager hos oss är du prestigelös och har förmågan att visa vägen och leda andra i deras arbete. Du kombinerar ledarskapsförmåga med operativ erfarenhet och affärssinne. Du har en stark drivkraft att skapa fantastiska gästupplevelser samtidigt som du säkerställer en effektiv drift av våra restauranger och kiosker. Vi förväntar oss att du är strukturerad, initiativtagande och kan engagera och motivera dina medarbetare. Du trivs när det är full fart och kan snabbt fatta beslut för att den dagliga driften ska fungera så bra som möjligt, både på kort och lång sikt. Du har goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska samt har minst 2 års erfarenhet av att arbeta som F&B Manager eller liknande befattning inom branschen. Tidigare erfarenhet av Caspeco Cloud är meriterande. B-körkort.
  
  

Vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
  
  

Vad kan vi erbjuda?
  
  

Ett utmanande och roligt säsongsarbete där du får bidra till att skapa minnesvärda upplevelser för våra gäster, medarbetare och dig själv. Du får möjligheten att utveckla din karriär inom restaurangbranschen samtidigt som du arbetar i en härlig och glädjefylld miljö. Arbetstider varierar efter parken och campingens öppettider så det förekommer arbete både dagtid och kvällstid veckans alla dagar. Anställningen är en säsongsanställning på 100% med start i maj/början av juni, pågår augusti/september ut. Individuell lönesättning, övriga villkor enligt kollektivavtal med Visita - Unionen. Möjlighet till personalboende.
  
  

Om oss
  
  

Nöjesparken Leksand Sommarland i Dalarna är ett riktigt äventyr för barnfamiljer under sommaren. Innanför grindarna väntar ett stort utbud aktiviteter och attraktioner. Några av våra populäraste attraktioner är Wipeoutbanan i Siljan, Lasertag, Höghöjdsbanor för stora och små, och så förstås vårt Vattenland med tempererade pooler och vindlande vattenrutschkanor.
  
  

Leksand Resorts femstjärniga familjecamping ligger mitt bland tallar i ett grönskande lugn alldeles intill sjön Siljan, granne med Leksand Sommarland. Vi har boenden från tält till lyxiga stugor, närmre bestämt 237 stugor, över 400 campingtomter, glampingtält och uthyrbara husvagnar.
  
  

Leksand Sommarland och Leksand Resort är en del av Leksand Resort-koncernen där även följande verksamheter ingår:
  
  

* Mat vid Siljan som driver en omfattande restaurang- och cateringverksamhet, bl.a. i Tegera Arena
* Moskogen Hotell & Restaurang med hotell- restaurang- och konferensverksamhet


Visste du att vi var nominerade till årets arbetsgivare i Dalarna 2024? Kom och bli en del av vårt fantastiska team 2025!
  
  

Du kan söka jobbet direkt från mobilen genom att svara på några frågor - Inget CV eller dokument behövs i ett första läge. Allt går snabbt och smidigt och tar bara några minuter.
  
  

Återkoppling på din ansökan och inbjudan till eventuell intervju kommer till din mejladress. Se till att även kolla skäpposten. Hoppas vi ses!

title: QA Specialist
description:
Bygghemma.se är Sveriges största onlinebaserade aktör inom byggvaror, hem och trädgård. Genom vår onlinebutik, som kompletteras och understöds av flertalet fysiska visningsbutiker och ett omfattande service- och tjänsteutbud, såsom montering och installationer, erbjuder vi ett ledande sortiment från välkända externa och egna varumärken. Vi har huvudkontor i Malmö.
  
Är du en engagerad och nyfiken person som vill vara med och forma framtidens e-handel? Bygghemma erbjuder en spännande möjlighet där du får göra skillnad!
  
Om tjänstenSom QA Specialist på Bygghemma spelar du en central roll i vår testprocess. Ditt huvudansvar är att säkerställa att vi levererar högkvalitativ mjukvara. Du gör detta genom att definiera testomfång för projekt och implementera rätt testprocesser och verktyg.
  
Rollen innebär att du vidareutvecklar och optimerar testprocessen genom att ta fram definierade rutiner för testning i olika faser av utvecklingscykeln. Du ansvarar även för att förvalta och utveckla vår portfölj av testramverk och verktyg för att säkerställa att vi använder rätt lösningar för våra behov.
  
I arbetet ingår att delta i kravfasen av projekt tillsammans med produktägare för att säkerställa att testkrav är väl definierade från början. Som QA Specialist kommer du att utföra tester i projekt och vid behov axla rollen som testledare. Du hanterar också våra regressionstest-set för olika plattformar och moduler, i nära samarbete med systemägare. Testdokumentationen behöver regelbundet underhållas och uppdateras, och du ansvarar för att detta sker i samverkan med relevanta personer i organisationen.
  
Om digVi söker dig som har flera års erfarenhet av att arbeta med mjukvarutestning i olika former. Du har goda kunskaper i Atlassian Jira och Zephyr Scale, och erfarenhet av att arbeta i molnmiljöer, främst Google Cloud men även Azure.Erfarenhet av e-handel är en stor fördel.
  
Vi söker någon som är proaktiv och prestigelös, och som är redo att kavla upp ärmarna för att nå uppsatta mål.Som person är du kommunikativ, engagerad och orädd. Du trivs i en dynamisk och snabbt föränderlig miljö och drivs av att bidra till att Bygghemma levererar marknadsledande mjukvarulösningar.
  
Vi erbjuderVi erbjuder ett varierande och spännande arbete hos en av Nordens ledande e-handelsaktörer. Det finns ett väldigt stort utrymme för idéer och goda möjligheter att vara med och påverka arbetet kring förbättringar av lösningar och vår affär. På Bygghemma ger vi dig även möjligheten att delta i olika företagsaktiviteter och sociala evenemang, såsom teambuilding-aktiviteter och afterwork. Välkommen till vår gemenskap, där våra värderingar är: Ansvar, Enkelhet, Utmanar och Tillsammans.
  
Låter detta som din typ av utmaning?Vi väntar på att höra ifrån dig, så skicka gärna din ansökan redan idag! Urval och intervjuer sker löpande.
  
Om företagetBygghemma är en del av BHG, en av de största onlineaktörerna inom konsumenthandel i Norden, med en nettointänkt på drygt 13 Mdkr 2022. Inom BHG ingår över 100 onlinedestinationer, innefattande till exempel: www.bygghemma.se, www.polarpumpen.se, www.trademax.se, www.nordicnest.se och www.svenssons.se - och över 70 showrooms.Vårt huvudkontor ligger i Malmö och vi har verksamheter i de flesta europeiska länder. BHG är noterat på Nasdaq Stockholm, med tickern BHG. BHG: s e-handelsverksamheter - www.wearebhg.com - har över 2 000 anställda som varje dag arbetar för att skapa en optimal köpupplevelse genom ett oöverträffat produktutbud och smart teknologi, kombinerat med ledande produktexpertis och ett brett utbud av service och tjänster.

title: Azure Integration Architect - Lead, Innovate, and Grow...
description:
### **We’re redefining what a data consultancy can be and achieve**


At Epical, we’re not just another consultancy firm; we’re on a mission to redefine what a data consultancy can be and achirve. Everything we do begins and ends with trust. For us, trust isn’t just a value—it’s the foundation of every successful partnership. As consultants, our role goes beyond providing advice and services. It’s about taking responsibility and seizing opportunities to help create a fairer world through expertise in integration, data and analytics, applications, and digital trust.

  

If you’re a customer-focused Azure Integration Architect who thrives on delivering high-quality integration solutions to enterprise clients across diverse industries, backed by a team of top-tier integration experts, keep reading—we’d love to meet you!

### **Your role as an Azure integration architect**


As an Azure Integration Architect at Epical, you’ll play a pivotal role in:

* **Consulting on integration architecture:** Partner with clients to craft and implement integration and API architectures that align with their unique needs and ambitions.
* **Leading technical delivery:** Steer your team from planning and requirement analysis through design and implementation, ensuring seamless and impactful solutions.
* **Presales activities:** Showcase Epical’s integration expertise to inspire confidence and excitement in potential clients.
* **Team collaboration:** Lead workgroups and nurture a culture of learning and shared success within a team-based delivery model.


We’re proud to deliver high-quality integration solutions on various cloud platforms, and our growth means we’re tackling more complex projects in dynamic environments. Whether you prefer a technical, hands-on role, a strategic advisory focus, or a blend of both, we’ll tailor your position to suit your strengths and ambitions.

### **Why join Epical?**


At Epical, trust and collaboration are at the heart of everything we do. Here’s what you can expect as part of our team:

* **An environment that prioritizes people:** Work-life balance and flexible remote working options are part of our DNA.
* **Stimulating assignments:** Collaborate with top-tier experts on exciting projects for enterprise clients in complex environments.
* **Career growth opportunities:** Shape your role and grow with us as we solidify our position as the Nordics’ leading integration consultancy.
* **Comprehensive benefits:** Enjoy a competitive compensation package, leadership and technical training, certifications, and more.
* **A mission-driven organization:** Join a company that’s dedicated to building a fairer world through the responsible use of data and technology.

### **What you bring to the table**


To thrive at Epical, you should have:

* A solid track record as a senior integration developer or integration architect with expertise in Azure integration architecture.
* The ability to see both the big picture and the finer details of client requirements.
* Leadership skills and experience guiding technical delivery teams.
* A technical background that allows you to understand development processes, even if you no longer code day-to-day.

### **Practical details**


All roles at Epical are permanent, with the flexibility to work from home or any of our offices across Sweden (Stockholm, Gothenburg, Malmö, Västerås, Örebro, and Skövde). To qualify, you must reside in Sweden and have a valid work permit.

### **Ready to join something epic?**


If this sounds like the opportunity you’ve been looking for, we’d love to hear from you. We’ll be taking a well-deserved break during the festive season to recharge and gear up for an exciting new year. So, don’t worry if you don’t hear from us right away—we’ll get back to you with updates at the start of January, refreshed and ready to connect!

### **About Epical**


Epical is a Nordic data consultancy driven to create a world built on trust. With approximately 400 experts, we go beyond the expected in integration, data and analytics, applications, and digital trust. By responsibly leveraging cloud technologies, we strive to deliver solutions that make the world a fairer place for everyone.

**Data-driven business beyond the expected.**

title: DevSecOps-ingenjör (Deltid)
description:
Följ med oss på vår roliga och spännande **SimpleSign-resa**!


Som **DevSecOps-ingenjör** hos oss kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att integrera säkerhet i hela vår utvecklings- och leveransprocess. Du kommer att samarbeta med vårt globala team för att säkerställa att våra tjänster är säkra, skalbara och följer branschstandarder.

### **Ansvarsområden**

* Implementera säkerhetskontroller i våra **CI/CD-pipelines** (GitLab CI/CD, GitHub Actions).
* Genomföra **säker kodgranskning** (SAST/DAST) och säkerställa att bästa praxis följs.
* Övervaka och hantera säkerheten i vår **GCP-infrastruktur** och **Kubernetes (GKE)**.
* Utföra regelbundna **penetrationstester** och sårbarhetsskanningar.
* Implementera och underhålla verktyg för **loggning, övervakning och incidentrespons** (t.ex. Prometheus, Grafana, ELK).
* Säkerställa att vi följer säkerhetsstandarder som **ISO 27001, NIST CSF** och andra relevanta ramverk.
* Utbilda och stödja utvecklingsteamet i säker kodning och säkerhetsmedvetande.
* Dokumentera säkerhetsprocesser och rekommendationer.

### **Kvalifikationer**

* **Minst 5 års erfarenhet** inom DevSecOps, IT-säkerhet eller relaterade områden.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med **CI/CD-verktyg** som GitLab CI/CD, Jenkins, GitHub Actions eller liknande.
* Stark kompetens inom **molnsäkerhet**, särskilt med **Google Cloud Platform (GCP)**.
* Erfarenhet av **Kubernetes (GKE)** och containerorkestrering.
* Kunskap om **Infrastructure as Code (IaC)** med verktyg som Terraform och Ansible.
* Erfarenhet av säkerhetsverktyg som **OWASP ZAP, OpenVAS, HashiCorp Vault**.
* Förståelse för säkerhetsstandarder som **ISO 27001, NIST CSF, CIS Benchmarks**.
* Grundläggande programmeringskunskaper i **Python, Bash eller liknande**.
* Flytande i engelska, både i tal och skrift.

### **Meriterande Kvalifikationer**

* Certifieringar såsom **CKS (Certified Kubernetes Security Specialist)**, **OSCP**, **CISSP**, eller liknande.
* Erfarenhet av att implementera compliance-krav som **SOC 2** eller **GDPR**.
* Erfarenhet av **penetrationstestning** för webbapplikationer och molninfrastruktur.

### **Vad Vi Erbjuder**

* Flexibla arbetstider – anpassa jobbet till din vardag.
* Möjlighet att arbeta på distans.
* Ett engagerat team som värdesätter lärande och utveckling.
* Möjlighet att ha en stor påverkan i ett växande företag.

title: Payroll specialist (M/F/D)
description:
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.
About the job  


Join our excellent payroll team in Sweden as a Payroll Specialist. As a crucial member of our team, you will play a pivotal role in delivering our everyday magic with the high level of service and salary payment to our businesses. We are searching for someone who has prior experience in salary administration and who has a strong ability of self-leadership as well as teamwork and collaboration.
In Tietoevry you will be responsible for traditional salary administration and system development, but also creativity and digital development. We are always working to improve and find new, efficient and secure solutions to deliver accurate payroll data to our organization.
Together with our colleges in HR and Corporate Business Services, we are the backbone in the Tietoevry organization. Come and join us!  


Your role
As a payroll specialist at Tietoevry you will be a part of a team with competent colleagues located in Jönköping and Kalix who each month deliver approximately 3 500 salary payment. Your extended team will be HR operations, and you will report to Head of HR Operations Sweden. You will also have close collaboration with Finance. At Tietoevry you will be a part of the HR community and have opportunity to grow and develop.
We work in a fast-changing environment, which requires you to be flexible. With your previous experience, you will also be able to contribute ideas to develop and streamline work routines. Examples of tasks include managing company cars, benefits, reporting/inputting data, reconciling files, and providing employees with support on payroll-related questions.
Tietoevry has a hybrid workplace, and you will be able to have a flexible work environment. As a team, we have fixed days when we meet in the office, and we believe that it is an advantage to sit together and work closely with each other. Therefore, we see that you preferably live around Jönköping. Kalix or Stockholm are also possible locations where part of the team is located.
Are you the one we are looking for?
We expect you to have at least 5 years of experience in payroll management. It is advantageous if you have experience working at a larger company where parts of the payroll process are linked to system integrations, hence we also prefer that you have an interest in systems. You work fluently in Swedish and English and have good knowledge of Excel. It is an advantage if you have experience with SD Worx payroll system, the HR system Workday as well as the ticket system Zendesk.
You will succeed in this roll if you have strong analytical skills and business-oriented approach, as well as the ability to independently plan and structure your work based on set goals. You meet high standards of integrity, communication skills and attention to details without losing the overall perspective. You are used to working independently and prioritizing tasks in a dynamic environment.
As we are a team with close collaboration, we are emphasizing your personal fit with the team and in addition to your skills and competences, we as a team like to have fun at work and are looking for a team member who can contribute to the good atmosphere in our group.
About Tietoevry
Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust, and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprises and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs.
At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: BIM Specialist
description:
**Description**  



  

**The opportunity**

  

As a Senior BIM Specialist, you will assess architectural, structural, and mechanical design models. You will check the quality and accuracy of the models, extract quantities, identify and resolve clashes, analyze costs, and develop documentation and representations. You will also be required to construct and maintain 3D/4D/5D/6D Building Information Models on occasion.


Because this is a global position, you will be working with colleagues, clients, suppliers, and subcontractors from all over the world. It is critical that you work well as part of a team and understand how to communicate effectively and clearly. BIM is still a developing matter, and it is critical to maintain an instructional approach to ensure that everyone is on the same page.

**How you'll make an impact**

* Lead project BIM and Model Coordination meetings: spatial coordination of disciplines, gathering all discipline BIM models including civil and performing coordination tasks
* Conduct 3D BIM design reviews, clash-detection and conflict resolution
* Manage and assist in the coordination efforts of all parties involved in the project including owners, architects/engineers, consultants, sub-contractors
* Derive BIM modeling requirements and guidelines from contract requirements and for BIM use throughout the lifecycle
* Support project team by managing and creating content library files and templates, creating and enforcing standards and evaluating project models.
* Act as the main point of contact for BIM technology and any related issues between the construction managers, subcontractors, owners, design team, and others as required
* Aid in the preparation and revisions of project budgets, estimates, and construction schedules
* Liaison with clients and other consultants regarding BIM standards/processes, and document project BIM standards/processes for distribution to the project team.

**Your background**

* You have a strong mindset and are able to lead large scale coordination meetings
* Good knowledge of BIM related platforms such as BIM360/Autodesk Construction Cloud and thorough understanding of BIM processes and global BIM standards
* Minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree within a related field
* Experience in 3D Modeling in the relevant tools and experience from BIM, Model and Data coordination.
* Preferably experience from Revit Architecture, Revit MEP, Autocad and Autocad MEP and Navisworks
* Fluency in English and strong analytical skills, excellent writing, and communication skills with experience of C-level business discussions

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More about us**


In this role, you can work from either Ludvika or Västerås in Sweden, and we also provide flexible work-from-home possibilities.


We want to hear from you if you are passionate about BIM and the energy sector and are searching for a challenging and rewarding career, so we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet all of the requirements.

  

Recruiting Manager Rohit Dahiya, rohit.dahiya@hitachienergy.com will be happy to answer your questions regarding this position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 29 86; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85. All other questions should be directed to Talent Partner Nicole Bergman, nicole.bergman@hitachienergy.com.

**Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Hitachi Energy career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**This is solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes will not receive a response.**
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

title: Business Security Officer
description:
**About** **the team:**


Security and Privacy enables everyone in Orange Business to perform business activities according to relevant security and privacy standards and regulations, as well as business requirements, and thereby contribute to the company reaching business goals. Our security and privacy strategy is aligned with the business strategy to ensure we use security and privacy not just as a compliance measure but also to drive innovation and business both for our customers and internally.


We firmly believe that good governance, security and privacy will be achieved through an aware and competent workforce, using well-defined processes and frameworks, and tools that support our security policies and privacy framework. That is why we see security and privacy as interdependent on each other, not as silos, and why we have one common department that works with both areas in an aligned manner supporting each other and the business.


The Business Security Officer works closely with, and within, the Security and Privacy department, supporting and reporting to the Group CISO, but also interacts with our *c*ustomers security organization, especially customer-appointed security representatives and/or their management, external regulatory bodies, especially in case of national security act, external partners/auditors - as agreed and authorized by customer and Customer teams, and our internal Service Managers and Business Managers (ad hoc).

 **The role:**


As **Business Security** **Officer** you will work as a liaison for our Sweden based customers, bridging the gap between the customer, the customer team in Orange Business, and other delivery units such as CyberSOC, Operations Center and Data Center. This role is typically provided to customers with high security awareness, specific requirements that must ensure compliance with different information security standards or frameworks.
