Your job will be to remain up to date on customer needs and ensure that Orange Business continues to design and operate our services, accordingly, including alignment with the security and privacy requirements. The BSO will also ensure ongoing reporting on security, risk, and compliance, both internally to the Group CISO and to the customers.


Additionally, you’ll assist Group CISO and Orange Business to comply with laws and regulations, such as EU GDPR and national data privacy legislation in each country of operation (in collaboration with the Data Protection Officer and the Group CISO), National/EU Security Act, etc. You will need to find ways to do internal control, provide reports to the customer and manage a customer security forum where you meet with your customers to align security efforts and improvement activities.

 **Your key areas of responsibility:**

  

* Meetings with customers, Group CISO and participate in internal/customer security forums, on a regular basis to convene and discuss security work.
* Take a lead in conducting security drills, testing both customer and Orange Business in different scenarios.
* Understanding the risks of the customer from a compliance perspective.
* Provide input to the compliance work in accordance with ISO 27001, SOC2 NIS2 and DORA to enhance proactive security measures, identify and reduce risks.
* Create or assist in creating customer specific policies, procedures, and routines, and make sure they are in line and up to date with our policies, laws and regulations.
* Assist customers and customer teams in planning and executing disaster and continuity exercises, audits, and change/architecture forums.
* Build and maintain security and privacy awareness, and act as guidance for the customer teams.
* Assist and provide input to Group CISO in our compliance activities, such as ISO 27001, EU regulations as GDPR, NIS2 and DORA
* Represent Security & Privacy in customer monthly security forums

 **As an ideal candidate you have:**



* High school or college degree in IT or equivalent competence through work experience
* Minimum 3 years of working in information and/or IT security area
* Customer experience within information and/or IT security, and/or Cloud Services
* Strong focus on service and delivery towards the customers
* Ability to take ownership and responsibility to find answers and solutions to customer questions and problems
* Excellent communication skills
Proficient in Swedish and English  
* 

**It is not a requirement, but other preferred qualifications would be:**

* Experience from compliance and architecture, or:
	+ Certifications ex. CISSP, CCSP, CompTIA Security+, or other certification by SANS or ISC, ISACA
	+ Experience from working with ITIL, ISO, and EU regulations as NIS

  



**What we offer you:**

* Hybrid ways of working with access to our modern & collaborative office in Stockholm
* We may work with tomorrow’s technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification
* An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential
* A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise

Read more about the benefits we offer here.  
* 

**About Orange Business:**


Orange Business is a leading network and digital integrator company with offices in 65 countries worldwide, and part of the Orange Group.


Digital Services, a business line of Orange Business is a division within Orange Business. In Europe the business line consists of approximately 1500 people distributed across 9 countries. We are digital natives, with innovation at the core of our business, which makes us a reliable partner close to our customers. Our joint mission is to help innovate, drive and lead them in their digital transformation challenges and business strategies in key digital domains, including Cloud, Customer Experience, Digital Workspace and Data & AI. As an agile and fast-moving digital business partner, the business line offers trusted end-to-end solutions and products that help businesses in a wide range of industries in the private and public sector transform their operations, enhance customer experience, and drive growth.


With our digital expertise, we are a strategic partner of Orange Business objectives to be a leading network and digital integrator with our team as a key growth engine.

 **The process:**  

  

This job posting will remain open until **January 17th, 2025**. To ensure your application is considered, please submit it before the deadline. We will begin reviewing applications and reaching out to candidates shortly after this date.


Interested but feel that you don´t match the criteria 100%? We encourage you to apply anyway! We believe in the potential of diverse skill sets, perspectives and individuality. We want to encourage everyone to be their authentic selves and your unique capabilities may align perfectly with our team's needs! Your perfect match might be the next job we are announcing, so why not have a head start and apply now!


Are you interested to read more about Orange Business? Visit our Website or follow our LinkedIn account.

title: Bioinformatics Research Scientist
description:
BioInvent ‘s activity spans all aspects of drug development, from discovery, preclinical and translational research, to manufacturing and clinical development.


Together we are creating the exciting future of BioInvent, and we welcome you to be part of it – as our

**Bioinformatics Research Scientist**


We are seeking an experienced and highly motivated Bioinformatics Research Scientist for the Computational Biology team at BioInvent in Lund.


We welcome you to join an innovative R&D-driven organization. Our primary goal is to develop the next generation of immuno-oncology drugs, focusing on improving cancer patient survival and quality of life.

**Key Responsibilities**


Analyze and process internally generated single-cell and spatial transcriptomics/ multi-omics datasets and integrate publicly available data to generate meaningful biological insights.


Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams and apply expertise in bioinformatics to integrate data types to drive innovative projects


Employ state-of-the-art machine learning and AI techniques to uncover patterns in extensive biological datasets, developing predictive models to identify biomarkers


**Your Qualifications**


To succeed in this position, we believe you have the following qualifications:

* PhD degree in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, or related disciplines
* Previous working experience in multi-omics data analysis (eg. genetics / genomics, bulk, single-cell transcriptomics, spatial transcriptomics, proteomics etc.)
* Proficient in R and/or Python, Unix/Bash
* Proficiency in machine learning and AI methodologies for analyzing large-scale biological data and developing ML models to predict biomarkers
* Familiarity with high-performance computing and cloud-based computing (preferably AWS) environments is a plus
* Demonstrated success in academic or industry settings, as evidenced by a strong publication record
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a collaborative environment

**You, as a person**


As a person, you are thorough, structured, responsible but also efficient, driven, and creative. Personal suitability is of great importance, and we believe that you have a positive attitude and a strong commitment and are flexible, proactive, and open-minded to take on new challenges. You understand the importance of achieving results, meeting deadlines, and ensuring high quality in your work. You are enthusiastic and enjoy creating results and achieving goals individually and with the team.


**Location**


The position is based in Lund.


**Application**  

Please send your application (CV and personal letter) and tell us why you are the right person for this position. Please make sure to send in your application, 31st of January 2025 at the latest.


BioInvent has a collective agreement and contact persons for the Unions are: Ellinor Karlsson, Akademikerföreningen and Camilla Ljungkrantz, Unionenklubben.

title: Senior Purchaser (Stockholm, hybrid)
description:
Are you ready to play a key role in shaping and developing the procurement processes at Net Insight? As a Senior Purchaser, you will be a key part of our procurement team, combining your expertise in sourcing, purchasing and supplier management with a hands-on approach. Our team today is small and focused on continuously improving the organization and its processes. This versatile role offers the opportunity to engage in a wide range of Procurement activities, where you'll balance strategic, tactical, and operational responsibilities.


In your project Purchaser role, you will focus on sourcing related tasks for new product development projects. In your category Purchaser role, you will manage purchasing volume products and components for specific product categories, ensuring availability in our finished goods warehouse. You will work closely with the Purchasing Manager, while reporting to the Head of Logistics & Procurement.

 *Want to learn more about our products and get to know our people? Make sure to check us out on* ***LinkedIn*** *and* ***Youtube****!*

**Key Responsibilities**

* Collaborate with project management, R&D and supply in product development projects.
* Source components and negotiate competitive prices to control total product costs.
* Evaluate quotes, select suppliers, and negotiate contracts with project teams and stakeholders.
* Place and follow-up on orders and deliveries with suppliers to meet project timelines.
* Collaborate closely with contract manufacturing partners (EMS) to ensure all components and materials are sourced for prototype builds and production ramp up.
* Procure specific product categories and manage inventory levels to ensure availability in the finished goods warehouse based on customer demand.
* Analyse bills of materials (BOMs) in terms of costs, lead times and risks to identify cost-saving opportunities and ensure optimal supplier choices.
* Develop procurement processes to support Net Insight’s growth and innovation goals.

 **The product**


Join a company that’s at the forefront in the media industry of video transport and media cloud technology and in the time synchronization industry, where your work directly contributes to innovation in live media workflows.

 **Good to knows:**

  

* We value work-life balance and have a hybrid work set-up (50/50)
* Full-time, permanent position
* Located in our HQ in Solna, Stockholm
* Our corporate language is English

  

Intrigued?


Well, you should be!

 **Your Profile**


You are a structured and goal-oriented professional with a passion for teamwork and a proactive mindset. As a skilled communicator, you thrive in cross-functional collaborations and embrace challenges with a problem-solving attitude. You are committed to continuous improvement, constantly seeking ways to enhance processes, drive efficiencies, and propose innovative solutions. With strong negotiation skills, you achieve cost reductions while maintaining professional supplier relationships. A natural curiosity about technology drives your eagerness to learn about our products and components. Flexibility and adaptability are essential, as you thrive in dynamic environments and quickly adjust to changing circumstances.

 **Skills and experience**

* Bachelors degree in relevant field or other relevant higher education.
* 5+ years of experience in a Procurement, Sourcing, or Purchasing organisation, with a proven track record in tactical (e.g., supplier negotiations, contracting) and operational (e.g., placing purchase orders) processes.
* Experience in purchasing electronic components and strong commercial competence in the electronic components market.
* Experience in purchasing for product development projects, collaborating with cross-functional teams.
* Proven track record in driving cost optimizations and achieving measurable savings.
* Strong knowledge and hands-on experience of working with ERP systems (e.g., NetSuite or similar).
* Proficiency in English, both written and spoken. Proficiency in Swedish is also preferred.

 **Bonus skills**

* Experience working with contract manufacturers (EMS).
* Experience in purchasing mechanical components and commercial competence in the mechanical components market.
* A technical background with an understanding of electronics and/or mechanical components.
* Experience working with Product Data Management (PDM) systems.

**Our culture and beliefs:**


At Net Insight, **innovation**, **collaboration**, and **trust** are the cornerstones of our success. As one team, we are committed to delivering value to our customers, contributing to the growth and success of our company.


Together we create a dynamic and positive workplace where everyone is valued, engaged and empowered to make an impact

**Why choose us?**


At Net Insight, you’ll play a key role in shaping our Procurement function while working in an innovative and collaborative environment. With opportunities to influence processes, grow your expertise, and work closely with global partners and technical teams, you’ll enjoy a dynamic workplace that values your impact. We prioritize work-life balance, professional development, and fostering a strong, supportive culture.

**Welcome to apply!**

  

Upload you CV and upload relevant documentation of you choice - That's it.


The position is permanent, full-time employment, based in our Headquarters in Solna Business Park.

  

We are recruiting continuously and we aim to get back to you as soon as possible.

*Note: We do not offer relocation support at this time.*

*Note 2: Background check will be part of our recruitment process.*

 **This is NET INSIGHT**

*Net Insight (Nasdaq: NETI B) provides the highest performing, most open video transport and media cloud technology for content providers as the industry standard for flexibility and service across live contribution, distribution and remote production media workflows.*

*For over 25 years, the world’s leading content owners, broadcasters, production companies, service providers and enterprises have trusted Net Insight’s Emmy Award winning Nimbra technology to guarantee media delivery. Today, Net Insight partners with hundreds of customers in over 70 countries to ensure media flows across managed and unmanaged IP networks, and the cloud – from anywhere, to everywhere. It enables customers to get the best from any mix of virtualized, cloud and IP technology and is the only platform to support all the major industry standards, protocols and clouds.*

  

For more information, please visit *www.**netinsight.net*

title: Innehållsproducent till Praktikertjänst (föräldravikariat)
description:
Är du en kreativ kommunikatör med öga för detaljer och passion för att skapa engagerande innehåll? Då har vi det perfekta uppdraget för dig! Sveriges största vårdkooperativ, Praktikertjänst, söker nu en driven innehållsproducent till sin kommunikations- och hållbarhetsavdelning för ett vikariat med start i februari i 11 månader.


Som innehållsproducent hos Praktikertjänst får du möjlighet att vara med och forma hur de kommunicerar med sina 8 500 medarbetare och patienter över hela landet.


Du kommer att dela produktionsansvaret för koncernen och dess mottagningar med en annan innehållsproducent, i en organisation som värdesätter samarbete, kreativitet och hög kvalitet i allt de gör.


Tjänsten är placerad på Praktikertjänsts huvudkontor vid Hötorget i centrala Stockholm, där du rapporterar till kommunikations- och hållbarhetsdirektören. Du kommer att arbeta med powerpoint/presentationer för personer i ledningsposition samt stötta avdelningar och verksamheter runt om i Sverige. Teamet består av 14 personer som ansvarar för koncernens kommunikations- och hållbarhetsarbete.

**Rollen som innehållsproducent hos Praktikertjänst innefattar**

* **Produktion**: Skapa annonser för tryck och digitala kanaler, med fokus på digitalt innehåll
* **Filmproduktion**: Klippa och redigera film i olika format och för olika plattformar. Använda och utveckla innehåll i Adobe After Effects, Premiere och Storykit för effektiv och engagerande kommunikation.
* **Design och layout**: Arbeta i Adobe Creative Cloud (framför allt Photoshop, InDesign och Illustrator) för att skapa visuellt tilltalande material för interna och externa kanaler.
* **Manualer och riktlinjer**: Följa och implementera design- och skyltmanualer samt ge rådge organisationen och leverantörer kring deras användning.
* **Kreativ rådgivning**: Vara ett bollplank till kollegor i kommunikationsfrågor, stötta i idéutveckling och koncept.
* **Projektledning**: Hantera mindre projekt från start till leverans, det inkluderar samordning med interna och externa parter.

**Om dig, din bakgrund och erfarenhet**


Vi söker dig som kombinerar kreativ passion med strategiskt tänk. Du har jobbat runt 3–5 år, helst med erfarenhet från byrå eller snarlik arbetsmiljö. Du bör vara en person som älskar att skapa kommunikation som både syns och berör, med en naturlig förmåga att anpassa budskap till olika kanaler och mottagare.


Din professionella profil utmärks av en gedigen teknisk kompetens inom digitala verktyg, särskilt Adobe Creative Cloud, där du behärskar både design och videoproduktion. Men tekniken är bara ett verktyg - din styrka ligger i förmågan att berätta historier som engagerar och inspirerar.


Som person är du strukturerad och självgående, med kapacitet att hantera flera projekt parallellt utan att tumma på kvaliteten. Du kommunicerar tydligt och engagerat, både skriftligt och muntligt, och har en naturlig förmåga att samarbeta och rådgöra med olika delar av en organisation.

**Bra att veta**


Detta är ett föräldravikariat under 11 månader med start i februari och med anställning hos Praktikertjänst.


Praktikertjänst är mitt inne i en förändringsresa och erbjuder ett mångsidigt, stimulerande och roligt arbete med möjlighet att påverka svensk tandvård och hälso- och sjukvård. Rollen är bred med goda möjligheter till utveckling och stort eget ansvar. Tempot kan vara högt, men det finns en god balans mellan privatliv och arbetsliv med möjlighet till distansarbete vid behov. Kulturen är familjärt professionell, varm, öppen och omtänksam med stort engagemang, prestigelöshet och delaktighet.


Låter det intressant? Du söker enkelt genom ”Skicka ansökan!”-knappen, anger ditt namn, dina kontaktuppgifter och bifogar ditt CV. Vi önskar inget personligt brev från dig. Vi jobbar löpande med urvalet och uppmuntrar dig som lockas av rollen att söka omgående, sista ansökningsdatum är annars 7:e januari. Vi fram emot din ansökan!


Har du frågor om roller är du välkommen att höra av dig till ansvarig konsult Fredrik Svenburg, fredrik.svenburg@hammerhanborg.com

**Om Praktikertjänst**

*Praktikertjänst är en av Sveriges största vårdgivare med 750 mottagningar i 220 av landets 290 kommuner. Bolaget ägs och drivs av de som utför vården i vardagen, såsom läkare, tandläkare sjuksköterskor, tandhygienister, fysioterapeuter, barnmorskor och psykologer. Det skapar engagemang, delaktighet, kontinuitet och hög kvalitet i vården. Praktikertjänst ser det som den bästa modellen för att bedriva vård och en viktig anledning till att bolaget varje år hamnar i topp när det kommer till nöjda patienter och medarbetare. Visionen är långsiktigt hållbar vård för alla i hela Sverige.*

*För oss är det skillnad på att bara vara bra och att vara rätt. Kompetens är mycket mer än CV och vi matchar alltid utifrån potential, värderingar och motivation. Vi ser mångfald som en styrka och välkomnar därför alla sökande. Vi tycker det ska vara kul att jobba och tror på samarbeten som bygger på förtroende och schyst agerande. Vi uppmuntrar och utmanar varandra och våra kunder att vilja och våga utvecklas. Tillsammans skapar vi framtidens professionella liv. Välkommen med!* *Läs mer på* *hammerhanborg.se**.*

  

*Hammer & Hanborg by Jurek är medlemmar i Diversity Charter Sweden som verkar för en värld där olika idéer, kunskaper, erfarenheter och kompetenser räknas, där olikhet är en resurs.*

title: Creative Director- Yazen Health
description:
**Company overview:**


Yazen Health is a leading digital healthcare provider committed to delivering innovative and personalized health solutions for obesity treatment. We leverage cutting-edge technology and comprehensive health data to enhance patient care and optimize health outcomes. Our dynamic and forward-thinking team is dedicated to defeat obesity in the world.

**Position overview:**


Yazen Health is looking for an innovative and experienced Creative Director to lead the creative output of our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be a highly skilled and versatile professional with a strong background in advertising, marketing, publishing, film, graphic design, web building, email marketing, and social media.


This role requires a strategic thinker and strong ability to conceptualizing creative content while managing multiple projects, collaborating across departments, and delivering high-quality creative solutions. The candidate will play a pivotal role in shaping the visual elements of projects, ensuring they align with the creative vision which attracts the right audience in order to meet the company’s goals.

**Creative Inhouse Global Production Team:** As a driving force in Yazen Health’s marketing department, you will work closely with a collaborative and innovative team responsible for producing high-quality, impactful marketing materials. Your role will directly contribute to creating content that resonates with our target audience and elevates our brand.

**Responsibilities:**

**Conceptualization:** Collaborate with creative teams to lead the development of visual concepts and ideas that align with the company's goals and objectives.

**Storyboarding:** Create storyboards, mood boards, or visual presentations to convey the visual direction and concepts to the team.

**Visual direction:** Provide creative direction for the visual elements of projects, including design, photography, illustration, and videography.

**Design oversight:** Review and approve design work, ensuring it adheres to the established creative direction and brand guidelines.

**Artistic collaboration:** Collaborate with artists, designers, photographers, and other creative professionals to execute the visual elements of a project.

**Quality control:** Maintain high creative standards for all visual output, conducting thorough reviews and revisions as necessary.

**Team leadership:** Lead and inspire creative teams, providing guidance and feedback to ensure each project's success.  

**Trend awareness:** Stay updated on industry trends, design trends, and emerging visual styles to incorporate innovative elements into projects.

**Qualifications:**

**Education:** A bachelor's degree in graphic design, visual communication, fine arts, or a related field is typically required. Advanced degrees or relevant certifications can be advantageous.

**Experience:** Several years of experience in creative roles, and a proven track record of successful projects. Experience of a leading creative role in an Advertising agency is a big plus  

  

**Creative skills:** Strong creative thinking and problem-solving skills to develop unique visual concepts.

**Leadership skills:** Effective leadership and team management abilities to guide and inspire creative professionals.

**Analytical skills:** Have a strong ability to analyze trends, problem-solving and oversee creative projects.


**Interpersonal skills:** Ability to empathize and understand the patient’s point of view as well as team members' need and motivation.

**Software:**

**Adobe Creative Cloud:** Proficiency in Adobe software such as Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, and After Effects for reviewing and directing design work.

**Project management tools:** Familiarity with project management software Notion for overseeing creative projects and collaborating with teams. Knowledge of FIGMA and MIRO are also useful.

**Presentation software:** Tools like Google Slides, Keynote, or PowerPoint are used to create and deliver visual presentations.  

  

**Reporting**  

Reports to the Chief Marketing Officer  

  

**Salary and benefits**  

Job type: Full-time  

Salary: Competitive salary and Warrants, based on experience and qualifications.

title: Business Intelligence med erfarenhet av RPA
description:
Vi söker en erfaren och engagerad Business Intelligence utvecklare med särskilt intresse för att arbeta med Robotic Process Automation (RPA). Hos oss vår kund får möjlighet att kombinera din tekniska expertis med en lösningsorienterad inställning för att hjälpa våra kunder effektivisera och förbättra sina verksamhetsprocesser.

### **Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:**

* Utveckla och implementera BI-lösningar som stödjer kundens behov av dataanalys och rapportering.
* Identifiera och automatisera repetitiva processer med hjälp av RPA-verktyg.
* Utföra dataextraktion, transformation och modellering för att säkerställa hög datakvalitet.
* Designa användarvänliga och visuellt tydliga rapporter och dashboards.
* Samarbeta nära med kunder för att identifiera förbättringsområden och anpassa lösningar efter deras affärsmål.

### **Vi tror att du har:**

* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Power BI
* Kunskap om RPA-verktyg som UiPath, Automation Anywhere eller Blue Prism.
* Kunskaper inom AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud Platform.
* Stark förståelse för datamodellering och databashantering.
* Förmåga att kommunicera tekniska lösningar på ett tydligt och affärsorienterat sätt.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en rådgivande roll mot kunder, med ett intresse för att skapa värde genom teknik.
* Flytande i Svenska och Engelska


Du erbjuds en arbetsmiljö som är både inspirerande och variationsrik, där du får möjlighet att bidra till spännande projekt tillsammans med kunder från olika branscher. Här finns stora möjligheter att utvecklas inom både Business Intelligence och Robotic Process Automation genom att arbeta med innovativa och utmanande uppdrag.


Du blir en del av ett kunnigt och engagerat team där kunskapsdelning och samarbete är centralt för att nå gemensamma framgångar. Arbetsformerna är flexibla och anpassade för att ge dig en bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv.


Förutom konkurrenskraftiga anställningsvillkor får du tydliga karriärmöjligheter med fokus på både din professionella utveckling och din personliga tillväxt.

title: End-User Service Owner
description:
*Liquid Wind is seeking an* ***End-User Service Owner*** *to lead IT digital services across our dynamic organization. This pivotal role bridges business needs and technology, aligning IT services with our strategic goals. This could be the opportunity for you to join our team!*


The location for this position is in Sweden, Gothenburg or Denmark. There will travel within the role to our offices in Denmark and Sweden. The company language is English, and preferably you understand and speak a Scandinavian language. You will report to the IT Manager in Gothenburg, Sweden.

#### **About the role**


As **End-User Service Owner**, you will be instrumental in shaping and delivering IT digital services across Liquid Wind’s workplace environment. Acting as the link between business stakeholders and technology, you will ensure that IT services align with strategic goals and meet the needs of our growing organization. You introduce new technologies, streamline IT processes, and optimize existing and new services. You support our End-users, empowering them to utilize IT tools effectively and drive productivity.

**You will, among other things ...**

* Train End users in new services, tools and way of working
* Lead the development and delivery of IT digital services across the workplace environment, including hardware, software, and collaboration tools
* Drive continuous improvement by exploring and implementing new technologies, providing value to business growth
* Manage vendors and partners, ensuring they deliver high-quality services
* Develop standardized and scalable solutions to support Liquid Wind’s growth and future needs
* Secure advanced security measures to protect our systems and data
* Partner with suppliers to maintain and enhance service quality

#### **About you**


You are a proactive professional who thrives in fast-paced environments, combining technical expertise with a strong service mindset to support Liquid Wind’s mission. Structured and analytical, you tackle challenges with clear, actionable solutions. You understand how IT drives success, aligning strategies with business goals. Focused on empowering end-users, you prioritize tools, processes, and knowledge that boost productivity.

**To succeed in this role, you ...**

* A degree in Information Systems or a related field and professional experience in IT service support
* Proven experience in:
	+ Microsoft 365 Apps and Azure services
	+ ITSM tools (Preferably JIRA) and ITIL Processes including knowledge management
	+ IT HW asset management
	+ Identity and Access Management (SSO, AAD, MFA)
	+ Printers and conference room equipment
	+ Network/Infrastructure cloud solutions
* Proven experience collaborating with IT suppliers
* Are service minded with a commitment to delivering high-quality user experiences

#### **We offer you**


As a part of Liquid Wind, you will experience a dynamic and flexible work environment where each day brings new challenges and opportunities. You will have the chance to actively contribute to the green transition by joining a pioneering company at the forefront of sustainable energy innovation. Be part of a team driving meaningful change for a more sustainable future.

**Together** with our **strong values:**

* **Community:** We are working together with peers and partners to reduce dependency on fossil fuel. Strong community collaboration provides the power to drive real change.
* **Drive:** We put our ability to use here and now. We don’t wait for approval or answers from others. We don’t get stuck in endless discussions or negotiations. We act. Now.
* **Courage:** We have the willpower, conviction and resilience it takes to become a category leader. We never give up, and we are not intimidated by the scope of our task or the fossil industry we are gradually replacing.
* **Transparency:** In our business of green transformation, transparency will be critical to gaining trust. We must live by it and make sure our customers can too.


Visit **liquidwind.com** or follow us on **LinkedIn** and **X****.**


If you have any questions about the role, please contact Karin Bubach (Hiring Manager) karin.bubach@liquidwind.com


We are actively reviewing applications on a rolling basis and therefore encourage you to apply as soon as possible. Embracing the Liquid Wind vision and mission, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

#### **About us**


Our mission is clear: Reduce the world's dependency on fossil fuels. By developing projects and solutions that convert green hydrogen and biogenic CO2 into eFuel, Liquid Wind offers hard-to-abate sectors like global shipping, aviation and heavy industry the opportunity to accelerate their transition to sustainable fuels.


We use a standardized approach, modular solutions and a digital platform to efficiently scale and replicate projects. By adopting cost- and time-saving technologies, we streamline processes, enhance operational efficiency, and ensure the successful deployment of eFuels – with special focus on eMethanol.


With a solid pipeline of projects in development, our goal is to reach 10 projects by 2027. Headquartered in Gothenburg, Sweden and present in Denmark, Finland and the UK, we are backed by a strong group of investors, including Alfa Laval, Carbon Clean, Elyse Energy, HYCAP, Samsung Ventures, Siemens Energy, Topsoe and Uniper. We have approx. 80 employees and are looking for a person that enjoys developing and growing together with the company.

title: DevSecOps-ingenjör (Deltid)
description:
Följ med oss på vår roliga och spännande
 **SimpleSign-resa** 
 !
   

  

 Som
 **DevSecOps-ingenjör** 
 hos oss kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att integrera säkerhet i hela vår utvecklings- och leveransprocess. Du kommer att samarbeta med vårt globala team för att säkerställa att våra tjänster är säkra, skalbara och följer branschstandarder.
   

  

**Ansvarsområden**
* Implementera säkerhetskontroller i våra CI/CD-pipelines (GitLab CI/CD, GitHub Actions).
* Genomföra säker kodgranskning (SAST/DAST) och säkerställa att bästa praxis följs.
* Övervaka och hantera säkerheten i vår GCP-infrastruktur och Kubernetes (GKE).
* Utföra regelbundna penetrationstester och sårbarhetsskanningar.
* Implementera och underhålla verktyg för loggning, övervakning och incidentrespons (t.ex. Prometheus, Grafana, ELK).
* Säkerställa att vi följer säkerhetsstandarder som ISO 27001, NIST CSF och andra relevanta ramverk.
* Utbilda och stödja utvecklingsteamet i säker kodning och säkerhetsmedvetande.
* Dokumentera säkerhetsprocesser och rekommendationer.


**Kvalifikationer**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom DevSecOps, IT-säkerhet eller relaterade områden.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med CI/CD-verktyg som GitLab CI/CD, Jenkins, GitHub Actions eller liknande.
* Stark kompetens inom molnsäkerhet, särskilt med Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
* Erfarenhet av Kubernetes (GKE) och containerorkestrering.
* Kunskap om Infrastructure as Code (IaC) med verktyg som Terraform och Ansible.
* Erfarenhet av säkerhetsverktyg som OWASP ZAP, OpenVAS, HashiCorp Vault.
* Förståelse för säkerhetsstandarder som ISO 27001, NIST CSF, CIS Benchmarks.
* Grundläggande programmeringskunskaper i Python, Bash eller liknande.
* Flytande i engelska, både i tal och skrift.


**Meriterande Kvalifikationer**
* Certifieringar såsom CKS (Certified Kubernetes Security Specialist), OSCP, CISSP, eller liknande.
* Erfarenhet av att implementera compliance-krav som SOC 2 eller GDPR.
* Erfarenhet av penetrationstestning för webbapplikationer och molninfrastruktur.


**Vad Vi Erbjuder**
* Flexibla arbetstider – anpassa jobbet till din vardag.
* Möjlighet att arbeta på distans.
* Ett engagerat team som värdesätter lärande och utveckling.
* Möjlighet att ha en stor påverkan i ett växande företag.

title: Junior Consultants – Cyber Security
description:
*Are you close to graduation or at the beginning of your career? Do you want to work with top tier clients and develop within a firm with great career opportunities?* 
*KPMG is now looking for high performing professionals who want to contribute to the development of our Advisory business area Cyber Security in Stockholm and Gothenburg.*
**About Us**
 As Cyber Security Consultants, we advise our clients in their transformation journeys, and we always seek digital, innovative, and sustainable solutions to our clients’ business challenges.
   

  

 Working at KPMG Cyber Security is an excellent way to begin and advance your career. Within Cyber Security Sweden we are a diverse team of around 35 colleagues with experts in Information Security Management Systems, Risk, Identity and Access Management, Security Transformation, Control & Security Audits, Forensic Investigations, Security Maturity Assessments, Security culture and awareness and more.
   

  

 Our brand, diversity both as people and within our competencies, makes us a renowned vendor within the global cyber security market. We work with businesses in all sectors with a strong local presence. A profound part of our work is to support our clients with cyber security related advice when they integrate new technologies, and through digitalization optimize various processes. KPMG Cyber Security is now expanding; therefore, we are looking for new coworkers to join our office in Stockholm and Gothenburg.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 You'll be part of a global organization and work within various industries and areas, together with competent and inspiring colleagues. Already from the start you'll be part of interesting projects with our clients, working shoulder-to-shoulder with top tier consultants. Our clients vary and you'll be exposed to different sectors of the market and different levels of an organization. Furthermore, you will get a mentor and a dedicated performance manager supporting you in kickstarting your career.
   

  

 Being a Cyber Security Consultant at KPMG involves performing tasks such as:
   

  

* Delivering various security services to our customers across different sectors of the market
* Identifying new business opportunities and being part of sales activities
* Building and maintaining client relationships
* Contributing to an inspiring work environment where knowledge-sharing and continuous learning is promoted
* Developing our way of working within cyber security, together with inspiring colleagues across our advisory practice.


 If you’re social, humble and have excellent communication skills - we believe you could be the right candidate for our team. Further, we see our next teammate as someone who has an analytical way of solving problems and gladly contributes with new ideas and perspectives in both our joint discussions within the team as well as in the conversations with our customers.
   

  

 Our work is organized in teams and therefore we find it important that you’re a team player who can collaborate with all different types of people. We’re very excited to welcome our new recruits to our team and we assure you that you'll get a steep learning curve and valuable experiences from working alongside our clients while targeting their critical challenges, and in addition to that, you will have a lot of fun on the way!
   

  

 ,
   

  

**To succeed in this role,** 
 you:
   

  

* Are a student expecting to complete your studies by summer 2025, a recent graduate, or a professional with up to 2 years professional experience from any relevant area.
* Have a completed bachelor’s degree in computer and systems science, preferable within information security or equivalent with excellent academic results.
* Are a high performer with strong drive and high ambition.
* Are a team player – open minded with ability to network, as well as contributing as an inspirational team member.
* Are a person who has personal integrity and ability to exercise sound judgement and common sense.
* Fluency in Swedish is required; multilingual proficiency is meritorious. We value diverse backgrounds in our team.


**Want to make a difference with us?**
 Don’t wait with your application as we review applications and are hiring on a rolling basis. If you have any questions please contact Talent Acquisition Specialist Amanda Engberg, amanda.engberg@kpmg.se. Successful candidates will be based in Stockholm or Gothenburg and start in August 2025, or as agreed.
   

  

 In this process we have the following steps:
   

  

* Personality and logical tests
* Interview with case presentation
* Final interview
* Background check


**We look forward to your application and** 
**for new colleagues to join our team!**

title: Data Project Manager / Data Transformation Lead
description:
**Company Description** 




 DataBees is a young company in the Data domain, specializing in helping customers accelerate business outcomes and enhance their data-driven digital transformation initiatives. They offer services in Cloud and Data migration, Business Intelligence, Data Engineering and Analysis, Data Life Cycle Management, Data quality and Governance. DataBees aims to empower businesses with the latest data-driven advancements through robust practices.
 



  





**Role Description** 





 We are seeking a skilled Data Acquisition Lead to develop and manage data transformation frameworks while leveraging strong project management expertise. This role involves leading the architectural change towards the target setup which covers all the factors, tools and services in the data platform.
 




  





**Key Responsibilities** 





 Drive the target data transformation in the modern platform.
 





 Lead cross-functional teams to deliver data integration projects.
 





 Manage project timelines, risks, and stakeholder communication.
 





 Handling internal workshops, collect information in a structured approach, provide recommendations and formulate target transition,
 




  





**Qualifications** 



* Data Engineering, Data Analysis, and Data Life Cycle Management skills
* Experience in Cloud and Data migration and Business Intelligence
* Project management skills and ability to lead data transformation initiatives
* Expertise in programming techniques and big data technologies.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills
* Ability to work remotely and independently
* Experience in Data platforms architecture changes or related field is a plus
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field



  





**Why Join Us?** 





 Lead impactful data initiatives in a collaborative environment.
 





 Advance your career with cutting-edge technology and frameworks.
 





 Good chance to work with leading Swedish enterprise customers
 




  





  






 Language : English / Swedish
 




 Role : Contract / Permanent
 



 Start date : Dec-2024 / Jan-2025
 



  





 Apply now with your resume and cover letter!
 



 For any questions please get in touch with us through info@databees.ai

title: Regional Vice President - North
description:
Build the future of the AI Data Cloud. Join the Snowflake team.
   

  

 The RVP - North role is a unique opportunity to contribute in a meaningful way to high visibility, high impact projects at a very exciting time for the company. Snowflake is an innovative, high-growth, customer-focused company in a large and growing market. If you are an energetic, self-managed professional with experience managing a complex sales process and possess excellent presentation and listening skills, organization and contact management capabilities, we’d love to hear from you. The North region at Snowflake includes Nordics, Benelux and Switzerland markets.
   

  

 AS AN RVP YOU WILL:
   

  

* Have an in depth understanding on Snowflake's product to be able to provide guidance on selling, navigating complex legal negotiations, helping eliminate technical barriers, managing escalations
* Hire a team of leaders and individual contributors that fit Snowflake's profile for success
* Enable, coach, develop and motivate a robust field sales team
* Scaling and developing territories by planning strategically and effectively assigning accounts
* Navigate complex legal negotiations and help eliminate technical barriers
* Ensure success of events by collaborating with marketing efforts and being accountable for attendance
* Accelerate Time to Capacity Agreement: Ensure execution during sales cycle (Effective POC, Champion's decks, Partner Alignment, Services Alignment)
* Ensure customers are set up for success and are consuming Snowflake effectively (Strategic account planning with team, ensuring
* Customer Advisory Services is engaged, Monitor consumption of all customers, Product Management engagement, C-Level Engagement)
* Manage weekly forecast meetings with the Area Vice President, EMEA Sales
* Develop an in region partner network (i.e. SIs and Ecosystem partners like Tableau, AWS, Microsoft, Google, etc.)


 AS AN RVP, YOU WILL HAVE:
   

  

* Extensive experience building & managing teams of leaders and individual contributors within the designated countries
* The ability to manage and motivate the team and drive them to success
* Pro-active, independent mind set with high energy and a positive attitude
* Ability to think strategically and understand the "bigger picture" along with the business drivers around it


 Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.
   

  

 How do you want to make your impact?

title: ML Engineer
description:
Ansök nu
   

  

* Urval sker löpande


 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Vi tror att tekniken ger oss oanade möjligheter – för att utveckla människor, skapa bättre affärer och bygga hållbara samhällen. Vi letar efter dig som vet att det krävs laganda för att vinna på dagens marknad och vill skapa verklig förändring tillsammans med våra kunder genom att bygga starka team och förstå deras affärsutmaningar på djupet. Vår vision är att bli ledande inom Data & Analytics i Norden och vara förstahandsvalet för företag med affärskritiska datautmaningar. Vi är stolta över vårt Google Cloud-partnerskap och vår utmärkelse som "partner of the year", samt våra samarbeten med Microsoft och Snowflake.
   

  

***Det här är Forefront***
 Vi – Forefront – är ett verksamhets- och IT-konsultbolag som föddes 2008. Idag är vi över 500 anställda, eller Frontiers som vi hellre kallar oss. Vi har som ambition att bli Sveriges bästa arbetsplats. Det gör vi genom att uppskatta varandras olikheter, ständigt blicka framåt och skapa en organisation som är lika modig som klok. Tillsammans är vi förenade av delade visioner och drivna av större ambitioner. Med kontor och Frontiers över hela Sverige strävar vi efter att få teknik och människa att gå hand i hand.
   

  

***Vem är du?***
 Vi söker dig som har en ingenjörsutbildning eller motsvarande inom datavetenskap, statistik eller liknande, och vill forma framtidens datahantering. Du har erfarenhet som Data Scientist eller ML Engineer och har arbetat med molnplattformar, främst GCP eller Azure. Du har programmeringskunskap i SQL och Python, och certifikat inom GCP, Azure eller AWS är meriterande. För att lyckas i rollen behöver du vara kommunikativ, initiativrik och ha en stark förmåga att kombinera teknik och affärsnytta.
   

  

***Kvalifikationer***
**Vi Tror Att Du Har Erfarenhet Av**
* Arbeta med publika molnplattformar, helst Google Cloud Platform (GCP) och/eller Microsoft Azure.
* Arbeta med maskininlärning (ML), data science och data engineering.
* Stark kompetens inom programmering, särskilt i Python och SQL.
* Djup förståelse för MLOps principer.
* Utmärkta kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift, samt förmåga att kommunicera tekniska koncept på ett tydligt och begripligt sätt.

title: Azure DevOps Lead Technical Consultant
company_industry: Information Services, IT Services and IT Consulting, and IT System Data Services
description:
**Azure DevOps Lead Technical Consultant** 




  





**Job Summary** 




 The Lead Consultant for DevOps Solutions in Azure is responsible for managing and implementing DevOps practices using Azure DevOps. The primary goal is to optimize the software development lifecycle by enhancing collaboration, automation, and integration between development and operations teams.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




 1. Designing, developing, and implementing devops pipelines and workflows in azure devops.
 



 2. Collaborating with development and operations teams to facilitate continuous integration and continuous deployment (ci/cd).
 



 3. Monitoring and optimizing the performance of azure devops tools and processes.
 



 4. Troubleshooting and resolving issues related to devops practices in azure.
 



 5. Providing technical guidance and support to team members on azure devops best practices.
 



 6. Implementing security measures within the devops process to ensure data protection and compliance.
 



 7. Conducting regular assessments and evaluations to improve the efficiency of devops solutions in azure.
 



  





**Skill Requirements** 




 1. Proficiency in azure devops services and tools.
 



 2. Strong understanding of devops principles and practices.
 



 3. Experience with ci/cd pipelines and automation using azure devops.
 



 4. Knowledge of containerization technologies such as docker and kubernetes.
 



 5. Familiarity with scripting languages like powershell, bash, or python.
 



 6. Ability to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues in devops workflows.
 



 7. Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross functional teams.
 



 8. Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail in implementing devops solutions in azure.
 



  





 Certifications: Azure DevOps Engineer Expert certification is preferred but not mandatory required.
 



**Skill (Primary):** 




 Microsoft Dynamics (APPS)-Microsoft Azure-Tools and Standards-Azure - DevOps

title: DATA SCIENTIST
description:
**Our purpose**
 At SAS we are passionate about revolutionizing the aviation industry through cutting-edge technology. We aim to become Scandinavia's preferred airline with your help. As part of our AI Team, you’ll have the opportunity to shape the future of air travel by developing and deploying innovative solutions. If you’re excited about driving machine learning projects to enhance network efficiency and revenue optimization, this role is for you!
   

  

**About The Team**
 We are a central machine learning team that collaborates closely with stakeholders across various business units, identifying business challenges and opportunities that can be addressed through advanced analytics.
   

  

 We work with diverse machine learning projects, collaborate and contribute to the machine learning practice to ensure that we have a solid foundation for SAS to scale and realize the full potential of machine learning.
   

  

 We are now strengthening our team with an experienced Data Scientist focused primarily on optimization projects within Revenue Management and Network, enhancing our advanced analytics capabilities to drive continuous business optimization.
   

  

**Data Scientist - Focused on Revenue Management and Network Optimization**
 In this role, you’ll work closely with the Commercial team, collaborating with Data Analysts and System Specialists on cross-functional initiatives within Revenue Management and Network.
   

  

 Your primary responsibilities will include translating business questions into analytical requirements and actionable data science use cases, developing and maintaining machine learning models, and applying innovative analytical approaches to drive business value.
   

  

 You’ll bring a fresh perspective to problem-solving by exploring advanced analytical techniques to address business challenges and uncover valuable insights. Your contributions will strengthen our data-driven approach, building a foundation for SAS to scale and unlock the full potential of machine learning.
   

  

 We believe you share our passion for data and algorithms. In this dynamic, fast-evolving environment of digital transformation, your curiosity and enthusiasm for using algorithms to solve complex problems and inspire others will be invaluable.
   

  

**To Be Successful, We Believe You Should Have**
* Master’s Degree or higher with strong mathematics focus (Data Science, Statistics, Econometrics, Applied Mathematics, Optimization, Computer Science) or related field.
* At least 3 years of industry experience within Data science domain
* Proven record of taking on loosely defined problems and translating into practical application
* Strong mathematical background (e.g., linear algebra, calculus, statistics, optimization)
* More than 3 years’ experience with Python, SQL and popular machine/deep learning libraries
* Proficient with statistical- and machine learning models (both supervised learning and unsupervised learning)
* Well-versed in cloud computing, prior experience with Azure is a big plus


 We believe you share our passion for data and algorithms. You’re self-driven, persistent, creative, and curious, with a strong passion for learning. You seek to understand both the big picture and the intricate details that make it up. Like us, you get excited by commercial opportunities and proactively strive to create business value.
   

  

**Why SAS?**
**Benefits**
 At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:
   

  

* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
* Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
* Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
* Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Central Station, Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.


 If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please apply already today with your CV and a short personal letter. Last day for application is January 26th, 2025. For questions relating to this position, please contact hiring manager warren.edgren@sas.se.

title: Security Analyst
description:
**Job Description**
 The Security Analysts are the first line of defence, and the ones who detect, investigate, and respond to incoming incidents, investigations, and alerts. They make sure to prioritise what needs attention and to be handled first based on an analyse of urgency and criticality of the event. This role is taking the first actions on an incident to minimize the harm and secure the environment, it is securing the first evidence of compromise and documenting the process.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**Overall areas of responsibility and activities.**
* Perform Security Engineering tasks (build, maintain and further develop) in Azure (Sentinel), Microsoft 365, AWS and any other solutions managed by Northvolt.
* Proactively work towards continual improvements of security processes, tools and routines.
* Configure, troubleshoot, and maintain security infrastructure software and hardware.
* Monitor systems for irregular behaviour, set up preventive measures and use-cases.
* Develop, execute, and track the performance of security measures to protect information and network infrastructure, devices, and systems.
* Define and continuously improve the way of working based on the cybersecurity architecture and the needs of the organization.
* Support the different disciplines within the Cyber Defence Centre (and extended Security team) in creating/enhancing capabilities and workflows.


 Apply with CV in English or your complete LinkedIn profile.
   

  

 Full time employment, fixed salary.
   

  

 Planned starting date is asap.
   

  

*Please note that candidates considered for employment with NV may be subject to a mandatory background check process.*
*Please note that any applications submitted via email or direct messaging will not be considered.*
**Skills & Requirements**
**We believe that you have** 
**:**
* A bachelor's degree in related field or equivalent work experience. Practical experience as a Security Analyst in a SOC setting or related position is a plus
* Proven knowledge of security monitoring and incident response handling, cyber threat mitigation using SIEM tools and Cloud Security Engineering.
* Sound and broad technical knowledge of networks, platforms, operating systems and programming languages, including cloud technologies
* Knowledge of threat intelligence, threat hunting, vulnerability management, and handling of sensitive investigations.


**Specific Skills**
* Broad understanding of cyber threats including common attack vectors, TTP’s and attribution and its relation to frameworks and standards, like MITRE.
* Understanding of security platforms and systems including anti-virus applications, content filtering, firewalls, authentication systems and intrusion detection and notification systems.
* Knowledge of identity and access management principles.
* Knowledge of SOC best practices and practical ways of working.
* Experience and interest in OT-security and in manufacturing industry is a plus.
* Relevant security certifications like CCNP, GIAC, SCA, CISSP is a plus.


**Personal Success Factors**
* Excellent communication skills with fluency in written and verbal English, Swedish is a plus
* Appreciate and see a strength in collaborating with colleagues from different areas of expertise and experience
* Proudly share knowledge and happily guide and support colleagues
* Ability to work under high pressure and tight deadlines, with excellent time management
* Proven problem-solving and critical thinking skills
* Passionate & purpose drive
* Curious with a strong sense of right and wrong. Always objective, unbiased and ethical

title: Microsoft 365 specialist
description:
Vi söker dig som är en expert på Microsoft 365 och vill använda dina kunskaper i en rådgivande roll för våra kunder. Som M365-specialist kommer du att guida kunderna genom hela implementeringsprocessen för Microsoft 365. Utöver att förklara användningen av produkterna kommer du också att fördjupa dig i kundens verksamhet för att utveckla skräddarsydda implementeringsförslag. Därutöver kommer din roll innefatta att agera säljstöd samt leda workshops och utbildningar för att öka förståelsen och användningen av M365. Du kommer också att ge rådgivning om Microsoft 365-lösningar och genomföra analyser för att optimera såväl teknik- som affärsprocesser. Vidare ansvarar du för att designa och planera arkitekturen för M365, implementera lösningar samt hantera krav, utveckling och införande.
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* Har goda kunskaper inom Microsoft 365 och kan förklara hur kunder ska använda M365 samt sätta ihop skräddarsydda paket för dem
* Har ca 4 års arbetslivserfarenhet
* Har en bakgrund inom den tekniska sidan av Microsoft 365 och vill nu fokusera på affärssidan
* Är en skicklig kommunikatör med förmåga att bygga förtroende och relationer


 Du är lyhörd med en stark konsultativ approach. Din förmåga att skapa och underhålla relationer är en betydande är en av dina styrkor. Du är drivande när det kommer till att leverera resultat och söker alltid efter de bästa lösningarna för våra kunder.
   

  

**Varför välja oss som din nästa arbetsgivare:**
* Hybridarbete. Vi prioriterar din work-life balance. 50 % av din tid kan spenderas på distans.
* Teknikpeng: Vi delar din passion för teknik! Som ny medarbetare får du välja din utrustning och får dessutom en årlig summa för att hålla dig uppdaterad med de senaste prylarna.
* Fantastiska kollegor: Du kommer att bli en del av ett team som värnar om varandra. På QD lever vi efter våra värderingar: Glädje, Engagemang och Tydlighet. "101 % för dig" är vårt mantra, oavsett om det gäller dig som medarbetare eller våra kunder. Vårt engagemang har belönats med Great Place to Work-certifieringen sedan hösten 2020.
* Friskvård: Du får ett friskvårdsbidrag på upp till 5 000 kr.


 Är du nyfiken på att höra mer om QD som arbetsgivare? Lyssna här ➡https://open.spotify.com/episode/7DdWlG3PGGMcv9AHlblHxg?si=1c6dbe944a474da0 ;
   

  

 I så fall vill vi gärna lära känna dig bättre genom att ställa några frågor och ta en titt på ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil. Vi tror på en fördomsfri rekrytering, så inget personligt brev behövs. En bakgrundskontroll genomförs innan anställningsbeslut.
   

  

 Vi är IT-partnern med den perfekta storleken för dig! Vi bygger en långsiktig relation där vi bidrar med proaktivitet och affärsnytta för din verksamhet. Med vår leverans av IT-avdelning som tjänst gör vi alltid vårt yttersta för att leverera med hög kvalitet med ett personligt engagemang. Vi skapar förutsättningar för en bättre arbetsdag!

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**Set off to your next adventure with us as an Infrastructure Engineer. We look for you with an analytical mind, eagerness to learn, and drive to excel across Sellpy’s technical infrastructure.** 




  





**We are proud to be one of the fastest-growing scale-ups in Sweden and the leading service for second hand goods in Europe. We’ve seen rapid growth during the last few years, and today we list half a million new items for sale every week!** 




  





 To accomplish our vision of empowering everyone to live circularly, we need fantastic employees who want to grow with us. That’s why we’re on the lookout for an Infrastructure Engineer to help us take Sellpy to the next level.
 



  





**Infrastructure Engineer at Sellpy** 




 In this role, you will gain broad exposure to all aspects of Sellpy’s technical infrastructure. Reporting directly to our CTO, you will work closely with them on a variety of tasks, ranging from cloud orchestration to network design. This is a demanding position that requires the ability to think and work both strategically and operationally. You will take ownership of our infrastructure, growing with the role and responsibility to optimise our cloud environment for performant and cost-effective scalability.
 



  





**In short, you will** 



* Design, deploy, and maintain scalable infrastructure solutions with AWS services like CloudFront, Lambda, EC2 and S3.
* Manage cloud services (e.g., AWS and GCP).
* Optimise our MongoDB database to enable efficient querying at scale.
* Manage on-premise networking hardware.
* Automate infrastructure deployment using tools like AWS CDK and CI/CD pipelines.
* Monitor system performance, ensuring reliability, uptime, and security.
* Collaborate with our Engineering teams to optimise infrastructure for applications.
* Troubleshoot and resolve infrastructure-related issues promptly.
* Ensure infrastructure adheres to compliance and best practices.
* Stay updated with new tools and technologies to improve infrastructure efficiency.



  





**Requirements** 



* At least 2 years of work experience in a similar role.
* Confidence to stand on your own feet, as you will take ownership of your tasks and drive them independently.
* The curiosity to explore unknown areas that you haven’t worked with before.
* Great communication skills in English.



  





**We’d be impressed if you have** 



* A bachelor's or master's degree in computer science or engineering.
* Experience working with AWS-services like CloudFront, S3 and EC2.
* Experience with MongoDB or SQL databases.
* Experience with logging and health monitoring solutions.
* Worked in a fast-growing, product-focused startup environment.



  





**You get to** 



* Be part of a tech-minded company that's driving the change towards a sustainable lifestyle. In return, you will get direction, energy, and work on meaningful challenges daily
* Work with highly skilled and motivated colleagues.
* Gain new skills with unlimited access to a learning platform.
* Make use of prepaid vacation.
* Enjoy Sellpy credits and staff discounts at Sellpy and the H&M brands (Arket, COS, Other Stories, Weekday and more).
* Save up with a monthly pension plan.
* Engagement in Sellpy’s social traditions with game nights, interactive planning days, guest speakers and other activities.



  





**Location** 




 You’re welcome to work from our new office at Medborgarplatsen in Stockholm and from home. Ideally, we’d love to see you in the office regularly, as it helps create a positive and productive environment.
 



  





**Form of employment:** 
 Full-time
 



**Start:** 
 As agreed upon

title: Senior Account Manager
description:
Dialect levererar IT- och telefonilösningar till företag. Vi ser till att allt kan fungera ihop – oavsett tid, plats eller lösning. Utöver våra integrerade lösningar och vägledande kunskap erbjuder vi ett brett utbud av produkter och tjänster. Lösningarna innefattar bland annat mobiltjänster, växellösningar, support och drift av företagets IT-miljö.
 



  
 



 Vi är just nu inne i en spännande förändringsresa där vi utvecklar IT-erbjudandet till befintliga kunder, för att positionera oss som en självklar helhetsleverantör till företag inom SME-segmentet. Med ett högt fokus på att överträffa kundens förväntningar och ett tjänsteutbud i framkant så har vår resa bara börjat.
 



  
 



 Här på Dialect Business Center är kulturen väldigt viktig. Vi är ett gäng som stöttar och utmanar varandra för att kunna erbjuda marknadens bästa service och anpassade lösningar till våra kunder.
 



 Vi letar nu efter fler företagsamma och entusiastiska säljare till vårat team
 



  
 



 Rollen går ut på att:
 


* Ansvar över hela säljprocessen, från lead till avslut
* Skapa kontakt med nya företag genom nätverk, sociala medier etc
* Hålla presentationer och hjälpa företag till rätt lösning/beslut
* Växa våra konton genom churn-minimering och merförsäljning
* Omvärldsbevaka och hålla dig ajour med marknaden



  
 



 Vi letar efter dig som:
 


* Är nyfiken och intresserad av företagstjänster inom IT
* Är målinriktad och vill vara en del av Stockholms roligaste säljteam
* Är duktig i tal och skrift (på svenska och engelska)
* Har arbetat med kundkontakt och merförsäljning tidigare, med minst tre års erfarenhet av företagsförsäljning
* Innehar B-körkort



  
 



 Tjänsten är på heltid och placerad på vårt Stockholmskontor – ljusa och fina lokaler på Södermalm. 
 



 Skicka gärna in den ansökan så snart som möjligt eftersom vi intervjuar löpande och kan tillsätta rollen innan sista ansökningsdagen.
 



  





 Kontakt, Elsa Wintzell 0708288880

title: Marketing Communication Manager
description:
**Join Our Team as SMC’s new Marketing Communication Manager!** 




  






 Are you ready to join an innovative and international company? SMC is seeking a Marketing Communication Manager to lead our efforts in the Nordic and Baltic regions (NBC). With long-term goals and a strategy to become market leaders, you will play a key role in our marketing department.
 




  





**About SMC** 





 Founded in Tokyo in 1959, SMC Corporation is a globally recognized brand in industrial pneumatics. With a presence in over 80 countries, SMC generates nearly 5 billion EUR in revenue and employs more than 23,000 people worldwide. We are a world-leading development and manufacturing company in industrial pneumatics and electrically driven linear units.
 





 Our headquarters is in Stockholm for the Nordics and Baltics region. We also have offices and warehouses in Espoo (Finland), Horsens (Denmark), Lysaker (Norway), Riga (Latvia), Tallinn (Estonia), and Vilnius (Lithuania).
 




  





**About the Role** 





 As the Marketing Communication Manager, you will report directly to the Head of Product & Marketing for NBC. You will contribute to the generation of sales leads, enhance the company image, and lead a group of talented market communication professionals.
 




  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Develop and implement marketing communication strategies in the Nordic & Baltic regions.
* Lead, coach, and manage a team of marketing communication professionals, fostering a collaborative and high-performance culture.
* Coordinate and oversee all marketing communication activities, including digital marketing, PR, content creation, event management, and generating sales leads.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment of marketing strategies with business objectives.
* Enhance the Nordic & Baltic consolidation and best practices on all levels.



  





**Requirements:** 



* Understanding of pneumatic, industrial automation, or similar fields.
* Minimum 3 years of experience managing teams.
* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications, or business, or a minimum of 10 years of experience in marketing communication.
* Experience in digital marketing as well as traditional marketing channels such as organizing exhibitions.
* Experience of B2B marketing.
* Knowledge of graphical tools like Adobe Creative Cloud (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.) or similar.



  





**Relevant Skills:** 



* Digital marketing proficiency, and expertise in digital channels.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Experienced and passionate leader with proven management skills.
* Ability to inspire and motivate a diverse team.
* Ability to develop and execute successful marketing communication strategies.



  





**Meritorious:** 



* Experience in multi-cultural companies.
* English is the corporate language but skills in Finnish, Norwegian, Estonian, or Lithuanian are an advantage but not a must.



  





**Why join us?** 



* We offer a fun and varied job with great freedom and personal responsibility.
* Fantastic colleagues with a friendly and open-minded work environment.
* Development opportunities, and international travel in the NBC region.



  





**Other:** 



* Full-time employment.8
* Location: Huddinge, in the southern part of Stockholm (Sweden), in Espoo (Finland) , or Horsens (Denmark).
* Hybrid work opportunities are available, depending on job needs.



  





**Application:** 





 Apply directly here at LinkedIn or send your CV in English to job.nbc@smc.com. Please reach out to Head of HR Helen Alkfors, alkfors.helen@smc.com if you have any questions.
 




  






 The last date for application is January 31st, please note that we interview candidates continuously and that the position may be filled before this date.
 




  





**Diversity and Equal Opportunities** 





 At SMC, we believe that diversity drives innovation and success. We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone is valued and respected. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and strive to provide equal opportunities for all.

title: Accounts Payable Clerk (Entry Level Opportunity)
description:
**The role of an Accounts Payable Clerk at Canonical**
 We have an exciting opportunity for an Accounts Payable Clerk to join our growing team. If you are passionate about the technology industry and want to work for a company that aligns with your interests, we might be the place for you! Canonical, and our world class Ubuntu product, attracts some of the leading talent from around the world. Come and work with exceptional people and kick start your career in Finance!
   

  

 Our Finance team is growing and it's a really exciting time to join the team. We are looking for bright, truly motivated people who have a passion for making a difference. You will be seeking an opportunity to drive process improvements and change, input your ideas, grow your career and truly contribute to the team.
   

  

 Your role will include ensuring accuracy of the A/P ledgers, process supplier invoices in a timely and accurate manner, prepare supplier payments, deal with queries effectively and efficiently and maintain compliance with processes and procedures. You will learn the fundamentals of how finance works in an organisation.
   

  

 In return we will provide you with ample opportunity for career development including offering you with support for continuing education and the pursuit of professional Accounting certifications. You will report directly to our Global Controller who will help you develop into the role and guide you through your learnings.
   

  

**A day in the life of an Accounts Payable Clerk**
* Maintain accuracy of our A/P ledgers and reconciliation of accounts
* Manage our vendor data (names, addresses, etc.), validate and gain approval for new accounts, and maintain our audit record of vendor data changes and approvals
* Process our supplier invoices in a timely and accurate manner, including entry of invoices into accounting systems and maintain our files in a tidy and organised manner
* Prepare our supplier payments in line with the payments timetable and presented for approval in a clear and organised format
* Identify payments properly withheld, monitored and released when approval given
* Help with our month end processes: prepayments, accruals, bank reconciliations and balance sheet reconciliations
* Resolve questions/issues, escalating when appropriate in a timely manner
* Maintain compliance with processes and procedures, recommend corrective action when identified and maintain suitable records to demonstrate compliance


**What you will bring to the role**
* Exceptional education achievements in an Accounting or Finance subject
* Excellent spreadsheet skills, including pivots, look ups etc.
* Excellent attention to detail, with great organisation skills and the ability to meet deadlines
* Great communication skills that you will use when connecting directly with our customers
* A passion for the world of Finance with ambition to progress your career
* Experience using an exterprise level accounting system


**What we offer you**
 Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits below, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
   

  

 In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.
   

  

* Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Parental Leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Solutions Engineer
description:
* Ansök senast: 31 mars 2025


 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Snabbväxande företag använder Upsales varje dag för att skala upp sin verksamhet där våra kunder i snitt växer sin försäljning med 22%, efter bara ett års användning. Är du nyfiken på ett Saas-bolag med utmärkelsen Great Place to Work, årets IPO (2019) och som har branschens högst rankade Customer Success-team (Diamond Level)?
   

  

 Välkommen till oss!
   

  

 Vi älskar att hjälpa snabbväxande B2B-företag att hitta nya leads, vinna fler affärer och växa befintliga kunder. Eftersom att vi på Upsales nu fortsätter växa och utvecklas, är vi ständigt på jakt efter nya talanger där vi alltid erbjuder ett nästa karriärsteg för dem som visar initiativ och levererar konsekventa resultat. Det som också definierar oss är vår gemenskap och drivkraft att utvecklas framåt som ett team.
   

  

***Därför ska du välja Upsales***
**Ekonomiskt stabilt tillväxtbolag** 
 - Du kommer till en organisation med lång historik av effektiv och lönsam tillväxt utan riskkapital eller extern finansiering, vilket skapar stabilitet jämfört med konkurrenter som ofta tvingas varsla och dra i bromsen under tuffare tider.
   

  

**Möjlighet att utvecklas -** 
 Du får goda utvecklingsmöjligheter och tillgång till världens främsta utbildningsplattform inom försäljning och ledarskap, fri tillgång till böcker och inspirerande lunchföreläsningar.
   

  

**Entreprenöriell arbetsmiljö -** 
 Du får vara i en fartfylld och kul arbetsmiljö med korta beslutsvägar. Vi präglas av en stark entreprenörsanda och har en engagerad VD och Grundare. Upsales har vunnit pris som t.ex. Di Gasell, Årets IPO (2019) och ligger långt över branschstandard i pulsmätningar inom områden som t.ex. arbetsglädje, samarbete och ledarskap.
   

  

**Utöver Detta Får Du Också**
* Omfattande introduktions- och karriärplan
* Mindfulness-konto och gym på kontoret
* Frukost på kontoret varje morgon
* Moderna lokaler mitt i centrala Stockholm
* Två årliga kickoffs för företaget
* Konkurrenskraftigt kompensationspaket och sex veckors semester/år


***Ditt uppdrag hos oss***
 Nu effektiviserar Upsales försäljningsprocessen för att fortsätta mot våra satta tillväxtmål framåt. Som vår nya Solutions Engineer kommer du att stödja våra säljteam under säljprocesser genom att utifrån kundens behov ta fram och presentera anpassade lösningar, samt agera teknisk produktspecialist under hela säljprocessen.
   

  

***Arbetsuppgifter***
 Stötta säljteamet och kundansvariga i att stänga fler affärer genom att:
   

  

* Besitta extremt god produktkunskap och hålla dig uppdaterad med den produktutveckling som löpande sker.
* Förstå prospekts och kunders utmaningar och hur Upsales kan lösa deras problem
* Ta fram kundanpassade lösningar, demonstrera dessa och påvisa värdet av den föreslagna lösningen
* Genomföra workshops och proof-of-concepts
* Agera trusted advisor under säljprocessen och reda ut tekniska utmaningar och frågetecken


 Kvalifikationer
   

  

***Vem är du?***
* Du har erfarenhet inom projektledning och/eller kundanpassning inom mjukvarubranschen (helst CRM, Marketing Automation eller ERP) och en teknisk eller ingenjörsvetenskaplig universitetsexamen (eller motsvarande)
* Du är lösningsorienterad, har ett kommersiellt tänkande och besitter en utmärkt kommunikationsförmåga. Du är snabblärd och älskar att grotta ner dig i detaljer
* Du har en god teknisk förståelse, främst avseende IT, APIer och integrationer
* Du talar flytande svenska och engelska
* Det är en bonus om du tidigare arbetat med försäljning och nu vill gå över till den tekniska sidan

title: Engineering manager, Digital Transformation
description:
At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company.
