* Collaborate with stakeholders to define system requirements, manage risks, and ensure regulatory compliance (FDA Class II, MDR), including maintaining technical documentation.

What We're Looking For:
We are looking for someone that has:* Bachelor’s or Master’s in Systems Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field, with 8+ years in system design, development, and integration, preferably in regulated industries.
* Strong experience in system architecture, hardware-software integration, risk management, and familiarity with medical device regulations (FDA, EU MDR, ISO 13485).
* Skilled in systems engineering tools for modeling and requirements management, with expertise in troubleshooting and balancing performance, cost, and compliance.

Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.

title: Test Engineer
description:
Job Title
Test Engineer
Job Description*If you answer yes to the following questions, our team Audio Solution QA could be a perfect fit for you!** *Do you have a great interest in quality, software testing and programming?*
* *Close collaboration with product management, developers and other test engineers - does that sound great?*
* *Would you enjoy working with a mix of automated testing methods?*
* *Are you passionate about staying up to date with new testing programming, tools and trends?*

*The Axis Audio Solution Quality Assurance (QA) team are now looking for a Test Automation Engineer to our HQ in Lund, Sweden. Audio is a product area within New Business at Axis.*
Who is your future team?
We are the Audio Solution QA team dedicated to ensuring the Audio solution area delivers Axis products and solutions that earn customer trust, ensuring reliability and satisfaction.  

  

Our team consists of 16 test engineers with mixed experience, both seniors, specialists and junior engineers, and widespread background. We value teamwork and each other and care deeply about the quality culture! Together we innovate, secure and improve the world - through collaborative solutions that combine expertise, trust and a relentless pursuit of excellence.  

  

Get to know our QA organization:
Axis Communications • Meet Quality Assurance! - Jobcast | Podcast on Spotify
What you’ll do here as a Test automation engineer?
You will have the following responsibility areas:* Lead and development of new test automation frameworks and test cases
* Maintaining existing test automation framework
* Supporting other test teams with tooling and test case/test result visualization
* Developing and improving environments, methods and processes.
* Educating colleagues


Who are we looking for?
We are seeking someone like you – an individual with a wealth of knowledge and passion for quality, software testing and programming. You enjoy problem solving and finding new efficient test automation methods. You are flexible and have a good ability to learn new technology areas.  

You have a bachelor's or a master's degree in engineering or equivalent knowledge and experience.  

As a person, you are creative, responsible and unpretentious, and appreciate collaborating with different people. With your strong communication skills and a drive to get things done you can clearly express your ideas and proactively push initiatives forward.
What Axis have to offer
You will have great colleagues that want to succeed together with you. We learn and develop through the work with our products, and we are not afraid to try out new things! Internal courses and external development are also part of our work life. From you first day you will have a mentor colleague to help you find your way and tell you everything about working at Axis. At Axis we also have a great introduction program for new employees.  

The well-being of the employees is essential to us. We work actively with our culture where team spirit, equal opportunities for all and having fun are central parts. We want you to enjoy working with us! Therefore, we offer great benefits, e.g., flexible working hours, breakfast every day, classic Swedish fika on Fridays, corporate bonus, physical training grants, insurances, your very own Axis bicycle – just to name a few.
Ready to Act?
Come and interview us! Our hiring process is as much for you as it is for us – it is important that you get to form an idea of new colleagues, manager and culture at the company. At the end of the day, we should enjoy working together. A tip before an interview is therefore that you think about what you want to know more about, so that we can help you get answers.  

Interviews will be held continuously during the advertisement period, we do not necessarily wait until the end date of the ad. So don’t wait - submit your application today!  

If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Madeleine Kullegård, madeleine.kullegard@axis.com
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2025-01-17*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 4500 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast

title: Test Automation Engineer – Lead
description:
### **Responsibilities**



1. Ensuring that the following activities are conducted in an efficient and well documented way, i.e. working according to latest version of company Test Strategy:


* Test planning and control.
* Test analysis and design.
* Test implementation and execution.
* Test evaluation: exit criteria and report.


2. Capability to co-ordinate and take responsibility for all QA activities.



3. Driving continuous improvement and introduction of best practices, ensuring the availability of test environment and test data, understanding and addressing testing skill gaps as well as coaching and helping team members to ensure agility and excellent deliveries.



4. Implements one of our frameworks for API tests automation using Postman, Swagger, Robot Framework.



5. Develops and maintains test automation scripts.



6. Creates and maintains test cases.



7.Provides Test documentation/evidence.



8. Follows company common data model.





**Requirements**


* SQL Concepts.
* ISTQB Testing Knowledge.
* Experience in managing software testing projects/activities and resources.
* Proactive approach towards communication, identifying challenges and solutions to problems, planning work for QA team.
* Formulate / review actions to ensure software testing strategies are aligned with company Quality and Testing Standards.
* Review business / software requirements and provide input.
* Prepare / review test plans.
* Analyze test results and test metrics.
* Prepare / review / present test reports.
* Coordinate with other managers (Project Manager, Development Manager, etc) to ensure the highest level of software quality.
* Communicate with development teams, architects, test environment people to define E2E testing scope and test environments to be used for testing.
* Experience in SAFe and QA in Agile.
* Hands-On Experience in test management tools (preferably qTest or similar).


**Desired Skills**


* It may be good to have experience also in Selenium.
* Understanding of AML will be an advantage.
* Gen AI and ML experience will be an advantage.

title: AUTOMOTIVE DIAGNOSTIC, METHOD OR PARTS ENGINEER
description:
Sigma Technology* All open positions
* Open Positions details
**JOB DESCRIPTION**
-------------------


Sigma Technology Information seeks automotive professionals. You may specialize in diagnostics, methods, parts or all three of them!

* Do you have technical knowledge from the automotive industry?
* Do you like describing complex technology in a simple way?
* Do you have a feeling for user-friendliness and information flow?
* Do you want to work with new exciting technical products before they reach the market?


Then you would probably be perfect to join our growing team and help develop, update, and maintain information of various sorts for several customers in the Göteborg area. You may be a former car mechanic, or you may have a university degree. It doesn’t matter, as long as you have the technical background needed for this job.

**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**
------------------------


To be a successful diagnostic, method, or parts engineer, you probably have:

* Technical knowledge about motor vehicles and competence within service and repair methods
* An understanding of a mechanic’s need for information and an ability to create this information in English
* A curiosity for technology and an interest for other people as you would work in a consultant role
* A good knowledge of English, Swedish is a merit
**PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS, EXPERIENCE**
------------------------------------------------------------


A successful candidate probably has some of the following qualifications:

* Previous experience within automotive aftermarket industry
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Previous knowledge of Vida, Impact or similar aftermarket systems
* For diagnostic engineer positions: knowledge of systems such as DSA, Grade X, wiring diagrams etc
* For service method engineer positions: experience from technical drawings and illustrations
* For parts engineer positions: knowledge of 3D CAD software, Windchill, Teamcenter, technical drawings etc
**WE OFFER**
------------


At Sigma Technology, we put you as a consultant in focus. We offer you good opportunities for development and a variety of assignments and customers, as well as offering events and benefits that suit you personally.

title: MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER/ DATA SCIENTIST
description:
Sigma Technology* All open positions
* Open Positions details
**JOB DESCRIPTION**
-------------------


Är du intresserad av att arbeta med maskininlärning och AI? Trivs du med att omvandla den senaste tekniska utvecklingen inom ML/AI till dataprodukter som kommer att användas över hela världen? Vill du bli en del av ett framgångsrikt och globalt företag i framkanten av digitaliseringen?


Då kan du vara den vi söker!


Just nu har vi ett behov av dig med bakgrund inom både maskininlärning och datavetenskap.

**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**
------------------------


För att lyckas i denna roll behöver du ha följande grundläggande kvalifikationer:

* Minst en master- eller doktorsexamen inom ett relevant högkvantitativt område som datavetenskap, statistik, matematik/tillämpad matematik, maskininlärning, datavetenskap, eller andra teknik/naturvetenskapliga områden med tillämpad matematik.
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med avancerad analys, maskininlärning, datavetenskap eller algoritmutveckling i en professionell miljö.
* Behärskar minst ett av de populära programmeringsspråken för avancerad dataanalys och maskininlärning som Python, C, C# och R eller liknande språk.
* Erfarenhet av ett ramverk för djupinlärning (t.ex. tensorflow, keras, Torch).
* Flytande svenska och i engelska i tal och skrift.


Det är extra meriterande om du även har ytterligare erfarenhet inom följande:

* Erfarenhet av att arbeta agilt.
* CI/CD erfarenhet.
* Erfarenhet av att använda JIRA och git.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med och utveckla maskininlärningsmodeller för tidsseriedata.
* Erfarenhet av utveckling av djupinlärningsmodeller.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Transformers och LLM ML arkitekturer.
* Erfarenhet av de verktyg och tekniker som behövs för implementering av ML-modeller i produktionsmiljöer.
* Uppdaterad med den senaste algoritmiska och arkitektoniska utvecklingen inom områdena ML och AI.
**PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS, EXPERIENCE**
------------------------------------------------------------


Vi lägger stor vikt vid din personlighet och din vilja att utveckla dig tillsammans med oss. Som person tror vi att du uppfyller följande:

* Du har intresse, lust och vana att ta till dig ny teknik.
* Du är en duktig kommunikatör som tycker om att bygga nya relationer.
* Du har ett mycket analytiskt tänkesätt och är både noggrann och strukturerad.
* Du är en initiativtagare som både är flexibel och ser lösningar istället för problem.
* Du ser till att dina leveranser håller hög kvalitet och respekterar uppsatta deadlines.
* Eftersom du kommer att arbeta som konsult trivs du i internationella samarbetsmiljöer.
**WE OFFER**
------------


Vi erbjuder en arbetsplats gjord för dig


Din tillväxt är vår prioritet – för utan dig finns det inget vi. Vi är ett konsultföretag som värdesätter individuell utveckling. Här kommer du att bli respekterad och arbeta tillsammans med ett otroligt team av olika individer.


Du får enkel tillgång till hantering och all nödvändig information. Vi vill att du ska trivas på Sigma Technology, så vi erbjuder tilltalande anställningsvillkor. Vi är stolta över vår kultur, som är rotad i passion, ömsesidig respekt och ett gemensamt uppdrag för att skapa en bättre framtid. Det är här du kan jaga dina drömmar samtidigt som du har roligt på vägen.

**CONTACT**
-----------


Marielle Dittmer,  


marielle.dittmer@sigmatechnology.com

description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



Vi på Sigma Industry Evolution jobbar med att hjälpa några av de ledande teknikföretagen i flertalet branscher med att bemöta de utmaningar som de står inför. Nu söker vi erfarna testingenjörer.



Du är intresserad av att jobba med att utveckla testmjukvara för produktionstester och har god förståelse för elektronik och mekanik.


### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**


* Du har en högskole- eller civilingenjörsexamen.
* 3+ års erfarenhet av produktionstestutveckling.
* 3+ års erfarenhet i C#.
* Stor förståelse för elektronik och mekanik.
* Erfarenhet i Azure.

### **PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS AND EXPERIENCE**



Som person är du social och har ett stort intresse för teknik. Du är självgående, drivande och noggrann i ditt arbete. Som konsult på Sigma är det också viktigt att ha god förståelse för kundens önskemål samt teknikens möjligheter.



### **WE OFFER**

*Kombinationen av lång branscherfarenhet, stort engagemang, interna och externa uppdrag samt ett tätt samarbete mellan Sigmas olika verksamheter i regionen skapar ett unikt branschöverskridande växthus för ingenjörer. title: Design System Engineer
description:
**What makes us Qlik?**  

A Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ Leader for 14 years in a row, Qlik transforms complex data landscapes into actionable insights, driving strategic business outcomes. Serving over 40,000 global customers, our portfolio leverages pervasive data quality and advanced AI/ML capabilities that lead to better decisions, faster.  

We excel in integration and governance solutions that work with diverse data sources, and our real-time analytics uncover hidden patterns, empowering teams to address complex challenges and seize new opportunities. **The****Design System** **Engineer****role:**  

You will join the cross-functional Core Design Language System team which designs, develops and spearheads adoption of, a modern Design Language System that enables consistency and efficiency in UI design and development across the organization as well as bridges the gap between design and development.  

Your role as an Engineer in this team is to build out the core assets (UI components) as well as tools (Node scripts, GitHub actions, Figma plugins/widgets, etc.) required to enable designers and developers to both adopt and be satisfied with the Design Language System.  

We work in a SaaS environment, using primarily React, CSS, and TypeScript on the development side, Figma and Token Studio on the design side, and Astro and Markdown/YAML on the documentation side. You will report to the Head of Design.  

**What makes this role interesting:**  

* You get to be a part of a dedicated team working towards improving quality and efficiency in both UI design and development by designing and building out a top-modern Design Language System with broad organizational buy-in, clear goals, and high expectations.
* You get a rare chance to improve your competence in a broad field including UI design and development at scale by being a key person enabling efficiency for both designers and developers.
* You get to work with continuous improvement methods in modern SaaS environment utilizing micro-frontends and micro-services.

 **Here’s how you’ll be making an impact:**  

* Play a key role in the development of the very core of our Design Language System.
* Come up with your own suggestions to technical and/or feature improvements.
* Communicate and collaborate with designers, developers, architects, product managers, and other stakeholders across the global organization.

 **We’re looking for a** **teammate** **with:**  

* A genuine interest in software engineering and UI design, learning, taking responsibility and initiative.
* 3+ years of experience from working with Web-based UI development, including JavaScript (preferably React and TypeScript), and CSS.
* Working knowledge and experience working in an agile environment..
* Excellent verbal and written English skills as the company language is English.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science (or similar).
* Previous experience of working with Design Systems, Figma, Figma Plugin/Widget/REST API, and Node are a plus.

**The location for this role is:**  

This position is available in Lund (Sweden). You will work in a team with colleagues both onsite and remote. Work-life balance is something we value at Qlik. **Apply now and help change how the world transforms complex data landscapes into actionable insights and turns complex data challenges into new opportunities!** **More about Qlik and who we are:**  

Find out more about life at Qlik on social: **Instagram**, **LinkedIn**, **YouTube**, and **X/Twitter**, and to see all other opportunities to join us and our values, check out our **Careers Page**.  

What else do we offer?* Genuine career progression pathways and mentoring programs.
* Culture of innovation, technology, collaboration, and openness.
* Flexible, diverse, and international work environment.

  

Giving back is a huge part of our culture. Alongside an extra “change the world” day plus another for personal development, we also highly encourage participation in our **Corporate Responsibility Employee Programs** ***If you need assistance applying for a role due to a disability, please submit your request via*** ***accessibilityta*** ***@*** ***qlik*** ***.com******.*** ***Any information you provide will be treated according to Qlik’s Recruitment Privacy Notice. Qlik may only respond to emails related to accommodation requests.***

title: HV Charging System Engineer
description:
*We are Zeekr Technology Europe. Powered by engineers and creative minds from all over the world. Located in Gothenburg, Sweden, one of the leading mobility innovation grounds worldwide. Established in 2013 as CEVT and began with the mission to create a revolutionary modular vehicle architecture, CMA. As of 2024, CEVT is now Zeekr Technology Europe, signaling our belonging within Zeekr. Delivering intelligent, sustainable, and user centric technology and software for tomorrow's electric mobility today.*


Are you ready to embark on a journey where innovation meets expertise? We seek an **HV Charging System Engineer** to join the Attributes & Power Distribution team. As part of our dynamic team, you will be at the forefront of revolutionizing the automotive industry. Here's your chance to make a difference!

**What You'll Do**

* Develop groundbreaking concepts that meet project prerequisites, pushing the boundaries of what's possible.
* Craft functional specifications and requirements, ensuring the highest levels of functionality, quality, and regulatory compliance.
* Work closely with suppliers and colleagues in China as well as test facilities globally.
* Collaborate with stakeholders in detailed design reviews, fostering innovation and excellence.
* Refine requirements and allocate them to subsystems, driving efficiency and effectiveness.
* Conduct rigorous quality assurance reviews, including FMEA and Risk Assessments, ensuring safety and reliability.
* Manage system/component suppliers, guaranteeing delivery of top-notch components on time and as per specifications.
* Take charge of resolving project and fault reports, identifying root causes and implementing corrective actions.
* Drive development and design improvements, optimizing components, systems, costs, and manufacturing methods.

**Is it You?**

* You have a documented experience in HV systems and/or Charging System development, focusing on high power charging and power electronics.
* Experience in embedded electronics and ECU development
* Proficiency in Functional and Cybersecurity standards, ensuring cutting-edge solutions.
* Ability to manage tasks independently and tackle challenges with unwavering energy.
* Cultural awareness, particularly in Asian-European dynamics, with experience working with Chinese teams highly valued.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken, facilitating seamless communication.

**Why should you join us?**


Let's face it, there are plenty of opportunities out there. But here's why joining us is a game-changer:

* Culture & Community: We're more than just colleagues—we're a tight-knit community that supports and celebrates each other's successes.
* Opportunity for Growth: At Zeekr Tech Eu, your growth is our priority. We provide ample opportunities for learning, development, and advancement.
* Impactful Work: Make a real difference! Join us in tackling exciting challenges and contributing to projects that have a positive impact on our customers and society.
* Flexibility & Balance: We understand that life happens, which is why we offer flexibility and work-life balance to ensure you can thrive both personally and professionally.
* Perks & Benefits: From competitive salaries to awesome perks like 30 vacation days, 8 additional ATK days and an annual STI program to reward your performance, we've got you covered.

**Do you want to join us on our journey? Welcome to contact us for more information:**


Björn Lövhammer, Head of Attributes & Power Distribution, bjorn.lovhammer@zeekrtech.eu for questions regarding the position.

  

**Last application date: 2025-01-03**


Apply today, we will perform ongoing selection during the application period. We look forward to hearing from you.


Please note that due to **GDPR, we can only accept applications and CVs sent through the recruitment system**, not via email or other channels.

title: Basetech Testing and Verification Engineer-Automotive
description:
We are looking for a **Experienced Basetech Testing and Verification Engineer** for a global automotive company in Gothenburg, Lindholmen.

**The Company**


The company develops next generation solution for Infotainment, connectivity, audio system and more. In the team, they work with system integration testing on the full Connected Experience domain level (6-7 ECUs) to secure the basetech functionality and support developing ARTs.

**What will you do?**


You will be part of a competence team within the basetech area. Here you will have the opportunity to learn and develop for every sprint. It is a complex technical area and essential for all other functions in the car. They have created this team with focus on Basetech and the team act as Subject Matter Experts within the in the full Connected Experience domain. The team focuses on software download, diagnostics & power management.

**Some of the activities included in this role are:**

* Create automated test cases for the domain CI and analyze results
* Manual testing on rigs and cars to find faults or fault trace
* Clarifying basetech requirements
* Support factory and aftermarket analyze issues


If you would like to contribute to the next generation and create system foundation, then this could be the right thing for you. Together they develop a technical area that is crucial for continued success. Join to become part of a new future within intelligent automotive.

**Do you fit the profile?**

* They are looking for professionals with genuine interest in cars and infotainment
* They believe that you at least have a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or equivalent.
* They see that you have strong automotive Basetech competence in Diagnostic, Power Management, Software download, Ethernet, CAN and like working with CANoe/CANalyzer and Wireshark when you are troubleshooting.
* To create the automated test cases you need skills in CAPL/Pytest/Python.
* Are you familiar with the processes involved in building cars on the line in the factory?
* Experience form Continuous Integration in automated test is meritorious. You are fluent in English (both written and spoken).

**Site:**


Lindholmen, Göteborg

**This is a full-time consultant position through Incluso in Gothenburg. Start is in February 2025, One year's limited contract to begin with, possibility of extension after that.**


Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis.


For more information about this role, please contact Kanika Singhal, recruiter at Incluso.

title: Automotive Functional Safety Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------

**Capgemini Engineering** **is a global leader in engineering and R&D services. We was previously known as Altran Technologies before being rebranded. The company specializes in helping clients accelerate their digital transformation and innovation cycles by leveraging cutting-edge technologies in digital and software, agile engineering platforms, and an industrialized delivery model.**  

  

**With over 55,000 engineers and scientists worldwide, Capgemini Engineering focuses on three main areas:**  

  

**Products and Systems Engineering:** **Mechanical, physical, electrical, electronics, and systems engineering.**  

**Digital and Software** **: Software engineering, connectivity, network engineering, data science, analytics, and AI.**  

**Industrial Operations:** **Manufacturing, process engineering, operations management, and product support.**  

  

**Capgemini Engineering’s work spans various industries, including automotive, aerospace, telecommunications, and healthcare, helping companies develop smart products, optimize operations, and create new customer experiences.**  

  

**Why Choose Us?**  

  

**Innovative Projects:** **Dive into exciting projects at the forefront of Automotive development, shaping the future of mobility.**  

**Top-Notch Tools:** **Access the latest tools and technologies, empowering you to excel in your craft.**  

**Collaborative Environment:** **Work alongside a talented team of professionals, collaborating seamlessly to conquer challenges and achieve excellence.**  

**Continuous Growth:** **Fuel your passion for learning with ongoing training and development opportunities.**  

**Impactful Work:** **Make a meaningful impact by contributing to the creation of safe, reliable, and innovative automotive solutions that touch lives globally.**

**Works in the area of Software Engineering, which encompasses the development, maintenance and optimization of software solutions/applications.1. Applies scientific methods to analyse and solve software engineering problems.2. He/she is responsible for the development and application of software engineering practice and knowledge, in research, design, development and maintenance.3. His/her work requires the exercise of original thought and judgement and the ability to supervise the technical and administrative work of other software engineers.4. The software engineer builds skills and expertise of his/her software engineering discipline to reach standard software engineer skills expectations for the applicable role, as defined in Professional Communities.5. The software engineer collaborates and acts as team player with other software engineers and stakeholders.****Job Description**
-------------------

**Your Role**  

  

**As a functional safety engineer your responsibility will be to:**  

  

* **Develop system and software level work products for customers in Automotive Safety domain**
* **Responsible for the technical coordination and management of safety work products**
* **Work with safety related specifications and regulations such as ISO 26262, SOTIF, etc.**
* **Perform safety analyses such as HARA, TARA, FTA, FMEA, DFA**

  

**Your Profile**  

  

**We are looking for a motivated and self-driven individual with the right skills, who is very good in communicating and has the ability to work in a structed way together with a team.**  

  

**Degree:** **Computer Science, Software Engineering, or similar education with minimum 4+ years professional experience in functional safety.**  

**Experience:** **Working with Safety-critical systems, safety norms and regulations such as (ISO 26262, SOTIF), safety analyses such as (HARA, TARA, FTA, FMEA, DFA), safety requirements, concepts, and mechanisms.**  

**Knowledge:** **Methods and tools for software and system development**  

**Tools:** **Familiarity with safety tools like Ansys Medini, Isograph FTA+ as well as development tools such as Enterprise Architect, Rhapsody, etc. is a plus**  

**Skills:** **Independent, proactive, team-oriented, enthusiastic, flexible, structured, good problem-solving, customer-facing, confident, thoughtful, detail-oriented, up-to-date with market developments, excellent communication.**  

  

**Application and Contact**  

  

**Selection and interviews are running continuously. Apply now to join our team and make a meaningful impact in the automotive industry.**  

**For questions and for more information contact Jan Hansson, Talent Acquisition Partner, 0725-616900**  

  

**Kindly note that due to GDPR, we will not accept applications via mail. Please use our career site.**  

  

**We kindly but firmly refrain from direct contact with staffing, brokerage, and recruitment companies as well as other external actors and sellers of additional job advertisements.**  

  

  

**#LI-JH6**

title: Life Cycle Analyst Engineer
description:
You will work in a team dedicated to sustainability, environment, and chemical compliance within the Lab organization in the R&D department at Electrolux Professional. The team is the local Sustainability and Environmental team, working with local facility-based Environmental Engineers and Central/Group Sustainability Officers.  



You will collect data that will be the basis for creating Environmental Product Declarations, Digital Product Passports, Life Cycle Assessments, Documentation of Conformity, etc. Prior to collecting the data, you will define methods and processes needed to ensure quality and reliability in the data. Data will be collected through suppliers of Electrolux Professional and within the organization of the Electrolux Professional Group.  



You will support project teams by analysis of different choices for materials, packaging, weights, etc. related to environmental impact and present to the teams in order for the company to make decisions based on environmental data and calculations. You will define methods and processes in alignment with the scope of the project teams, and you have access to software tools and standards. You will have the Central Sustainability Team and your team members in the local Environmental and Sustainability Team to support you in your work.  



Our mission is to make our customers’ work-life easier, more profitable, and truly sustainable. As a member of the LAB Team, You are an ambassador for LAB and will together with the team educate and share our working principles.


  
* Verification and testing (RoHS, REACH, RML, outturn samples).
* Method and process development.
* Sustainability (Digital Product Passport, Environmental Product Declarations, Documentation of Conformity, LCA).
* Environmental analysis of materials.
* Data quality analysis.

  
**Qualifications and valued qualities:**

* Minimum Bachelor Degree in Environmental and Sustainability field.
* Knowledge of environmental and sustainability terminology (EPD, DPP, LCA, GHG, etc.).
* Structured and organized approach.
Standardized work method.  
* 

**Previous Experience on:**

* Material analysis.
* Documentation.
* Systematic work methods.
* Development of methods and/or processes.
* LCA.
* Environmental and sustainability analysis.

  
**About the Electrolux Professional Group**  

The Electrolux Professional Group is one of the leading global providers of food service, beverage, and laundry for professional users. Our innovative products and worldwide service network make our customers’ work-life easier, more profitable – and truly sustainable every day. Our solutions and products are manufactured in 13 plants in eight countries and sold in over 110 countries. In 2023, the Electrolux Professional Group had global sales of SEK 12bn and approximately 4,300 employees. Electrolux Professional’s B-shares are listed at Nasdaq Stockholm. For more information, visit https://www.electroluxprofessionalgroup.com

title: Design Engineer
description:
Join an industry leader and make a positive change in the sustainable use of the world’s natural resources. Together, we will transform the business and drive the industry toward a greener future.
  
  

At Metso, you will be supported by our inclusive culture and a network of colleagues from around the world. With us, you will embark on a personal growth journey and are encouraged to realize your potential. This is your invitation to rise above the possible.
  
  

**Job posting end date:** 01/19/2025
  
  

Introduction
  
We are seeking a Design Engineer to join our global Customer Order Engineering (COE) team. You will be primarily responsible for customization designs for customer orders and quotations, product care design tasks, and technical support to manufacturing and other COE-teams globally. In this position, you will report to the COE-Manager. This position is mainly located in Sala, Sweden, but we are happy to offer flexible working arrangements, including hybrid options. Despite this, we see physical presence at the office in Sala as a key success factor.
  
  

Team you belong to
  
The Customer Order Engineering (COE) group in Sala designs world-leading slurry pump assemblies adapted to the needs of Metso’s customers. Together, the group produces designs, manuals, and articles for quotes and orders for complete assemblies with pumps, motors, drives, and protection. For this efficient team, we are now looking for a Design Engineer. The group you will work in consists of six designers, three material master data handlers, and three IOMS creators. You will belong to a global organization with teams in Sweden, the USA, India, Brazil, and Peru.
  
  

What you’ll do
  
  

As a Design Engineer, you are responsible for made-to-order design solutions for customers all over the world for slurry pumps, hydro cyclones, and hoses according to customer requirements.
  
  

**In this role, your daily tasks include:**  

Creating 3D and manufacturing drawings utilizing Metso’s current design software based on standard designs and calculations. Maintaining data and part numbers using the Product Lifecycle Management system (PLM).
  
Creating outline drawings for customers and assembly, and detail drawings for our operations. Performing/initiating basic strength evaluations/calculations.
  
Assisting with problems regarding assembly or parts incorrectly fabricated with internal operations and external suppliers. • Performing documented product safety reviews as part of the daily design process.
  
Developing new solutions independently and sometimes leading the design scope in order projects.
  
Identifying the needs for design changes from production requirements as well as quality and procurement needs.
  
  

Who you are
  
  

Bachelor’s degree or higher in Mechanical Engineering and/or equivalent professional experience and a general interest in Design engineering.
  
1-2 years of experience in the use of 2D-drafting and any of 3D-CAD programs such as Solidworks, Autodesk Inventor, AutoCad, Catia and PTC Creo.
  
Knowledge/experience in any of the PLM systems. Previous working experience in Autodesk vault/Teamcenter is merit.
  
Knowledge and interest of the Mining industry specially pump industry and/or experience in multiple technical industries is a merit.
  
Good communication skills and ability to work proactively, communication involves both written and spoken Swedish and English.
  
  

We are looking for someone who is creative in problem-solving with a great interest in technology. You are someone who wants to take an active role in further developing working methods and processes. You have the ability to work both independently and collaboratively with others. You should be eager to share your knowledge and experiences. You possess a service-oriented mindset with a strong focus on business growth and profitability. You are driven, responsible, and structured with a commitment to delivering on time. Additionally, you are meticulous with documentation and thorough in your work.
  
  

What's in it for you
  
  

An inspiring purpose - Enabling sustainable modern life. Minerals and metals are the backbone of essential functions in the modern world. However, there's a pressing need for more sustainable solutions to collect and process them. At Metso, you get to be part of transforming the industry and making a positive change.
  
Wellbeing and safety - Benefit from occupational healthcare, generous benefits plan, healthy living rewards, mental well-being services, on-site gym, bicycle benefits, and engagement surveys.
  
Compensation and rewards - Global incentive program tied to business and performance targets and meal benefits.
  
Hybrid working possibilities - While we are big advocates of meeting and collaborating in person, we believe in fostering a flexible work environment.
  
A thriving culture - We are committed to developing an inclusive culture that enables everyone to do their best and reach their full potential. A culture that is courageous, compelling, and caring, and unites our people to build a sustainable future together.
  
Extensive learning opportunities - Ongoing growth dialogues, internal mobility, mentoring programs, education assistance, ambitious projects, and global opportunities.
  
  

Get in touch
  
  

Want to rise above the possible with us? Click ‘Apply now’ to leave your application.
  
  

For additional information, please contact recruitment consultant Anna Edén at anna.eden@jeffersonwells.se
  
  

**Recruitment timeline:** 19th January 2025.
  
  

How to join - Working at Metso - About Metso - Diversity and Inclusion - Meet our people
  
  

Metso is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workforce culture. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, nationality, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, status as a protected veteran or status as a qualified individual with a disability.
  
  

Metso is a frontrunner in sustainable technologies, end-to-end solutions and services for the aggregates, minerals processing and metals refining industries globally. We improve our customers' energy and water efficiency, increase their productivity, and reduce environmental risks with our product and process expertise. We are the partner for positive change.
  
  

Headquartered in Espoo, Finland, Metso employs over 17,000 people in close to 50 countries and sales for 2023 were about EUR 5.4 billion. The company is listed on the Nasdaq Helsinki. metso.com, x.com/metsoofficial
company_description: Metso is a frontrunner in sustainable technologies, end-to-end solutions, and services for aggregates, minerals processing, and metals refining industries globally.

title: Volvo Penta Engineering Program 2025
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

 **Volvo Penta welcomes you to apply to our Engineering Program!**


Are you eager to learn and would like a fresh start to your career within Volvo Penta? Now is your opportunity to be part of our Engineering Program, where you will have the chance to work in a department while gaining a holistic understanding of engineering at Volvo Penta. We are preparing for the next generation of products and sustainable power solutions for the future. Connected, electrified, and automated solutions are making their way into our lives. Come join us and make it happen!

  

The Volvo Penta Engineering Program kicks off in September. Upon completing the 9-month program, you will receive permanent employment, giving you the chance to continue growing with us in your new role. We don’t see this as a short-term opportunity; we are looking for our future colleagues!

 **Role Description:**


We offer you, as a newly graduated engineer, an excellent opportunity to develop into one of our most attractive engineering positions. We strongly believe that high performance comes from having fun at work and having the courage to think outside the box. Doing the same thing we did yesterday will not make much of a difference; change is the key to success. We want to use your curiosity, dialogue, and teamwork to find new solutions. Our goal is to give you insight into working on different projects in a global company while providing you with the opportunity to create a valuable network as the start of your career.

  

You will join a 9-month program designed to give you engineering skills and a thorough knowledge of the company for future advancement. You will be assigned to a main area within an engineering department to work on, mixed with training and practice while collaborating with different departments within the company. These 9 months of training will be combined with educational and inspirational workshops and lectures to help you grow in your role, while socializing with colleagues not only in Gothenburg but also at our different plants in Sweden!

 **Who are you?**


We believe you are curious and eager to make an impact for the future. We want to hear your ideas and expect you to combine your recent theoretical knowledge with a hands-on attitude. If you are a creative problem solver who loves to develop, then you would probably love it here.

  

Below are the areas we are recruiting for and their qualifications. If you believe you qualify, do apply—we would love to hear from you.

  

* Driveline & Electromobility: We are seeking candidates with an MSc in disciplines such as, Electromobility, Mechatronics or Mechanical Engineering.
* Software & Electronics: We are seeking candidates with an MSc in disciplines such as Automation, Data Science, Data Engineer, Electronics and Mechatronics, or related fields.
* Testing and Laboratory: Development and calibration of sustainable powertrain solutions or within virtual propulsion development. These roles are ideal for M.Sc. in Electrical, System Controls, Automotive, Mechanical or Chemical Engineering.

  

Proficiency in written and spoken English is required.


Most importantly, there are two key qualities we are looking for: You are committed to leaving footprints for the future through innovative methods, and you believe in the power of teamwork and helping each other.

 **Welcome with your application! We look forward to having you help us create a better world!**

 **If you have any questions regarding the positions feel free to reach out to:**


Driveline & Electromobility: Fredrik Jägersvärd +46 739026022 and Magnus Ekström +46 739 027557


Software & Electronics: Andreas Nyman +46 739028543 and Anders Johansson +46 739025093


Testing and Laboratory: Simon Anwell +46 73 902 7272 and Fredrik Brodén +46 7390 28303

  

Last application date: February 9

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Volvo Penta**, a world-leading supplier of engines and complete drive systems for marine and industrial applications, you will be part of a global and diverse team of highly skilled professionals who works with passion, trust each other and embraces change to stay ahead. We make our customers win.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Software Test Engineer
description:
If you are a professional looking for an opportunity to grow and develop your abilities within a dynamic business, Emerson has an appealing role for you!


As a **Software Test Engineer** , you will be responsible for the planning and reporting results of product verification related to software execution of a web-based System Software platform, as well as maintaining applicable lab-rooms and equipment, test infrastructure and target systems.


If this sounds like an interesting job for you, we welcome your application!


**In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:**

* Create and maintain manual and automated test cases to verify product requirements.
* Create, review, maintain and execute automated test scripts.
* Contribute to test plan by identifying test scope, timelines, risk and mitigation plans for every product increment window.
* Coordinate test activities such as penetration tests and interoperability tests performed at external test partners.
* Collaborate with other product and scrum teams to connect various components and perform system level tests on the platform.

**Who You Are:**

You create teamwork allowing others across the organization to achieve shared objectives. You persist in accomplishing objectives despite obstacles and setbacks. You uncover root causes to difficult problems. You scan the environment for new technical skills, knowledge, or capabilities that can benefit business or personal performance.


**For This Role, You Will Need:**

* Technical education at Master or Bachelor level.
* At least 5 years of relevant experience as a Software Test Engineer in an Agile team.
* Good knowledge in Test automation using Selenium with C#/Java.
* Understanding of communication protocols such as OPC UA, HART, Modbus.
* English language proficiency (read/written/spoken).

**Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:**

* Swedish language proficiency.
* Experience working in a matrix organization.

**Our Offer to You:**

At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspire innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers. We’re emphasizing a culture of togetherness – one that builds community, prioritizes collaboration and continuous improvement.


The philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion at Emerson .


Moreover, our global volunteer employee resource groups will empower you to connect with peers that share the same interest, promote diversity and inclusion and positively contribute to communities around us.


We understand the importance of work-life balance and are dedicated to supporting our employees' personal and professional needs. From competitive benefits plans and comprehensive medical care to equitable opportunities for growth and development we strive to create a workplace that is supportive and rewarding. Our work schedule aims at creating new levels of growth, build a stronger community and provide greater professional development for our employees.


Make this great opportunity yours!


**For additional information, please reach out to:** bala.pattabiraman@emerson.com


**No calls or agencies please.**


  
**WHY EMERSON**

**Our Commitment to Our People**

**At Emerson, we are motivated by a spirit of collaboration that helps our diverse, multicultural teams across the world drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. And we want you to join us in our bold aspiration.**

**We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world’s most complex problems — for our customers, our communities, and the planet. You’ll contribute to this vital work while further developing your skills through our award-winning employee development programs. We are a proud corporate citizen in every city where we operate and are committed to our people, our communities, and the world at large. We take this responsibility seriously and strive to make a positive impact through every endeavor.**

**At Emerson, you’ll see firsthand that our people are at the center of everything we do. So, let’s go. Let’s think differently. Learn, collaborate, and grow. Seek opportunity. Push boundaries. Be empowered to make things better. Speed up to break through. Let’s go, together.**

**Accessibility Assistance or Accommodation**

**If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact:** **idisability.administrator@emerson.com** **.**

**ABOUT EMERSON**

**Emerson is a global leader in automation technology and software. Through our deep domain expertise and legacy of flawless execution, Emerson helps customers in critical industries like life sciences, energy, power and renewables, chemical and advanced factory automation operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability.**

**With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety.**

**We offer equitable opportunities, celebrate diversity, and embrace challenges with confidence that, together, we can make an impact across a broad spectrum of countries and industries. Whether you’re an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or a recent graduate with an advanced degree, you’ll find your chance to make a difference with Emerson. Join our team – let’s go!**

**No calls or agencies please.**

title: Senior Software Development Engineer
description:
Are you a current Elekta employee?
Please apply through our internal career site Find Jobs - Elekta.
Want to join a team with a mission to improve and save lives?
We continually look for motivated and skilled individuals who are interested in supporting our customers – healthcare professionals who use our products to help patients and their communities.
We currently have the following opportunity available - please contact us for more details!
What you’ll do at Elekta
At Elekta, we don’t just build technology. We build hope for everyone dealing with cancer. As Senior Software Development Engineer, you will be designing and implementing the user workflows for our radiation therapy products and contribute to the innovation of tomorrow’s radiotherapy solutions. You will write code on both the frontend and the backend.
You will be part of a cross-functional software development team that works together on requirements, design, implementation, testing, and documentation.
Your team is part of an international program that consists of a diverse group of specialists in mechanical engineering, electronics, physics, embedded software, and more.
Responsibilities
In addition to the above, the Senior Software Development Engineer will also take on responsibilities such as:* Participating in all activities in software engineering, with emphasis on requirements specification, design, implementation, testing, and associated documentation whilst following company standards
* Perform evaluations of technologies, methodologies, and products
* Follow the technical and clinical evolution within the field
* Understand and adhere to the Elekta quality system and introduce improvements to its effectiveness.


What you bring
We are looking for a creative, and smart new colleague, who works best in teams. You have a can-do attitude and a problem-solving mindset. The team works with software solutions that guide the users through the radiotherapy treatment workflow. They are enthusiastic about writing efficient code with great user experience - we think you are too. In addition, we believe you have a:* Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, physics, electronics or similar.
* Worked with frontend development using Angular and Typescript.
* Worked with backend development in C# .NET.
* Experience of working in MedTech or some other regulated industry.
* Experience with Docker and Kubernetes.


Why should you join Elekta?
In this role, you will work for a higher purpose; hope for everyone dealing with cancer, and for everyone regardless of where in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. In addition to this, our benefit package includes:* 30 paid vacation days/year, additional 4 Elekta days off /year (plus bank holidays).
* Ability to purchase additional vacation days .
* Attractive defined contribution pension scheme.
* Private Medical Insurance.
* Lunch Benefit.
* Contribution to wellness activities.
* Hybrid work option (you are required to work on location at least 3 days/week).


Hiring Process  

  

We are looking forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and resumé in English, via the “Apply” button. Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail. Last day for applying is January 10, 2025.
For questions, please contact the responsible TA Partner Oscar at Oscar.persson@elekta.com.  

We are an equal opportunity employer
We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where Elekta operates.

title: Test Facility Engineer at Volvo Cars
description:
**Can you engineer a brighter tomorrow?**
-----------------------------------------

  

  

It’s crystal clear: the actions we take in the next few years will significantly impact our future. At Volvo Cars, we embrace change. We’re committed to transforming the automotive industry and leading in electrification. For this, we’re seeking out more creative minds to shape that future. Don’t miss this opportunity to create your tomorrow.

  


**Let's introduce ourselves**
-----------------------------



Propulsion & Climate Labs is Volvo Cars’ Centre for testing of propulsion systems, in complete vehicle as well as in component form. We operate and develop propulsion test facilities for vehicles, drivelines, electric motors, inverters, batteries, transmissions, as well as aerodynamic and climatic testing. Our work includes hardware- and software preparation of testing, test execution and processing of measurement data. We also develop and build new test facilities  

To meet the future, we need to invest in state-of-the-art test environments and continuously develop our test methods to ensure that we test and verify next generation cars in an efficient and correct manner. Do you want to contribute to making our test environment the best in the business? Then the role as Test Facility Engineer at TEM (Transmission Electric Machine) test is for you!  



**What you'll do**
------------------



You will be responsible for the systemization of the complete test environment for both HW and SW testing in Powertrain Lab. You will work with method development, develop the lab for future needs and leading concept work during early phases. Together with the Powertrain Labs teams and the developing organizations understand the requirement of the testbeds, both when it comes to data collection, accuracy needed for different test methods, capability, and legal requirement of today and for the future. Your target will be to make sure we build the right environment with the right capabilities to fulfill verification needs. You will also need to consider extending capabilities of existing test environments and how to fit new environments into an existing software infrastructure.


**What you'll bring**
---------------------


**Qualification:**


* We see that you have a M.Sc. or B.Sc in Mechanical Engineering, or another related field.
* You have experience within validation and verification methods and knowledge in Physical Measurement techniques in electric machine.
* You are familiar with Test Automation system - both HW and SW is meritorious.
* Experience from building up lab environment would be highly valued.
* Experience from Automotive.


**Who you are:**


* You are comfortable making your own decisions and appreciate the freedom to take required actions on own initiative.
* You have a good portion of high-level thinking as well as hands-on attitude.
* You are a great communicator who easily build new relationships, persistent enough to get the answers you need in order to succeed.
* You never forget about the long-term goal, but are able to think outside-of-the-box to get there.



**Ready to Take the Next Step?**
---------------------------------

  

  

Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English. Please keep in mind that we recruit continuously and therefore encourage you to apply as soon as possible.


If you have any questions about the recruitment process, you are welcome to reach out to Recruiter Sanghamitra Deb at sanghamitra.deb@volvocars.com. For specific questions about the position, please reach out to Hiring Manager Jeanette Gillser at jeanette.gillser@volvocars.com.

  

  

Once your application is successfully submitted, you’ll receive a confirmation email. Applications are open until 16th of January 2025. We’re excited to get to know you!

  



**Volvo Cars – driving change together**
-----------------------------------------

  

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.


And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Tacton CPQ Engineer
description:
**Bring more to life.**


Are you ready to accelerate your potential and make a real difference within life sciences, diagnostics and biotechnology?


At Cytiva, one of Danaher’s 15+ operating companies, our work saves lives—and we’re all united by a shared commitment to innovate for tangible impact.


You’ll thrive in a culture of belonging where you and your unique viewpoint matter. And by harnessing Danaher’s system of continuous improvement, you help turn ideas into impact – innovating at the speed of life.


Working at Cytiva means being at the forefront of providing new solutions to transform human health. Our incredible customers undertake life-saving activities ranging from fundamental biological research to developing innovative vaccines, new medicines, and cell and gene therapies.


At Cytiva you will be able to continuously improve yourself and us – working on challenges that truly matter with people that care for each other, our customers, and their patients. Take your next step to an altogether life-changing career.


Learn about the Danaher Business System which makes everything possible.


The **Tacton CPQ Engineer** is responsible for supporting master data analysis, Tacton CPQ testing as well as end user training while getting opportunity to develop into a technical Tacton CPQ Expert or Process Owner over time. This position reports to the Sr. Manager Sales Configurator and is part of the QARA PLM Configurator team located in Uppsala and will be an on-site role.

**What you will do:**

* Creation of training material, end user support FAQ’s, ownership and continuous update of the Tacton CPQ SharePoint information site.
* Support the execution of Tacton CPQ testing framework, processes, scripts and test automation tools.
* Support New Product Implementation (NPI) projects with master data review, acting as the bridge to the Configurator Architects in collaboration with R&D, Product Management, Global Supply Chain and Service.
* Support the Tacton CPQ demand management & prioritization process.
* Over time you will assume ownership of one of a process or technical domain within Tacton CPQ. As the domain owner you are accountable for solution design & maintenance of processes and/or technical content within the domain.

**Who you are:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Bioinformatics, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent.
* Previous experience working with ERP and/or PLM software in an Engineering, Logistics or Manufacturing oriented environment.
* Proven ability to work with cross-functional, multi-cultural teams and to deliver results in an ambiguous and dynamic environment.
* Track record of delivering continuous improvements of processes in a transactional environment.
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both written and verbal.
* Ability to travel domestically and internationally up to 10%

**It would be a plus if you also have:**

* Functional understanding of Oracle EBS Warehouse, Inventory, Planning or Manufacturing modules.


Interview and selection will happen continuously, and the opening can be filled before last day of application. For questions regarding the role please contact hiring manager Gustav Mena, *Sr. Manager Sales Configurator*, at gustav.mena@cytiva.com.


#LI-HJ2


Join our winning team today. Together, we’ll accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life.


For more information, visit www.danaher.com.


At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.
company_description: Cytiva is a global provider of technologies and services that advance and accelerate the development and manufacture of therapeutics, addressing urgent needs and helping save patient lives.

title: Maps Services Lead Engineer
description:
**Summary**  

  

Posted: Dec 19, 2024
  

  

Weekly Hours: **37.5**
  

  

Role Number:**200583487**  

  

Are you a self-starter looking for an exciting career opportunity? Do you like to ship software solutions that impact Apple Maps users around the world? Are you passionate about leading complex software engineering work? A job at Apple is unlike any other you’ve had. You’ll be challenged, inspired, and you will be proud of your work. Maps are a significant part of our everyday lives. Whether you are selecting a fine restaurant for dinner with friends, finding public transit that gets you to the big game before kickoff, or looking for the nearest gas station, you are relying on services provided by the Maps Services Team. The Apple Maps Services team develop cutting-edge guidance products to constantly improve the navigation experience and help hundreds of millions of people every day with their driving, walking and public transit needs. The team is also responsible for generating the vector maps that powers the beautiful map display in Apple Maps. We are looking for a skilled lead software engineer, with a passion to take ownership of problems and deliverables, lead software engineering work, and to organise skilled engineers to deliver the next generation of display and navigation services for Apple Maps.
  

  

**Description**  

  

- Lead and drive the work of a team of remarkably skilled software engineers. - Be a strong advocate for the customer experience. - Take ownership of solving problems and deliver solutions on time. -Communicate and coordinate with teams and stakeholders in the US. - Participating in design and code reviews. - Influencing the future product direction.
  

  

**Minimum Qualifications**  

* Ability to take ownership, identify requirements, prioritise and make progress in an environment with limited given input.
* Very strong in leading others, and hands-on, in programming, system design and problem solving.
* Extensive, professional experience from software engineering.
* Fluent communication in English with a sense for listening to others as well as getting you message through in a crisp way.
* Experience in cross team collaboration and communication across multiple timezones.

  

**Preferred Qualifications**  

* Strong understanding of common data structures and basic graph algorithms.
* Mindset of writing efficient code, but also that the most "optimal solution" is often the least efficient if it doesn’t really matter.
* Experience from Scala, Python, Kotlin, and C++.
* Knowledge in Spark, Iceberg och spatial algoritms/problems.
* Experience from working in distributed engineering teams.
* Knowledge from the maps (GIS) domain, related to for instance routing, navigation, traffic or display maps.
* Experience from the ML domain.

title: OFCI Package Lead
description:
Winthrop Technologies is a dedicated data centre delivery partner providing turnkey solutions to our clients, headquartered in Dublin and delivering throughout Europe.


Winthrop specialises in providing turnkey data centre solutions, providing services from design, through to construction across the full range of civil, structural, architectural, mechanical and electrical services as well as commissioning.


Winthrop has grown to become the leading and most trusted company in our sector and is the only dedicated Data Centre delivery partner in Europe.


We are currently constructing multiple turnkey data centre projects in 7 different European countries, equating to over 430 MW of IT load in flight.


We are pleased to announce we are recruiting for an **OFCI Package Lead** to join our expanding team in Sandviken, Sweden.


**Requirements**

* Confident technical and process lead comfortable in being the key interface with client appointed vendors and in discussing/escalating OFCI items with the Client and other relevant stakeholders to support project delivery.
* Manage the OFCI team to ensure that Works are engineered, planned and installed in accordance with project requirements.
* Support engineering, programme and commissioning requirements through managing & liaising with Key Project Stakeholders
* Ensure all Vendors equipment is coordinated with the construction requirements and project programme.
* Lead weekly meetings with the client, OFCI Vendors and other relevant Stakeholders
* Report on OFCI packages progress.
* Escalate issues & risks for mitigation.
* Mitigates contract disputes and provides oversight, guidance, and technical expertise.
* Ensure client security and confidentiality is maintained at all times

**Skills / Requirements:**

* 7+ years experience working with an M&E Contractor
* Qualified Electrical Engineer
* Excellent negotiation, problem solving, leadership and decision making skills
* Proficient in the use of systems software related to Engineering functions
* Experience working on large scale projects is essential

***Winthrop Technologies Ltd. are an equal opportunities employer***

title: System Analysis Engineer within ML
description:
Job Description:


We are a dedicated engineering team working to ensure that Arm delivers performant and functional ML software and hardware solutions and enables our partners to build competitive products. Using detailed analysis and rigorous characterisation, we identify, distill and explain data to Arm engineering, marketing, and external partners.


The team covers a wide range of software and hardware levels, application domains, workloads and types of analysis to get a full and accurate picture of ML performance capabilities, limitations and improvement opportunities.


We are growing, and we are offering several opportunities for this team.


Responsibilities:


As an ML System Analysis engineer you will develop test infrastructure for our fully automated test flow, including functional and performance testing, as well as visualisation and report generation of the results. Through teamwork, you will explore, analyse and influence the direction of Machine Learning performance on future Arm IP and systems. Analyzing Machine Learning use-cases and workloads to make Machine Learning run optimally on Arm technology.


We collaborate closely with other specialists across Arm, including software, IP, and Systems teams to understand, explore and challenge the limits of performance capabilities.


We use advanced pre-silicon platforms of next-generation systems, to understand new use-cases and significant workloads to ensure Arm technology delivers excellent ML performance and quality.


Required Skills and Experience :

* A bachelor or master degree in engineering or equivalent. Documented programming courses. Good python knowledge is essential.
* You have a passion for analysis and improvements.
* A high level of pro-activity, initiative and problem solving skills. as well as willingness to take on varied technical challenges.
* You have strong communication skills, inter-cultural awareness and you embrace diversity.


“Nice To Have” Skills and Experience :


If you know your way around pre-silicon platforms, building test infrastructure, low level debugging, or some familiarity with data analysis that would be great too!


In Return:


At Arm, you will enjoy working in a highly stimulating collaborative environment. Our team works closely with other software, hardware and system teams across the company.


You will have a chance to share ideas with and learn new skills from the best engineers in the world. We work in small teams, so your contributions will really make a difference.


#LI-MZ1

At Arm, we want our people to Do Great Things. If you need support or an accommodation to Be Your Brilliant Self during the recruitment process, please email accommodations@arm.com. To note, by sending us the requested information, you consent to its use by Arm to arrange for appropriate accommodations. All accommodation requests will be treated with confidentiality, and information concerning these requests will only be disclosed as necessary to provide the accommodation. Although this is not an exhaustive list, examples of support include breaks between interviews, having documents read aloud or office accessibility. Please email us about anything we can do to accommodate you during the recruitment process.


Hybrid Working at Arm


Arm’s approach to hybrid working is designed to create a working environment that supports both high performance and personal wellbeing. We believe in bringing people together face to face to enable us to work at pace, whilst recognizing the value of flexibility. Within that framework, we empower groups/teams to determine their own hybrid working patterns, depending on the work and the team’s needs. Details of what this means for each role will be shared upon application. In some cases, the flexibility we can offer is limited by local legal, regulatory, tax, or other considerations, and where this is the case, we will collaborate with you to find the best solution. Please talk to us to find out more about what this could look like for you.


Equal Opportunities at Arm


Arm is an equal opportunity employer, committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal opportunities are available to all applicants and colleagues. We are a diverse organization of dedicated and innovative individuals, and don’t discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

title: Experienced SW Engineer in ML
description:
Job Overview:


We have a fantastic opportunity to move into Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence; key technologies for the future of computing. Arm is everywhere technology matters. We are offering several positions within different teams within SW. Are you thrilled by this? Then we should talk!


We need hardworking and motivated people to join our team. Working with the world’s best companies as they build sector-leading products from our designs. You’ll share ideas with and learn new skills from the best engineers in the world. We work in small teams, so your contributions will make a difference. This role offers the opportunity to lead, challenge the status quo and ultimately change the world of ML and AI!


Responsibilities:


You will work/develop/design/architect new features and evaluate their performance. The features are mainly in the field of ML compiler and framework development, kernel/user space driver development, real time embedded software development, test automation. As an experienced engineer you are expected to be able to take lead on larger work-packages and to mentor more junior engineers. You will also be working closely with the ML HW team to achieve optimal system partitioning.


We are looking for you who has strong analytical skills, has an eagerness to find innovative solutions to sophisticated problems, and are comfortable working in a fast paced and dynamic environment. You have excellent interpersonal skills cooperating closely in diverse teams, striving together to fulfil common targets.


Required Skills and Experience :

* Development experience on multi-team projects with milestones and dependencies
* Strong programming skills (C, C++, Python).
* Source control skills (Git, Gerrit, Repo)
* Worked and developed using methods like agile SW development, continuous integration and Test driven development.


“Nice To Have” Skills and Experience :

* Experience with Machine Learning applications and frameworks
* Experience in compiler development
* Open Source software development
* Awareness of hardware architecture principles


In Return:


All Arm employees are provided with vital training to succeed in their respective roles. As well as a friendly and high-performance working environment, Arm offers a competitive benefits package in Sweden including private medical insurance, 30 days of annual leave, sabbatical, supplementary pension, wellness benefits.


You will be working with a bunch of enthusiastic and brilliant colleagues. We are proud to have a set of behaviours that reflect our DEI (Diversity, Equity & Inclusion) culture and guide our decisions, defining how we work together to shape extraordinary!
