title: Development Engineer Test and Performance, R&D Asia
description:
Scania has decided to establish a third industrial hub in China with the capacity to produce some 50,000 vehicles per year. Alongside building a new factory and an expansion of the sales network we will also establish a local R&D organisation in China. Our mission in R&D Asia is to develop trucks specially adapted for the Chinese market, the biggest commercial vehicle market in the world.
   

  

 Are you ready for the greatest adventure of your life? Then come and write Scania history together with us at Powertrain Development R&D Asia as a Development Engineer within Test & Performance!
   

  

**Your Work Tasks**
 A dedicated organisation will carry out the work, developing and managing the products over time. We work mainly in the early stages and with concept development. The organisation will consist of colleagues from all brands within the TRATON Group together with many new colleagues from China. We are building the organisation simultaneously as we develop the product. We are now looking for an additional development engineer to help us develop the powertrain systems, engine performance, and emerging fuels.
   

  

 The main work tasks will be working close to the vehicle with preparing the truck, test drive, analysing the performance, suggesting solutions/improvements, and presenting results to the organisation. The starting point for the powertrain is the Scania combustion engine, exhaust treatment system, and gearbox. However, to be successful in the Chinese market we have to adapt the premium powertrain to meet the challenging product cost target in the B+ segment.
   

  

**Your Profile**
 You have an extensive background in automotive and powertrain development, preferably with experience from Scania. Most likely you have worked with testing, calibration, and performance for powertrain, or in similar areas. You are hands-on and enjoy solving problems during the testing of trucks. You are structured and thorough in your work and can lead projects, create test reports, and present to the organisation. We believe you have a passion for technology and understand cause-and-effect relationships in a technical system. This position is great for you who dare to challenge the current technology to find more cost-efficient solutions.
   

  

**Education**
 We believe you have a master's degree in engineering, or other higher education, and have experience in the automotive industry for at least 5 years. You are highly proficient in both spoken and written English (English Level C1 - CEFR) and can work with Microsoft Office suite, Matlab, INCA, or similar. CE driver's license is a demand for the position and experience with testing software is a merit.
   

  

**More Information**
 Please contact Andreas Tjärning, Group manager Pre-development Powertrain, email: andreas.tjarning@scania.com
   

  

 During the Christmas holiday season, you can expect delays in the replies. We hope for your understanding.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and copies of grades or diploma. Scania uses tests in the recruitment process. A background check may be conducted for this position. Selection and interviews will start after the application period, in week 3 in January 2025. Apply via scania.com/career as soon as possible, but no later than January 12, 2025.
   

  

**Please note:** 
 If you already are a Scania employee, you log in and apply via MySuccess/Careers.
   

  

 Scania is a world-leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. In 2022, we delivered 80,238 trucks, 4,994 buses as well as 13,400 industrial and marine power systems to our customers. Net sales totalled to over SEK 170 billion, of which 21 percent were services related. Founded in 1891, Scania now operates in more than 100 countries and employs some 57,000 people. Research and development are mainly concentrated in Sweden. Production takes place in Europe and Latin America with regional product centres in Africa, Asia and Eurasia. Scania is part of TRATON GROUP. For more information visit: www.scania.com

title: System Verification Engineer Getinge Critical Care
company_industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
**With a passion for life**
 Join our diverse teams of passionate people and a career that allows you to develop both personally and professionally. At Getinge we exist to make life-saving technology accessible for more people. To make a true difference for our customers – and to save more lives, we need team players, forward thinkers, and game changers.
   

  

 Are you looking for an inspiring career? You just found it.
   

  

 Join Getinge and strengthen our Product Area of Critical Care in Solna as a System Verification Engineer. At Getinge in Solna we have the full cycle development and manufacturing of products for Intensive Care Units within Anesthesia and Ventilation. We invite you to be a part of our exceptional team of test and verification engineers within our R&D organisation.
   

  

 As a verification engineer at Getinge, you will tackle complex interdisciplinary challenges, collaborating with highly skilled colleagues to find innovative solutions. You will contribute to the development of world-leading products in intensive care.
   

  

**Position Overview**
 Your primary responsibility will be to analyze requirements, design test specifications and run tests to ensure the quality of the embedded systems of our products. You will write automated test scripts and take part in developing test tools, validating and ensuring that there is traceability. You will also run exploratory tests on our system. In this role, you will get an excellent overview of how all parts and systems in the machines work connected with knowledge of how the products are used, which gives us a great opportunity to support the rest of the department with development work and problem-solving.
   

  

**To excel in this role, you should possess the following qualities:**
* Master of Science in Engineering or equivalent.
* 1-3 years of experience within test and verification
* Perform exploratory testing to challenge the product and find defects.
* Comfortable making critical technical decisions, thriving in high-expectation environments.
* Having knowledge of Linux
* C++/Python/Squinch knowledge
* An interest in CI/CD
* Interest in advanced healthcare and our products in intensive care and anesthesiology.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience in a testing environment with embedded systems.
* Effective collaboration within cross-functional teams.
* Thrive on working with safety-critical systems in advanced healthcare, where functionality and reliability are vital.
* Proactive in learning and contributing to the testing environment and continued development of our products, staying ahead of fierce global competition.
* Excellent command of English and Swedish both written and spoken.


**Personal Characteristics**
 In addition to technical skills, the following personal attributes will contribute to your success:
   

  

* Analytical and systematic problem-solving approach, capable of handling intricate challenges and breaking down tasks effectively.
* Ambition for growth, embracing challenging and stimulating tasks.
* Strong documentation skills, ensuring comprehensive project understanding and efficient collaboration.


 Become part of Getinge's revolution in healthcare technology. Apply now to embark on a rewarding journey with us.
   

  

**Why work for us**
 Getinge offers a job in a safe and informal work environment, where we appreciate close team collaboration. We keep an open dialogue between leaders and employees, as well as between teams. We are focused on developing people, and together we will create a plan for learning and competence development when you start your career with us.
   

  

 We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, including wellness allowances, generous family benefits and joint company activities. Everything to ensure we support your well-being and goals.
   

  

**Application**
 Applications will be reviewed continually, and we recommend sending us your application as soon as possible. For question about the position, pls contact Hiring Manager Pia Skogsberg: pia.skogsberg@getinge.com or Talent Acquisition Manager Emma Paulsson: emma.paulsson@getinge.com
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application. We hope you will join us on our journey to become the world’s most desired medtech company.
   

  

**About Us**
 With a firm belief that every person and community should have access to the best possible care, Getinge provides hospitals and life science institutions with products and solutions aiming to improve clinical results and optimize workflows. The offering includes products and solutions for intensive care, cardiovascular procedures, operating rooms, sterile reprocessing and life science. Getinge employs over 12,000 people worldwide and the products are sold in more than 135 countries.
   

  

 Reasonable accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Forskningsingenjör
description:
**Vill du bidra till medicinsk forskning av toppkvalitet?**
 Vi söker en forskningsingenjör som kan hjälpa till i vår forskning inom kardiovaskulär diagnostik och fysiologi vid Klinisk Fysiologi, Institutionen för Molekulär Medicin och Kirurgi. Anställningen är en tillsvidareanställning på 25 %.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Forskargruppens utvecklar nya sätt att diagnosticera hjärt-kärlsjukdom med magnetkamerateknik och ultraljud och använder dessa metoder för att fördjupa förståelsen om dessa sjukdomars patofysiologi. Dessutom deltar gruppen i flera kliniska prövningar som använder magnetkamerateknik och ultraljud. Forskningen är nära kopplad till Klinisk Fysiologi på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset och leds av Prof. Marcus Carlsson.
   

  

 Som forskningsingenjör kommer du att ansvara för databasutveckling i Filemaker och att extrahera resultat från undersökningar utförda på forskningspersoner. Arbetet inkluderar nära samarbete med systemförvaltare inom Region Stockholm för RIS-PACS och ultraljudssystemen (Philips och GE). Arbetsuppgifterna är att utveckla lösningar för sökning och överföring av bilddata som används för forskning inkluderande pseudonymisering. Dessutom ingår utvecklande av en existerande databas skapad i Filemaker för undersökningsresultat.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Behörig att anställas som forskningsingenjör är den som har civilingenjörsexamen och dokumenterad erfarenhet av Filemaker samt erfarenhet och god kännedom om de PACS och RIS lösningar (Sectra) som används på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset.
   

  

 Du har mycket goda kunskaper i muntlig och skriftlig svenska.
   

  

 Meriterande är om du har erfarenhet av GE:s och Philips system för lagring och visning av ultraljudsbilder.
   

  

 Som person har du god kommunikations- samt organisationsförmåga. Du kan arbeta självständigt och i team, du är noggrann och ansvarsfull.
   

  

**Vad erbjuder vi?**
 En kreativ, internationell och inspirerande miljö fylld av kompetens och nyfikenhet. Karolinska Institutet är ett av världens ledande medicinska universitet. Vår vision är att driva utvecklingen av kunskap om livet och verka för en bättre hälsa för alla. Här bedriver vi framgångsrik medicinsk forskning och har det största utbudet av medicinska utbildningar i Sverige. Som universitet är Karolinska Institutet en statlig myndighet. Det gör att du får goda förmåner genom vårt kollektivavtal. Medarbetare på KI erbjuds också möjlighet till ett flexibelt arbetssätt. Det innebär att om den verksamhet du jobbar i tillåter, så kan du arbeta en del av din arbetstid på distans. Du får även träna fritt i våra moderna friskvårdsanläggningar där utbildad personal finns på plats.
   

  

**Placering:** 
 Solna
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan senast den 3 januari 2025.
   

  

 Ansökan ska göras via rekryteringssystemet Varbi. I denna rekrytering söker du med ditt CV utan personligt brev. I ansökningsformuläret kommer du istället att få svara på några frågor om varför du söker jobbet.
   

  

**Vill du göra skillnad – och bidra till en bättre hälsa för alla? Sök jobb hos oss**
 Anställningsform: särskild visstidsanställning | Anställningens omfattning: deltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 25 % | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: STÖD 2-5234/2024 | Kontakt: Marcus Carlsson, Professor/Överläkare marcus.carlsson@ki.se, | Facklig företrädare: Virpi Töhönen, SACO virpi.tohonen@ki.se, Taher Darreh-Shori, SACO taher.darreh-shori@ki.se, Elisabeth Noren-Krog, OFR elisabeth.noren-krog@ki.se, | Publicerat: 2024-12-20 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-01-03

title: QA Test Lead
job_function: Quality Assurance, Design, and Information Technology
description:
Nasdaq is expanding the Clearing team in Stockholm to bring in a new QA Engineer Test Lead, focusing on expanding automation test coverage and Tool Development. You will be part of a team responsible for delivering a highly sophisticated Clearing system to major customers around the world. It is an advanced system with very high demands on quality and performance and it is built with leading edge Java technology and tools.
   

  

 Role and responsibilities will include API interface testing, analyzing results from batch tests and identifying issues and creating JIRA tickets. In addition, you will be working with multiple stakeholders and across teams to identifying areas to expand test coverage. Furthermore, you will maintain and improve auto test frameworks and tools.
   

  

**We are looking for someone with:**
* University degree in computer science, information technology, software development or equivalent practical experience
* Experience with Java SE, API and Swagger, TestNG
* Experience working with GIT
* Experience working with Linux, Kafka, and databases
* Experience working with Gradle, CICD pipelines
* Effective communication in English as the role will require ability to liaise with development/business teams and clients


**It would be great, but not mandatory, if you also have:**
* Work experience of Gitlab, Jenkins or similar
* Experience working with financial systems especially clearing/risk systems
* Work experience with JavaScript, Python, React, Playwright
* Knowledge of Cloud based solutions including Docker and AWS


**With this position we offer:**
 The opportunity to work in agile scrum teams. You will play a critical role to uplift the quality and speed of our deliveries by extending our test automation coverage and improve our build pipeline from a QA perspective in addition to work with Technical Testing, Test approaches and Tools. This is a position where you can be creative and make design decisions with ownership and responsibility over creating more efficient ways of testing.
   

  

*We also offer;*
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.
* Competitive salary and benefits package including monetary bonus and equity.
* 32 vacationdays, 6 additional flexdays.
* Employee Stock Purchase Program Nasdaq stocks with a discount
* Pension plan
* Fitness allowance
* Flexible health Insurance program
* Exciting projects and the chance to make a significant impact on our business.


**Does this sound like you?**
 This role is located in Stockholm. Nasdaq’s Stockholm office is located in the harbor area of Frihamnen, we have a private commuter shuttle running in the morning and evening hours between the office and the Karlaplan metro-stop. Our office offers free parking, secure bike storage and bike/e-bike lending. The office also features a gym and recreational sports room, as well as a restaurant and snack shop. In the end of 2025, we are moving to a new modern office space in the city center (Mäster Samuelsgatan).
   

  

 Please submit your application no later than January 10th, and our recruiting team will reach out after that. We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

**Come as You Are**
**Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.**
**We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.**

title: PLM Application Engineer
description:
**This is Us** 




**For 40 years Sigicom has developed instruments for the professional measurement industry. Figuratively speaking, our expertise in measurement, industrial operations and microprocessors, is built into all of our systems. Computer technology is used to process, transmit, collate, and present data in a way that relieves the mundane, time-consuming tasks from a human operator. We have experience in complex product development targeted towards demanding and difficult applications, as well as more cost-sensitive applications. It gives us a good starting point for utilizing clever combinations of existing and new technology for new and existing applications.** 




  





 We have grown to be an industry leader in the development of environmental measurement systems, while at the same time maintaining a great atmosphere and close collaboration with our customers.
 



  





**The Role** 




  





**As our PLM Application Engineer, you are part of the Development team of around 25 engineers. The team consists of expertise within SW, HW, FW, mechanical, automation and test.** 




  





 The PLM team is a group within Development, and this is the team you will belong to. The team comprises of in-depth experience and expertise of Sigicom products and solutions for maintenance of the products throughout the life cycle, i.e. production, service and calibration, invoicing etc. We are now looking to add competencies to this group, primarily regarding .Net/C# PC applications.
 



  





 Key areas of responsibilities:
 


* Design, develop, and maintain applications using .Net/C# in Visual Studio.
* Design, develop, and maintain databases for the PLM system.
* Troubleshoot and optimize existing applications for scalability and performance.
* Participate in code reviews and contribute to continuous improvement in our development processes.
* Support and maintain processes and routines regarding production and calibration.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams (production, software and hardware teams etc.).



  





**The Profile:** 



* Strong experience in development of .Net/C#/WinForms PC applications.
* Solid understanding of SQL/Postgres databases.
* A collaborative mindset, pragmatic and solution oriented.
* Strong command in both Swedish and English.
* Setting up and troubleshooting Windows PCs.
* Calibration specifications.
* Industrial automation



  





**What We Offer:** 



* A chance to work on cutting-edge technology in a growing industry.
* A collaborative and supportive work environment with flexible work options.
* Opportunities for professional development and growth.
